San K., 42, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. sells soft drinks, earning an income of about $7 per day. 

Her husband produces traditional musical instruments to sell, earning an income of about $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $74 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more materials for her husband to make traditional musical instruments. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband to make musical instruments

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Madame Akouavi est âgée de 58ans elle réside à Attiégou. Elle est veuve et à 03 enfants en charge. Elle a démarré l’activité il ya 6ans et est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes et de céréales.  Madame Akouavi s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodesséwa.  Bien qu’elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants elle reste dynamique, courageuse et elle désire solliciter ce premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes et des céréales afin de mieux vendre pour  réaliser de profit et voir ses derniers grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouavi is 58 years old and lives in Attiegou. She is a widow with three dependent children. She started her business six years ago, and specializes in the sale of African dresses and cereals. Mrs. Akouavi gets her supplies inside the country and in Lome, and retails on the market of Akodessewa. Even though she takes care of her children by herself, she remains energetic and resolute. She wants to request this first loan to purchase African dresses and cereals in order to sell more, make a profit, and be able to see her younger children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: To purchases African dresses and cereals

loans.name: Gladys Marcelina

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, con grado de educación superior.  Es soltera  y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. 
La señora se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes y trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace cinco años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería al por mayor para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, leches, etc.
También nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carros, es un negocio que lo realiza esporádicamente (alterno).  Ella trabaja sola.
Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande y bien abastecida para generar más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) community bank which is located in Puno district and department.  She is 36 years old and completed her higher education.  She is single and has two school-age children.

Gladys sells groceries.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money for her grocery business.

Gladys will use this new loan for 1,300 soles to buy merchandise wholesale for her store.  She will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.  She tells us that she also sells cars.  It is a business that she carries out sporadically.  She works on her own.

Gladys' dream is to own a much bigger store which is well stocked so that she can make more income.  What Gladys likes about her community bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. for her store (wholesale)

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es una madre D. familia D. 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 2 hijas en el caserío Viviano Espinoza que se encuentra a 15 minutos del distrito Las Lomas y a una hora D. distancia del departamneto D. Piura, tiene casa propia, pero no cuenta con los servicios básicos.  Esta zona  se caracteriza por tener una mucha actividad agricola, ganadera, artesanía y turismo .

Hermelinda ha acondicionado la sala D. su casa para poner un pequeña tienda para vender productos D. belleza y ropa, ésta actividad lo realiza desD. hace unos 10 años, tiene su propia clientela que le hace pedidos.  Estos productos es para que las personas D. todas las edades mejoren su imagen personal,  con estos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijas  junto con su esposo.

A solicitado Hermelinda a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1600 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio con mercadería novedosa tanto en productos D. belleza como ropa, ya que en ese caserío son pocas las personas  que se dedican a este rubro, lo que le permite tener exito en su negocio y cada vez cresca más. Con los ingresos D. la venta D. todos sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado y mejoraría la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

Hermelinda es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a su familia (esposo e hijos).
texts.en:
Hermelida is a 46 year old mother living with her husband and two daughters in Viviano Espinoza located 15 minutes from the Las Lomas District and an hour away from Piura Department.  She owns her house but it lacks basic utilities.  This zone is noted for having much framing, livestock raising, crafts and tourism activities.

Hermelinda has turned her living room into a small store to sell beauty products and clothes.  She’s been doing this for the last 10 years.  She has her own clientele that places orders.  These products are so that people of all ages can improve their personal appearance.  Income helps her and her husband support their daughters.

Hermelinda has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan to stock her business with novel merchandise both in beauty products and clothes because there are few people in her hamlet who are in this kind of business which permits her to have a successful business that grown more each time.  She will use income from the sale of all her products to cover payment of the granted loan and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Hermelinda is very well known for being a hard working, cheerful, responsible woman who is a good mother wishing to proviD. a better future for her family (husband and children).

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of merchandise (beauty products and clothes).

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FAIDA est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier de Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de roulement consistant, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’habits, de chaussures et de tissus  avec  Awa. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts de groupe et les deux précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce  prêt Awa compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes de wax et 5 pièces de pagnes REAL de motif différents. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composés de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  qui sera réutilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Faida Group ("Plentiful") is composed of four married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have five children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Torakabougou, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to have sufficient working capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and finance their activities of trading with clothes, shoes and fabrics (the latter is Awa’s activity). This is their third loan, the previous two loans having been repaid on schedule.

Awa intends to use this loan to buy 10 units of wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 5 units of "Real" pagnes with different patterns from wholesalers in Bamako. She retails her fabrics at the market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Thanks to this loan, Awa expects to make an average profit of 25,000 CFA francs a month, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, contando con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada  en el distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona muy comercial al por mayor y menor.

José se dedica  a la venta de verduras desde hace 3 años, su puesto está en el mercado los Pathos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, zona que se encarga de las ventas al por mayor y menor de todo tipo de productos comestibles, la demanda que existe en ese lugar a permitido que José pueda incrementar sus ventas y sus clientes, por eso a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de más verduras para seguir comercializandolos a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito adquirido y solventar sus gastos personales.

José es una persona con muchos ideales y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más adelante otro puesto en el mercado, lo que permitirá que mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, single, and lives at the home of relatives.  He receives water and electricity services.  José resides in the District of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, which is part of Chiclayo Province.  This district is known as a commercial area where goods are sold wholesale and at retail.  

José has been selling vegetables for three years.  His vending post is located at the Los Pathos Market in the city of Chiclayo.  All types of food products are sold here in bulk and in small amounts.  Due to existing demand, José has been able to increase his sales and expand his customer base.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN so that he can buy more vegetables to sell to his customers.  With the revenue he generates, he will be able to repay his loan and cover his personal expenses.  

José is a person with many ideals.  One of them is to work hard and with great effort so that he can acquire another vending post at the market.  This will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Esbon

texts.en:
Esbon has been in the mining industry for the past nine years, in Naivasha town. He is 39 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with four schooling children.

Esbon was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his second loan, after he repaid his previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to employ manpower and to add stock for his spouse’s retail shop. She is currently having a challenge in managing the number of clients who come to her shop.

In the future, Esbon hopes to buy a lorry for transporting extraction products to the market.

loans.use: to employ manpower and add stock for his spouse’s retail shop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 70-year-old, married woman with 6 children. Nenita works very hard to provide for her family.

Nenita runs a variety store in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 15 years, and she explains that she sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, bread, and other groceries. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Cheryl has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from her general store. Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, está casado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa, poseen casa propia, él es agricultor, dedicado a la siembra de maíz, aprendió de su padre y tiene muchos años de realizar esta labor, de la producción ha logrado garantizar la alimentación de su familia así también ingresos económicos. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres sacos de abono y una bomba plástica  de herbicidas, estos materiales los necesita para aplicarlos al cultivo, con la intención de tener buena cosecha con frutos sanos.
Para Elmer el objetivo que tiene es que a través del financiamiento poder tener los insumos necesarios para trabajar honradamente en la agricultura, logrando mantener a su familia con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Elmer, 22, is married.  He lives with his wife and they have a house of their own.  He’s a farmer who grows corn.  He learned from his father and has been working in this occupation for many years.  From his production he’s been able to feed his family and earn income.

He is asking for a loan to buy three sacks of manure and a plastic herbicide pump.  He needs these materials to apply to the crops with the aim of obtaining a good harvest of healthy fruit.

For Elmer, the goal he has for the loans is to be able to have the necessary supplies to be able to work honorably in farming being able to provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure and a plastic herbicide pump.

loans.name: Porvenir Femenino Group

texts.en:
Flavia belongs to the “Porvenir Femenino” (Future Women group). The group is comprised of ten members who work day-to-day at their business activities. The group is located in the Peninsula of Samana, a nascent tourist city where much of the citizenry live in rural areas surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic ocean. They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Flavia’s family is made up of herself and her five children, 2 of whom still live with her in her home. They live in a wooden house that Flavia wants to upgrade into a concrete block structure.  This is her most difficult challenge.  But she says this is not impossible because with her work and God´s will, she will makes this dream come true and give her children all the support and anything they need. 

Flavia has a business selling gasoline from the front of her house.  She lives on the edge of one of the main roads.  Many people drive through it and stop at her gasoline stand. She has been engaged in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she started this business thanks to some savings she had, then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza and was able to invest further.  Flavia has accessed and repaid 11 loans with Esperanza Internacional. She will use this new loan to buy gasoline and motor oil.

Flavia and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: buy gasoline

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is 50-year-old man who breeds sheep. He has 8 years of experience in this field. Zakir usually buys lambs and then raises and fattens them and resells them for a profitable price in the central Bilasuvar bazaar. He sells sheep for meat and fur purposes. Sheep fur is very popular for hand-made blankets and mattresses.  He is married and has three children. He would like to purchase more sheep to increase his profit. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 41 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola y ganadera.

Esperanza tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace 6 años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1600 para comprar material y aves de corral para iniciar en un nuevo negocio,  así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Esperanza con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio y familia adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
41-year-old Esperanza lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  The only basic service their home receives is electricity.  It is located in a rural area of Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

Esperanza's business is making and selling clothes.  She has been in this line of work for six years and her business is located in her home.  She has her own customer base and also does work to order.  There isn't a lot of competition in this field.  With the income that she makes, Esperanza is able to cover her family needs.

Esperanza has requested this loan for 1,600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa's seed capital fund.  She will use the money to buy material and also farmyard birds so that she can start out in a new business.  This will enable her to continue providing a good service and complete the orders that she has.  This will enable her to make more profits so that she can improve her family's quality of life.  With a lot of effort and hard work, Esperanza has known how to make progress in her business and get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy material so that she can continue making clothes, and to buy farmyard birds

loans.name: Kerenlee

texts.en:
Kerenlee started her farming business four years ago together with her husband, who sows and transplants the rice seedlings in her one-hectare rice field. She usually earns a yield twice a month and uses it to sustain their basic needs. 

She needs to improve her crop production for a higher income but she has insufficient capital to pay for land cultivation and buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice field. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. 

In the future, Kerenlee wants to strengthen her farming business and produce an abundant harvest to save for the college education of her child.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, seeds and fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Ade Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary sells batik and clothes in Berekum. She is 36 years-old and married with three children. Mary has been running this business for eight years now but does not have adequate working capital to support her business. Most of the time, she buys supplies on credit and makes payment after sales.  She wants to use the loan to purchase additional stock and also expand by acquiring a shop. She hopes to use part of her earnings to finance her children’s education. 

She belongs to the community group called “Ade Pa Trust Group”. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Lester Roberto

texts.es: El Señor Lester tiene 1hijo el se dedica a la distribución de productos pepsi,  hace 4 años, comenzó con pocos productos pues él le compra a los camiones distribuidoras ya que el almacena sus productos y los distribuye a las pulperías. El crédito solicitado es para comprar variedad en gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños. El Sueño del Señor Lester es mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo cada día más.
texts.en: Lester has one child and he has been distributing Pepsi products for the past 4 years.  He started with a few items but then he started buying from the company trucks.  Now he warehouses the products and distributes them to the general stores.  He is requesting a loan to buy different types of soft drinks, and different flavors and sizes.   Lester’s dream is to improve his business and expand it more every day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks in different flavors and sizes

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. His wife Mwanaidi is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Abdu has operated a retail shop for the past eleven years. His potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of transporting his goods to his shop. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 60,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to do business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso está solicitando uno para la compra de repuestos para la motocicleta, así como pago de mecánico, el trabajo con los prestamos le agrada, porque es un dinero que en cualquier necesidad logra solventar, ayudándole con la oportunidad de plazos accesibles para el pago de las cuotas, en su anterior experiencia, él logro manejar la inversión, y pago oportunamente.
La condición económica de Carlos está un poco mejor, y en su familia todos están bien, tratando de superarse todos juntos.
texts.en:
Carlos has the need to continue investing in the business and this is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy spare parts for a motorcycle, and also to pay the mechanic.

He likes working with the loans because it is money for whatever needs to be resolved, offering him with the opportunity of affordable time payments. In his previous experience, he managed to make his payments on time. 

Carlos is in a little bit better financial position now, and his family are all well, trying to succeed together.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Cang-alwang, Siquijor, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Josephine engages in snack vending. She has had this business for five years.  Each month, she earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. Josephine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months.  In the future, Josephine hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa is a married man with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school while 1 is married. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.  

Yawa has operated as a blacksmith for the past 26 years. In addition he also runs a goat-selling business. His potential clients are the local area farmers. He dreams of expanding his businesses.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase scrap metals and goats for his businesses. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals and goats for his business

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es: Juana Emilia tiene una actividad económica que es una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella tiene 33 años, a su cargo tiene dos hijos que con mucho esfuerzos ha sacado adelante. Juna es una emprendedora con mucho éxito, ya que ha cumplido unos de su sueños que es de iniciar su propio negocio como una alternativa de trabajo y poder generar ingresos a su familia. Ya tiene en su negocio clientes fijos y eventuales que le ofrece su servicio. Juana está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio  y por  comprar  lo que son: granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergente, shampoo entre otros productos que sus cliente más demandan en negocio.
texts.en: Juana Emilia has a general store in her home. She is 33 and supports two children. With great hard work, she has gotten them ahead. Juana is a very successful entrepreneur who has achieved one of her dreams: starting her own business as an alternative job in order to generate income for her family. She already has loyal customers, as well as casual customers. She is requesting a loan to invest in purchases of the products for which she has the highest demand, such as: basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, and shampoo.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, shampoo, and other items.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Estrella esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual puso invertir en su negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa usada de temporada de invierno, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de ropa. 
Doña Estrella se a dedicado al comercio y su esposo es albañil trabaja en una constructora entre los dos han sacada a delante sus tres hijos que tiene y formando un patrimonio segura.
Desea mejorar los su negocio y tener mas ganancias y ingreso a su familia.
texts.en:
Estrella is grateful for the help provided to her with the previous loan, which she used to invest in her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy used clothing for the winter season, since her customers are asking her for this type of clothing. 

Estrella dedicates herself to her business, and her husband is a mason who works for a construction business. Between the two of them, they have helped their three children get ahead and are building up a secure financial foundation. 

She wants to improve her business and have more earnings and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 30 лет, замужем. Вместе с мужем воспитывает троих детей, младшей из которых четыре года. Закончив факультет филологии, Айзада начала работать в школе села Жан-Булак, где и работает по сей день преподавателем английского языка. В 2003 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айзада начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 4 дойные коровы, 20 голов овец, 8 голов коз и 4 лошади.   В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Aizada is 30 years old and married. She and her husband are raising three children, the youngest of whom is four years old. After having graduated from  college with a degree in philology, Aizada started working in the Zhan-Bulak village school, where she still works as an English teacher. In 2003, in the search of an additional source of income for her family, Aizada started raising farm animals. She had 15,000 KGS as her starting capital. At present her farm brings in about 15,000 KGS monthly from sale of milk products. Currently she has four dairy cows, 20 sheep, eight goats and four horses. In order to increase her cattle herd, Aizada turned to  "Bai Tushum &Partners" for a loan of 45,000 KGS to buy two young bulls. Aizada plans to use the resulting revenues to purchase additional animals, which will allow her to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosilen

texts.en:
Rosilen is 22 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with two children. 

Rosilen has a business that sells variety of products. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rosilen has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Gs Vero Group

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica, es  casada, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas como nacatamales, tutti fruti, mariscos y también venta de ropa nueva y achinería  ella cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
Doña Verónica cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en la venta de Golosinas y de sus demás productos, ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona de las montañas y cafetaleras de jamastran, ella a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque su  manera de atenderlos es muy especial. Doña Verónica el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos, frutas, maíz, utensilios de cocina y compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
Doña Verónica el crédito solicitado le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los Sueños y planes a futuro de Doña Verónica son que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca para dar el sustento a su familia.
La Señora María se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de chorizo en masa, embutidos de cerdo, embutido de res, y  molida de maíz.
La Señora Oneyda, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de  nacatamales y ropa nueva.  
 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Verónica is married and is a very hard-working person. She works in sales. Her main activity is selling foods such as pork tamales, fruit salad, and seafood. She also sells new clothing and low-cost consumer goods. She has twelve years of experience managing her business.
Verónica counts on her husband's support in selling her food and the rest of her products. Her customer base is in the mountain and coffee-growing areas of Jamastran. Her business has allowed her to get ahead, since it has been one of her main sources of income. She has been successful in gaining customers because her customer service is very special. 
Verónica will use the loan to purchase seafood, fruit, corn, and kitchen utensils, and to purchase new clothing to sell. The granted loan will help Verónica have a better business, so that she can cover home expenses and give her family a better quality of life.
Verónica's dreams and plans for the future are that her business will grow and become stronger so that she can support her family.
María works in sales. Her main activity is selling chorizo paste, pork sausage, beef sausage, and ground corn.
Oneyda works in sales and her main activity is selling pork tamales and new clothing.   
 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase seafood, fruit, corn, and kitchen utensils, and to purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 39 years old mother of 3 children, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she opens a small grocery store in front of her house. This business can bring her USD 3 per day.

Ann would like to get loan from HKL in the amount of USD 560.00 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Ann thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a female student who comes from Klapanunggal. She is a clever student, but she comes from a poor family. 

Sometimes, she has bad expectations about her dreams because she wants to be a doctor, but if she lacks the costs, she must drop out of the school. That's one of the reasons for her mother to join and be a Komida client: because she needed additional money for her daughter’s school costs.

loans.use: to pay for monthly school costs.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: LAURA: Es una señora alegre y amable de 41 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como conductor. Desde hace más de 15 años estableció una pequeña tienda de zapatos y ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Anteriormente era integrante de un grupo solidario y gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido adquirir garantías y solicita su primer crédito en la modalidad de individual, para comprar en Managua: Blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, entre otros productos y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.

loans.use: para comprar en Managua: Blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, entre otros productos

loans.name: Cruzche Iii Group

texts.en:
34 year old Paulina, who is a member of the group, is married with eight children who range in age from 2 months to 15 years old. She needs to work hard to support her large family and has two businesses. She has an animal husbandry business and raises chickens and pigs. In addition, she works with palm leaves of the area and fabricates bottle covers of palm leaves as well as palm hats. She  takes orders for her palm creations and delivers them weekly.  Paulina is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of palm leaves and supplies so that she will have plenty of raw materials available.

Paulina and her friends in the “Cruzche III” Trust Bank feel fortunate to participate in the monthly educational trainings of the Trust Bank when a Facilitator shares beneficial information with them in their own language. As the ladies have had little or no formal education, they are very grateful to obtain knowledge about important and relevant themes including business administration, family matters, women’s issues and empowerment. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus” and it is most effective.

KIVA investors from around the world are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in the lives of Paula and the members of the “Cruzche III” Trust Bank. They are on the path towards a more prosperous future, benefitting themselves, their families and their families in Santa Cruz El Quiche, Guatemala! Thank you!

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of palm leaves and supplies so that she will have plenty of raw materials to make hats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: According to Mrs. Mary Erhunmwunse, she started this business 14 years ago and her family has benefited a lot from it. Although she is 50 years old, her business acumen paves way for her. She is interested in the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Koévi

texts.en:
A sigle man without children, Mr. Koévi A. was born in 1984 in Kévé. He is an electronics repair person by training, however, he has had insufficient means to supply himself with working materials, and has thus chosen to buy and sell motorcycle spare parts.

He is asking for a credit of $900 with the aim of opening his own workshop where he will sell spare parts. The profits from this business will enable him to refund the credit in time and will improve his quality of life from the economic and financial point of view.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire sans enfant, Monsieur A. Koévi est né en 1984 à Kévé. Etant rebobineur de métier et par manque de moyen pour s’approvisionner en matériels de travail, il a alors opté pour l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées pour moto. Dans le souci d’ouvrir à présent son propre atelier auquel il associera la vente des pièces détachées, il sollicite un crédit de $900. Les bénéfices tirés des ces activités lui permettront de rembourser à temps et amélioreront sa qualité de vie sur le plan économique et financier.

loans.use: Opening of a electronics repair workshop and selling spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., a 47-year-old woman, has four children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is a garment worker, another one is a chef in a small nearby restaurant, and the rest are students. Phan makes her living by growing a wide range of crops and raising animals in the field. She and her husband normally earn around $5 per day by selling crops and animals. In order to make additional income and to satisfy greater demand from the market, this couple must grow more crops and raise more animals on their farm. Phan hopes to use the loan to purchase a piece of land to grow more crops and to raise more pigs. In the future, if she has enough money, she would like to buy a car for her husband to run a taxi business and to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow more crops

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat has been in business for over 9 years. She is married and has 5 children. She has a very friendly family. Her husband goes on the trip to purchase goods. They have three places of trade; her elder son and daughter are responsible there. They have a good profit from this kind of business and are satisfied with their trade places.

Muhabat became a client of MicroInvest in 2001. Her first loan was $100; she spent it to purchase a new batch goods. Gradually she could increase the turnover of her working capital and rent two trade places for her children. In the future Muhabat wants to open her own bookstore and office supply shop in the center of Khujand.

Muhabat plans to spend her next loan to purchase two boxes of pens and pencils, 2000 copy-books, 120 sketch-books, and 20 school bags. She wishes to see a profitable month before the school period.

P.S. Muhabat's elder daughter Munirahon is pictured.

loans.use: Purchase office supplies for school season

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: There has been an increment in my profit making since I started borrowing from LAPO says Mrs. Ann I. who hails from Benin City, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 3 years; she is 37 years old, married mother of five (5) children. she sells food stuffs in an open-air market. She has been in this business since 1998. She needs the US$ 800 loan to buy more foodstuffs and drinks and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Biova

texts.en:
Born August 8, 1983 in Lome, A. Biova is a single father of one child. A hard-worker and tactful, he has a natural talent for administration and has worked for 3 years in his trade as a mechanic. His parents were poor and he endured a lot to be able to purchase the materials for his workshop (keys, hammers...) This is what prompts him to request a loan of $800 dollars, which he will be able to pay back without difficulties. This sum of money would allow him to complete his project for his workshop and would also allow him to improve his quality of life and to profit from his earnings.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né le 08 août 1983 à Lomé, A. Biova est célibataire et a un (1) enfant à sa charge. Travailleur et discret, il a un talent en matière de gestion et exerce le métier de mécanicien depuis 03 ans. Ses parents étant pauvre, il souffre beaucoup pour acheter les matériaux d’atelier (clés, marteaux---). Ce qui l’amène à demander un crédit de 800 dollars qu’il pourra bien rembourser sans difficultés. Cette somme lui permettra de réaliser son projet et lui procurera un changement dans son niveau de vie et une rentabilité de ses revenus.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop

loans.name: Change Group

texts.en: Bdilika ("Change" in English) is a group of entrepreneurs featured in the photograph. It is is composed of Mamka A., Pili Nasoro, Kasanda M. and Rehema Shaban, who are all residents of the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam. S. and Manka run restaurants, while the other two own groceries. All four of them are recipients of the business and entrepreneurship skills training organized by YOSEFO, and have long ago realized the importance of doing business together. They are each in need of US$300 to help them boost their respective businesses.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ao

texts.en:
Ao F. is a mother aged fifty-four from the village of Tulaele. She runs a vegetable garden business. She’s a very energetic woman who has put much effort into trying to improve her business.

Ao has a very good loan history with SPBD and wishes to continue to stay in the program for more financial assistance to her business. With her requested loan, she plans to further improve her little market garden business.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and more seeds

loans.name: Kitea F(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Rose. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to increase her inventory stock. N. is 35 years old and a single mother of 5 children. Her children all go to school and range in age from 5 to 16. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her grocery business.

N. is joined in her small group by Llillian B., Agnes N., Lazia B., and M. Allen. Llillian B. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more hairdryers. Agnes N. is currently in the poultry business. She is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to finish the poultry house that is under construction. Lazia B. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to expand her restaurant. M. Allen is currently in the business of brick lying. M. is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to re-invest in her brick business.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Reoung

texts.en: Mrs. Reoung S. M., 46, works making small mills (made of wood or hard stone) at her house. She makes on average around $3 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns about $2 a day. This couple has eight children, two of who are married and live away from home. Moreover, four others work making small mills, with a revenue of $2 each a day, and the rest of the children are students. To expand the business and produce more mills now they are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase stones to make mills. (Pictured is Mrs. Reoung S. M., on the right, and her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase stones to make mills

loans.name: Zendia B 2009-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rakele K.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rakele is a 30-year-old married woman. Her husband is a teacher. They have 2 children ranging from age 1 to 16 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses.

Josphine P., Juslian D., Mary M., and Leya F. join Rakele in her small group. Josphine P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Juslian D. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Mary M. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Leya F. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Thus far, alone, we have almost finished . But, there are a few details left. In order to finish the list of details, we need to finish making our ceramic floors. But, at this moment, we don't have the capital required to buy the ceramic floors. We are requesting a loan of $900 in order to buy and make the ceramic floors.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Ya casi tenemos la casa terminada solo nos esta haciendo falto algunos detalles. Para verla total mente lista uno de esos detalles es el vitropiso es el que nos esta haciendo mas falta, pero por el momento no contamos con el capital requerido para la compra y colocación del vitropiso. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $900.00 dlls. Para la comprar y colocación del vitropiso.

loans.use: To buy ceramic floors for the interior of the house.

loans.name: Takku 1 Group

texts.fr:
The women from the Takku 1 group are very active in the field of weaving traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes) and in making clothing. With the allotted funds, they will buy essential material: weaving thread, bazin fabric, traditionally weaved fabric, and dye etc… They will then share those to make traditional clothing as well as distinctively African ones, such as robes, wrap around fabric (pagnes), male outfits, sheets and tablecloths, and other knitted clothes for women. They will sell their wares at the weekly markets and in their neighborhood. This type of clothing is popular at this time because it is made of cotton fabric. 
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Les femmes regroupées dans le groupement Takou 1 sont trés actives dans le dommaine du tissage des pagnes et la confection d'autres tenues vestimentaires. Avec les fonds alloués, elles vont acheter les matières premières : fil de tissage,  tissus bazin et pagne tissé de façon traditionnelle, teinture etc., qu'elles vont se partager pour confectionner des habits traditionnels et typiquement africains, telles que les robes, pagnes,tenues masculines, draps et nappes de tables, et autres tenues tricotées pour femmes qu'elles revendent au niveau des loumas hebdomadaires et dans leur quartier. ces habits sont très recherchés en ce moment car ils sont faits à base de tissus en coton.

loans.use: Making and selling of clothing

loans.name: Nancy Graciela

texts.es:
Nancy has worked many years to support her household. For 10 years she has been a street vendor selling food, usually in Vilcacoto, an area near her residence. Throughout all these years Nancy has been able to earn enough income to support her 4 children. She has set herself up to one day be able to sell groceries and, in doing so, remain closer to her children, especially the youngest ones. For now Nancy needs to buy ingredients to make the food she sells and replace the utensils she uses to serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Nancy ha trabajado durante varios años para ser un sostén de su hogar, hace 10 años ella vende comida de manera ambulante principalmente en Vilcacoto un lugar próximo a su localidad. Durante todos estos años, ella ha podio generarse los ingresos para sostener a sus 4 hijos. Se ha proyectado para que en un futuro cercano pueda vender también abarrotes y así estar más cerca de sus hijos, en especial de los más pequeños. Nancy necesita por ahora comprar ingredientes para sus comidas y mejorar los utensilios que utiliza para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils for business selling food

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City,  Edo State, Nigeria. She sells plantains wholesale. She travels to the villages nearby Benin City to buy plantains wholesale. She later sells the plantains to retailers who in turn sell them to the final consumers. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more plantains to meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more plantains for re-sale

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi S. is 40-years-old, married with four children. The family lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria. Kemi has been selling eggs since 1996.

She is requesting a loan to buy a deep freezer so that she can begin selling frozen foods, thereby expanding her business and increasing her profit margin. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to expand the business into frozen food sales

loans.name: Barbara Herma

texts.es:
Doña Bárbara tiene 39 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de cuatro hijos varones cuyas edades son de 10, 8, 6 y 2 años. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo S/N. distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao – Puno.  

Hace un año que es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2,000”- Mazocruz. Con su primer crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, compró galletas, gaseosas, caramelos, yogurt (venta de abarrotes). Desde los 10 años de edad empezó a trabajar ayudando a sus tías de parte de su padre, a cambio de su trabajo sólo recibía víveres y lana de alpaca. Cuando ya cumplió los 19 años de edad empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia, vendía salchimote en la ciudad de Juliaca y a los 29 años de edad convivió con su esposo, desde entonces se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, llamas (engorde), la mayoría de veces entrega alpacas, llamas en pie a los Bolivianos que viene a comprar al campo y al mes una ó dos veces entrega carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna, en un promedio de 03 a 05 degollados. También pertenece a una Organización de Artesanas y les llega pedidos de Cuzco y Arequipa en convenio con el “Proyecto Sierra Sur”.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará más alpaca, llamas para engorde y posterior venta en carne.

Su meta es tener una tiende de abarrotes en Mazocruz y que sus hijos estudien en la ciudad de Puno.
texts.en:
Ms. Barbara A. is a 39-year-old woman who completed elementary school, is married and has 4 sons ages 10, 8, 6, and 2. She lives in Jr. Trujillo S/N, Mazocruz district, in the El Collao Ð Puno province.

She has been a member of the “Generación 2,000” – Mazocruz microfinance institute for a year. With her first loan of 500.00 PEN, she purchased cookies, soft drinks, candy, and yogurt for her grocery store. From the age of 10, she started working, helping out her paternal aunts. In exchange for her work, she only received provisions and alpaca fleece. When she turned 19, she started to work independently. She used to sell salchimote, Peruvian street food made of maize and sausages, in the city of Juliaca. At 29, she went to live with her husband and ever since then, they raise livestock—cows, sheep, and llamas (for meat). Most of the time she delivers alpacas and llamas by foot to the Bolivians who come to the countryside, and once or twice she delivers meat to retailers in the city of Tacna at an average of 3-5 carcasses. She also pertains to an organization of craftswomen, and they receive orders from Cuzco and Arequipa in agreement with the “Proyecto Sierra Sur” (Southern Sierra Project).

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase more alpacas and llamas to fatten them and sell their meat.

Her goal is to have her own grocery store in Mazocruz and to have her children study in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpacas and llamas to be fattened and sold for meat

loans.name: Muni's Group

texts.en:
Muni baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 40 years. She is the mother of eight children: six sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a railway station. The next to him has a mobile shop. The others are also set in their own works. Muni baji’s daughters help her in household work. Muni baji’s husband has a pigeon selling business. He sells these at a famous market named “Tolinton Market”.

Muni baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more mobile phones to expand her son’s mobile phone business, so that he will be able to sell more mobile phones and earn profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tasneem baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to resell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (switch boards, switches and tube lights) for her shop. Talat baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Samen D. is a villager in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a seller who owns a small restaurant to earn her living. She is a 62 year old widow and the mother of three children who are employed in different positions. Even though they have different businesses, they do not have much money to support their household and to repair the house. Thus, Mrs. Samen D. decided to ask for a loan to repair her house to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To repair her house to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Gema Misere Group

texts.en:
Florence N. is the leader of the Gema Misere loan group in Mityana. She is a farmer who grows matooke, beans, maize and cassava on plantations that she has owned for a very long time. Once the produce is ready for sale, she sells from her home as well as taking it to the market to sell at a favorable price. 

As a result of getting loans for three years now, she has been able to include the keeping of cows and goats at her home with the savings from her previous cycles, as well as develop her home by buying furniture for her home. Her children are in school and generally the standard of living is great! Florence needs a loan to be able to buy produce from other farmers so as to supply her regular customers plus the many extra due to the festival season. She hopes the the profits will help her with school fees come next year.

Other group members have very similar aspirations.

loans.use: Buying more produce for her business.

loans.name: Neema N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Neema N. N. from Tukuyu. She is married with one one-year-old child. Neema has been running a timber business since 2005. Her business is to purchase timber from villages and resell it in town.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Neema currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more timber in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Sofia Catalina

texts.es:
Sofía y su esposo hace un tiempo se dedicaban a vender mochilas, maletas y carteras en un mercado como ambulante. No obstante, una vez que su esposo consiguió un trabajo estable en una empresa de gas, Sofía abandonó el negocio de las maletas. Luego de ello, Sofía consiguió un trabajo en la Municipalidad de su localidad. Lamentablemente después de un año y medio, también debió abandonarlo puesto que quedó en cinta de su única hija.

Ahora se dedica por las mañanas y en sus tiempos libres a la venta de productos de belleza de tres diferentes marcas. En las tardes se ocupa trabajando en una discoteca en la cual también gana clientes para su negocio de cosméticos.

Eventualmente cuando no tiene muchos ingresos en su negocio trabaja independientemente para una imprenta. En un futuro, anhela abrir un pequeño puesto en el mercado junto con su hermana.
texts.en:
Sofia and her husband sold rucksacks, luggage and wallets on a market as street vendors for a while. Nevertheless, once her husband obtained a steady job in a gas company, Sofia stop selling the luggage products. After this, Sofia got a job at the local town hall. Unfortunately, after a year and a half, she had to leave the job because she became pregnant of her only daughter. Now, she sells beauty products from three different brands in the mornings and during her free times. In the evenings she works at a discotheque, where she also gets clients for the cosmetics business. Sometimes when she doesn't have enough income she works independently for a printing company. Her dream in the future is to open a small stand on the market together with her sister.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been a food and vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She belongs to Jikomboe Group (group code 2068). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 450. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 a.m. to noon. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lydia is 48 years old, married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 14 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more food items and vegetable for her business.

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.ru: Курбонов Охунчон мужчина 34 лет , женат имеет двоих детей, проживает в районе Сомгар. Охунчон  работает в колхозе трактористом, жена работает в сельской школе, учительницей начальных классов. Охунчон для  дополнительного дохода имеет свой бизнес животноводства. Охун купив молодой скот ,откармливает его и продаёт на рынке. С чего имеет доход и  использует его на проживание , расходы семьи.Получив кредит Охунчон хочет прикупить скот.
texts.en:
Ohunjon K. is a 34 year old man, he is married and has two children. He lives in the Somgor region. Ohunjon works on a collective farm as a tractor driver, his wife works in the village school as an elementary school teacher. Ohunjon has his own livestock business for additional income. Ohunjon after purchasing young livestock, fattens it and sells it at the market. This earns him an income and he uses it to live on, family expenditures. After taking out a loan, Ohunjon will buy additional livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra ya que era empleada en una empresa, pero su sueldo y el de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos de la casa.
Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2006 por iniciativa mía, ya que donde ella trabajaba aprendío mucho sobre las tortillerías y quizo independizarse y poner su propio negocio con unos ahorros que ella tenía y con el apoyo de una de sus hijas que trabaja en los EEUU. 
 
Poco a poco  fue haciendo de mis clientes y aunque tiene mucha competencia por estar cerca de un mercado su estrategia ha sido que ademas de vender tortillas y masa también vende refrescos, periódicos, etc. y además también hace entregas a domicilio de masa y de tortillas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000, este crédito le va a ayudar para comprar materia prima  para tener un mayor inventario para esta época de semana santa.
texts.en:
Silvia started her business to earn extra income because she already worked for a company but her salary and that of her husband wasn't enough to cover all the household expenses. She started the business in April 2006 on her own initiative, since where she worked she learned a lot about tortilla making and wanted to go out on her own and start her own business with some of her savings and the support of her daughter working in the United States. Little by little she's taking on her clients and although there she has a lot of competition from being close to the market, her strategy has been to sell tortillas and pastries as well as beverages, periodicals, etc. She also makes home deliveries for tortillas and pastries. She is requesting a loan of MXN $3,000, and this credit will help her purchase ingredients to increase her inventory during the Easter period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: назарова Мухае . Проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает в средней школе -учителем. Кроме того имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота путем покупки молодого бычка. Это даст возможность заработать дополнительно .
texts.en:
N. Muhayo lives in the Rudaki region. She works in the high school as a teacher. In additions she has a plot where she raises livestock. She has been doing this for 10 years now. She plans to get credit in order to increase her livestock headcount by buying a young bull. This will allow her to earn an additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo "Primavera" esta representado por el señor José Raúl y conformado por 12 personas que van cursando juntos ya su tercer ciclo, el presidente se dedica a la distribución de refrescos en botellas de plástico al interior del departamento, el resto de los socios venden artículos de ferretería en tiendas o se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tienda de barrio y productos en general como huevos, refrescos y celulares. Por la misma actividad a la que se dedican requieren de capital para la obtención de productos al por mayor y así poder abaratar sus costos y competir en el mercado con mercaderías de buena calidad. Los socios cuentan con la experiencia de haber trabajado anteriormente con nuestra entidad teniendo grandes expectativas de seguir creciendo junto a nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" group is represented by José Raúl and is made up of 12 persons who are in their third loan cycle. The president of the group distributes bottled soft drinks within the province, the rest of the members sell hardware in stores or sell groceries in neighborhood stores or sell goods in general such as eggs, soft drinks, and cell phones. Because of their activities, they require capital so they can buy their products wholesale and in this way be able to lower their costs and compete in the marketplace with good quality merchandise. The members have prior experience working with Fundación Agrocapital and have high expectations to continue growing with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.en:
Mr. Emerson C. is a bona fide member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He is 54 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He is a pensioner and his wife is a retired teacher.

Recently, he's obtaining a loan of PHP 20,000 that will used for the enrollment of his graduating student. The rest will be used for the maintenance of his motorcycle which is also their source of income.

He's thankful to the Paglaum Coop for giving him the chance to borrow the money that has answered his problem. And with Paglaum he is able to say that he can continue to support his children in school and enable them to finish college and someday find a decent and stable job.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: mr M. est un enseignant de profession,il est marié et est père de trois enfants et loge au quartier cité senghor de thiès ,après les heures de classe il fait de l'aviculture pour diversifier ses sources de revenu;il a eu à rembourser son premier pret sans difficulté et sollicite un autre pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a professional teacher. He is married and the father of 3 children. They live in the Cité Senghor neighborhood in Thiès. After teaching his classes, he raises poultry to diversify his sources of revenue. He managed to reimburse his first loan without difficulty and is now asking for another loan to bolster his working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising poultry

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Mercedes es conviviente tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Mercedes  termino la escuela estatal, no siguió estudiando  por que salió embarazada y se dedico a cuidar a su hijo,   empezó a trabajar vendiendo ropa en gamarra vendía, lo dejo por que salió nuevamente embarazada,  tuvo que dejarlo y hace tres años  decidió poner en su casa una tienda, empezó de a pocos y con los prestamos de Finca está comprando mas mercadería.    
Desde que Mercedes esta en Finca,  primera institución que le dio préstamo, para su negocio, aprendió a organizarse hacer precavida.   
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda, arroz, azúcar, aceite. 
 El sueño de Mercedes es crecer más en el negocio y poner otra tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Las Luciérnagas Communal Bank.
Mercedes lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has two children aged 11 and 8 who attend public school.
Mercedes completed public school, but did not continue studying because she was pregnant and had to care for her son. She started to work selling clothing at Gamarra, but she quit because she again became pregnant. Three years ago she decided to set up shop in her home. She started little by little and with the loans from Finca she is now buying more merchandise.
Since Mercedes has been with Finca, the first institution to give her a loan, she has learned how to organise and be cautious with her business.
Mercedes needs an 800 PEN loan to purchase groceries for her shop like rice, sugar and oil.
Mercedes dreams of growing her business and of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her shop like rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Zakiu Group

texts.en: Zakiu is the group leader of Zakiu Group. There are three members in this group and they all want a loan to progress their businesses so they are requesting a group of loan 22500 Afghani. Zakiu will use the loan for her tailoring business. Aziza wants to use the loan for her business of bead working, and Nazifa wants the loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable cart. They are very happy about this lending process being in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: To progress their businesses.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en: Zaynab is 26-years old and owns a store in the suburbs of Beirut. She sells women's clothing and is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more products . She has owned the store since 2007 and she hopes the loan will help to expand the store and increase profits. Her business has faced difficulties in the past when she had few clients and products but she hopes to produce more in order to overcome her financial difficulties. Zaynab is a hard worker and has good people skills which help her in running her business and improving it.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Haraldo Filiberto

texts.es: El señor Haraldo C. tiene 38 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Artesano,  “Confección de Pants”, habita junto  a su esposa, el y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar en dicha Confección    su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Bostonoy

texts.en: Bostonoy is a very diligent mother with big plans for her business. For the past seven years she has been dedicated to the buying and selling of manufactured products. She carries out this work with the support of her elder sons and it's generating an important economic source for her, allowing her to provide for the well-being and education of her younger children, who are the reason and motivation to keep working hard. Bostonoy, seeing a great demand for her business, wants to increase her stock and for this reason is requesting the loan. With your support, she hopes she will be able to improve her financial situation even more. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase manufactured products for increasing her range of goods

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita J. is from the village of Colupan Settlement, Tudela,Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Anita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Anita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Thèrèse

texts.fr: S. Thèrèse est née en 1962 à Adja dans le Département du Mono. Thèrèse est mariée à AKOHOUE François. Thèrèse et François ont quatre enfants tous majeurs et indépendants. La famille vit à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Thèrèse vend des beignets de haricot et de l'igname frit pour le diner devant son domicile. Les tubercules d'igname et le haricot que Thèrèse utilise pour ses repas sont achetés à Kokoro, une localité du Centre Bénin où les produits vivriers sont moins chers. Thèrèse est une ancienne bénéficiaire de ALIDé qui est à sixième crédit avec ALIDé. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en perpétuelle croissance, Thèrèse sollicite de nouveau un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Thèrèse was born in 1962 in Adja in Mono County. She is married to AKOHOUE François. Thèrèse and François have four children who are all legal adults and independent. The family lives in Agbodjèdo, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thèrèse sells bean fritters and fried yams for dinner in front of her home. The yam tubers and the beans that she uses for her meals are purchased in Kokoro, a town in central Benin where staple foods are less expensive. Thèrèse is a former ALIDé recipient and is on her sixth loan with ALIDé. To satisfy further her ever-growing number of customers, she’s requesting a new ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of beans, yam tubers, and containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: This is Daler, who is an animated guy filled with enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling the national pie called “sambusa” (it is the flour course with the meat that is baked in the coals according to the old recipes) in a small place which he rents. Since he was very young, Daler learned a great deal about sambusa preparation from his mother and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. Daler has big plans and dreams to grow his business. His goal is to have his own place where he can offer more comforts to his customers. And he'd like to buy a refrigerator so he can begin to offer cold drinks as well. With this purpose in mind, Daler wants to take a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase the necessary ingredients for preparing sambusa and also to improve his business conditions. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts and your important contribution, Daler can reach his goals. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing sambusa and to improve his business conditions

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita D. is a 67-year-old entrepreneur from Tala, Caloocan City. She is now a widow and lives with her son and grandchildren.

Lucita manages a glass/aluminum workshop located along the national highway, where her son is the chief worker, along with two other assistants. Lucita contracts with customers while her son and her two other employees do the hard work. Their shop fabricates and installs aluminum and glass doors, windows, and building panels. They earn more than 28,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lucita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is on her 16th loan cycle and has applied for a 30,000 PHP loan to sustain her business.

She hopes to have a bigger workshop someday so she can help employ more people in their community.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Glass display cases

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie is 38 years-old and a farmer who lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She plants rice, which is one of the main agricultural crops in her area. She has been married to Eugenio for 20 years. Despite the difficulties in farming, Virgie still finds time to be happy and thankful for her business. She is also grateful that Kiva partner CEVI opened in her town and extended its financial service to farmers like her. She is applying for a loan of Php 8,000, which she will use to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc. This loan will help Virgie with her farming and eventually her family life.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Faith And Hope Group
