texts.en:
Mary T. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Faith and Hope. She is 39 years old and is married with 3 children aged 5-18 years old. Their educational levels kindergarten-6th grade.
Mary dropped out of elementary school due to poverty.
She and her family lives in central Voinjama, but work in the Central market of Voinjama City, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia .
She sells used clothing. She buys used clothes wholesale and sells retail to buyers in the Voinjama central market in Lofa County, Liberia.
Mary has been running this business for 2 years and hopes to improve her business by having a store in the near future.
She serves and treats her customers with care in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business.
Mary needs this loan to purchase additional used clothes to increase business.
She dreams of giving her family and kids the best support possible.

loans.use: Purchase additional used clothes to increase business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 40 years old, married and mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working woman and works hard to support her business and her children in school. She trades in flip-flops, Ghana-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both sexes. She takes delivery of stock from Accra in Ghana. She purchases them in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She mostly sells them through hawking (that is, house to house selling) and sometimes in the community on market day. She has no regrets with this business as it brings her satisfaction. In spite of keen competition in the market, she manages to make sales all day. She requests your loan assistance to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy flip-flops and Ghana-made slippers in bulk from Accra.

loans.name: Daniel Fernando

texts.es: Daniel es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en casa propia la cual fue financiada por nuestra institución desde la compra del lote de terreno. Daniel es empleado en un surtidor de la zona trabaja en un turno y en sus horarios libres se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su moto taxi. La competencia es media en sus dos actividades. Daniel destinará el crédito a la construcción de una habitación más en su casa. Daniel tiene excelentes referencias morales en la zona, su cumplimiento fue excelente en el pago de sus anteriores operaciones. Esta será su cuarta operación en la institución.
texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old, single and lives in his own home, which was financed by this lending institution since he purchased the land. Daniel works at a regional gas station in shifts, and in his free time he makes a living transporting passengers in his moto-taxi. There is medium competition in both of his activities. Daniel plans to use the loan on building another room in his home. He has excellent moral references and his payment history was excellent in his previous loans. This will be his fourth loan through this lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to his home

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie L. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Sagua Banua, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her photography business.

Rosemarie’s husband, Jemmy, who is 44 years old, helps in running the business by going to different schools and by catering different occasions where video or photography is needed.  They have four children between the ages of 6  and 17 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosemarie joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the photography business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $203 from her business activities.

She is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her photography business, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now in her 14th loan cycle, Rosemarie is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use for their photography business.  She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née le 11 Octobre 1949 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Madeleine est mariée à HOUNGUE Gérôme et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais deux enfants sont encore à la charge du couple. La famille réside à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Madeleine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Madeleine n’a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Il y a près de 22 ans que Madeleine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, allumettes, bougies, conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, piles, pâtes alimentaires, sucre, papiers hygiéniques, etc.) à son domicile. Madeleine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs qu’elle avait obtenu. Très sollicitée par sa clientèle, Madeleine ambitionne renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Madeleine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on 11 October 1949 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Madeleine A. is married to Gérôme Houngue, and is the mother of five children, all of whom have been provided with some education. However, only two children are still in the couple's care. The family lives in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Madeleine helps her husband in providing for the family. Madeleine only attended primary school. For close to 22 years, Madeleine has run a business selling various items (soap, matches, candles, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, batteries, pasta, sugar, toilet paper, etc.) at her home. She buys these goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and has properly repaid all the previous loans she obtained. Highly sought-after by her clientele, Madeleine aspires to strengthen her business and better respond to the increasing demand of her clientele. This is why Madeleine is seeking another loan with ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (soap, batteries, milk, pasta, canned goods, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene la actividad económica de venta de hot dog y una pulpería, el tiene 49 años de edad. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues desde hace tiempo empezó con su humilde negocio y los financiamientos fueron de gran apoyo. El inicio hace más de 23 años, por lo que tenía mucha necesidad de mantener a su familia es un hombre trabajador, que se levanta muy temprano a realizar las compras para sus 2 negocios humildes pero productivos. El sueña con obtener una distribuidora. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de salchichas, carbón, bolsas, salsa tomate, cebolla entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar sells hot dogs and he has a mini-market. He is 49 years old. He has worked with the Foundation for a long time. Some time ago he started his humble business, and the loans were a great help. He started over 23 years ago because of the great need to support his family. He is a hard-working man. He gets up very early to make the purchases for his two humble, yet productive, businesses. He dreams of getting a distributorship. He is currently asking for a loan to buy hot dogs, charcoal, bags, tomato sauce, and onions, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma L., 45 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in vegetable vending in the local market. She lives in Brgy 5, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental with her husband Marino and their 9 children, 4 of whom are already working, 4 are students, and one is still a baby.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,500.

Vilma is now borrowing Php 17,000 so that she could buy more stocks for her vegetable vending business. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vilma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Baynhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Erdenebileg operates a sewing business in her town. She started her business by herself in 2000 after operating a small cafe for the previous 10 years.

She has worked hard over the years to gain experience and build a loyal customer base. In 2005, she began operating a sewing workshop with three other sewers. Her business is very important to her and she attributes her success to her good communication skills. Erdenebileg is optimistic about the future and says, "I would like to expand my sewing workshop into a company in the future." She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~ 590 USD) loan to purchase more materials and fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn sells seafood products — fish, dried, fish and shrimp. She buys seafood from different fishermen and sells it in the village. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and married, with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventoryl. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
A. Jovia is a hard-working business woman. Thirty years of age, she is a married and blessed with a son who is three years old. 

She owns a retail shop business where she deals in soft drinks. Her business is located in Kyabakuza Trading Centre. She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, tea leaves, rice, fruits, and soft drinks to sell. Her future hope is to enlarge her business for more income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, soap, tea leaves, rice, fruits, and soft dinks to sell

loans.name: Yunish

texts.en:
Yunish K. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets, dresses, shoes and trousers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pairs of shoes and sandals to sell.  

Yunish is 37 years old and married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a salon shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more pairs of shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro A. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 53 years old. Alejandro is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alejandro owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling different kinds of fruits in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alejandro from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are still too young. She has been operating her business of selling soft drinks (juices) for over one year. Her previous occupation was a cafe operator. She has no other source of income. With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase two sacks of mango fruits, pineapple, oranges and avocados. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her goal is to be self-reliant and to open another soft drink shop in future. Amina decided to go to Yehu for financial assistance. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of mango fruits, pineapple, oranges and avocados

loans.name: Olenka

texts.es: La Sra. Olenka es una cliente que retorna a trabajar con nuestra institución desde hace dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, tiene su esposo y su pequeña hijita, su mamá le ayuda en lo que puede, y estan colaborándose mutuamente. Viven ella y su familia en la casa de su suegro, el crédito que solcita ahora es para comprar perfumes y joyas que es el pedido que tiene ahora, ella aprovecha que los productos se encuentran en promocion y compra para despues venderlos a un costo un poco mas elevado y asi poder obtener un poco mas de dinero, la pareja es joven y ambos trabajan mucho, uno de sus deseos es el de tener su propia casita.
texts.en:
Olenka has been a returning partner of the institution for 2 years. She sells cosmetics through catalogs. She is married and has a young daughter. Her mother helps her however she can and they all help each other. She lives with her family in her father-in-law's house. She requests the loan to buy perfumes and jewelry, which are the orders she currently has. She takes advantage of product sales, buys and sells products at a small profit so that she can get a little bit more income. This is a hardworking young couple and one of their wishes is to own their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year old married woman with one child who is attending school. Her husband is the main income provider for the family but she helps him with large expenses.

She has twenty years of experience working as a farmer; she has been running her own farm for the past ten years. She uses plastic tents to grow her products and these tents allow her to better monitor her produce quality as well as to grow her produce for more months of the year. She works independently in her business.

Today she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, who rents a space in a department store, has owned a small business selling women's clothing for the past five years. A good location and an absence of competition have contributed to Svetlana's success, and her goal is to start one additional location.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase her assortment of clothing. She hopes to receive additional income and invest most of it back into the business. Svetlana enjoys her business and hopes to develop it further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: La Sra. Aracely A. R., ha  obtenido este crédito el cual esta  destinado para complementar la remodelación de su vivienda en donde esta realizando ampliando un cuarto, cambio de techo y pegado de cerámica y pago de mano de obra, nuestra cliente ha manifestado la importancia que ha sido nuestra institución y la oportunidad que ha recibido al haberle proporcionado dicho crédito siendo una cliente asalariada pero a mostrado tanto para nuestra institución responsabilidad,  como nosotros una alternativa de mejoramiento habitacional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aracely A. R. has obtained this loan which will be used to complement her home where she is enlarging a room, reroofing, installing tile and paying for labor costs.

Our client has stated the importance our institution has had for her and the opportunity it has provided by granting the loan.

Being a salaried employee she has nonetheless demonstrated responsibility towards our institution as we have tas an alterntive for her home improvements.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen V., 25, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for a business area with Vietnam. V. produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 33 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. V. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to produce more rice

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’articles divers tels le balais, les feuilles séchées d’échalotes, de poissons frais et fumés etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire avec l’institution.
 Madame Azara  Sogoré, qui est un membre du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 corbeilles de poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. 
Pour avoir du poisson fumé, on lave proprement les poissons frais, les étale sur les matériels conçus pour la circonstance au dessous duquel on active le feu dans un coin de la cour de la maison pendant deux ou trois jours au moins. On procède ensuite au suivi régulier tout au long du processus. Le poisson ainsi fumé est vendu à domicile et dans les foires de Konodimini et Konobougou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Azara  Sogoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres femmes du groupe l’achat des petits ruminants pour des fins d’élevage.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi group are married and live mostly in monogamous families.  They are on average 29 years old and have two children.  They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family and marriage ties.  The members of the group are in the business of selling various items such as balas, dried shallots,  fresh and smoked fish, etc.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the members of the group have decided to take advantage of the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their first joint loan with the institution.

Madame Azara Sogoré, a member of the group, plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of fresh fish on the shore of the Niger River in the village.  To smoke fish, one has to properly wash the fresh fish and spread them out on surfaces made for this purpose.  Under this a fire is lit, in one corner of the courtyard outside the house, for at least two or three days.  The fish must be tended to throughout the process.  The smoked fish is then sold door to door and in the markets in Konodimini and Konobougou for cash and on credit, generally to women.

Madame Azara Sogoré hopes to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA to be used to meet the daily needs of her household, as well as to reinvest in her business.   Like the other women in the group, she plans to buy and raise small livestock.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en: Allah Rakhi lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan famous for its dairy industry. She is 32 years old and married to M. I., who operates a business of selling bread.   Allah Rakhi  is a housewife. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law, who is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers, including school children. He will use the loan to repair his rickshaw because its engine is not working well.  Allah Rakhi is hopeful that through this investment her brother-in-law’s rickshaw will become fully repaired and allow him to work for longer hours.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Kalisa

texts.en:
Kalisa is 29 years old and is married with a 3 year old child.  His wife works in his business as well.  Kalisa has a clean and well-stocked store selling a large variety of groceries and other items.  He has been in this business for 7 years and is well-known in the district.

Kalisa has requested this loan to expand his stock.  With any profits Kalisa makes from this loan, he will reinvest into the business and continue to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children. Haidar has long experience in repairing generators so, in 2001, he decided to open his own maintenance shop. Now he has established a very good reputation and is well known in his community. He is requesting a $2500 loan to renovate his store so he can expand in the future and change his family's quality of life for the better.

loans.use: To renovate his store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He lives in Lebanon. He has been working in the construction field for the past twelve years. His work consists in wall foliage. He has been involved in this occupation for twenty years now. He cooperates with his wife who works as a household maid to satisfy the needs of the family.  

He works directly with construction entrepreneurs where he completes the concrete work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase iron scaffolding which will answer his business needs.

loans.use: to purchase iron scaffolding

loans.name: Elvis Ruperto

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Pítipo, perteneciente a la región Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a menos de1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura. El tiene un terreno propio que cultiva con la finalidad obtener productos de buena calidad para su posterior comercialización al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permite ayudar el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Elvis desea adquirir materiales e insumos para el cultivo de maiz amarillo duro. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elvis is a 31 year-old father who lives together with his family in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Pítipo, in Lambayeque region, less than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elvis works in farming.  He owns his own plot of land where he grows crops with the aim of obtaining good-quality products that he can then sell to the general public and the traders who usually visit his area.  This activity allows him to financially support his family.

Elvis would like to acquire materials and supplies for his yellow corn crop.  This will enable him to make bigger profits on his sales.  He is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire materials and supplies for growing yellow corn

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are five and seven years old. Both of her children attend school. Faida sells charcoal, which she has been doing for a period of seven years. Her husband works as a house builder. 

Faida will use the new loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Faida plans to set up a shop and continue to reinvest in the business of charcoal. In the future, she would wish to see all her children go further in their studies, assuming she will be able to pay school fees for them.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling products to her neighbours. Umazi faces a major challenge of high competition from other retail shop operators. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase two bundles of maize flour and a sack of sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring

loans.name: Tsatsral

texts.en:
Tsatsral is 27, married, and a micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and two children, aged two and four, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children attend kindergarten. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. For the past five years, she has supported her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband.

She began her business in 2005, and today her working capital is 2.6 million MNT. She purchases her products every three months from Ereen, a city that borders on China. She is friendly and has a lot of regular customers. She wants to expand her working capital with this loan, and to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to increase her clothing inventory for spring. 

Her goal is to improve her living conditions by building her own small house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory for spring.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia, 23, is married to J. I., who operates a livestock business. He has two cows and some goats and sheep. He sells their milk and also sells them for profit to butchers and other buyers. 

Shazia lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 12 years. She is a housewife, staying at home to take care of household responsibilities. She takes these responsibilities very seriously and makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family through her work. She is the mother of a six year old son, who is in school. Shazia is very fond of education but was unable to get one herself due to the poor circumstances of her parents. She wants to provide a quality education to her son so that he may become a successful person.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy cattle for resale. He has operated this business for the past six years and Shazia hopes that after the loan investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and result in a better financial condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a livestock business.

loans.name: Mrs. Bunsok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 people. Mrs. Bunsok is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member's portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 
Mrs. Bunsok is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice for her own family and to sell. She is also a beautician while her husband is a soldier. Since her business is getting on well, Mrs. Bunsok wants to expand it. Therefore, to improve her business, Mrs. Bunsok is applying for a loan to buy more beauty equipment. She is a mother of two children who are farmers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wood and posts, among other construction tools.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad. Desde hace veinte años, él vive con su esposa e hijo en una comunidad rural en etapa de expansión, donde la gente es muy trabajadora y su actividad principal es la agricultura y comercio de animales. Esta es la zona de Monsefú  - Lambayeque, una zona conocida, también, por sus magníficos artesanos y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Desde hace 17 años, Miguel se dedica a la venta de animales menores (patos, pollos, gallinas, cuyes)  y a la venta de leche fresca, debido a que cuenta también con un ganado vacuno.

Miguel solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles, que desea invertir en la compra de  productos para la alimentación balanceada de su ganado y animales y para arreglos de su establo, el cual le generará una crianza más óptima.

Miguel tiene buenas perspectivas para su negocio ya que su población de animales esta creciendo y el mercado donde se desenvuelve está en expansión. Además la gente de allí también se preocupa más por salir adelante económica y comercialmente. Los pasos a seguir es no descuidar su demanda y mejorar su producto para tener conforme a su clientela y seguir creciendo comercialmente.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 36-year old father and head of the household.  Since he was 20 years old, he has lived with his wife and child in a rural community that is in an expansion period.  The people are very hard working, their primary activity being agriculture and raising livestock.  This is the zone of Monsefú – Lambayeque, an area also known for its magnificent artisans and delicious food.

Since he was 17, Miguel dedicated himself to selling small animals (ducks, chickens, guinea pigs) and fresh milk, as he also has some cows.  

Miguel requests a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he wants to invest into buying balanced feed for his livestock and small animals, and to make repairs to his stable.  These efforts will allow him to raise his animals more optimally.

Miguel has good prospects for his business, as his population of animals is growing and the market where he conducts his business is expanding.  In addition, the people from there also preoccupy themselves more about getting ahead financially and commercially.  The steps to follow are to not neglect demand, to improve his product so his customers are happy, and to continue growing as an enterprise.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals and make repairs to his stable.

loans.name: Grissel Janina

texts.es: La Señora Grissel Janina tiene 37 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella, sus deseos son de prosperar en el negocio que tiene actualmente ya que este es el que le ha ayudado a salir adelante porque le ha proporcionado que sus hijos puedan estudiar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, hace más de 15 años, que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella inicia este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarles a sus hijos el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de granos básicos, fósforos, café, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes galletas y sopas.
texts.en: Mrs. Grissel Janina is 37 years old; she is married and has 2 children that live with her. She dreams of getting her business to succeed since it has helped her get ahead and given her children the opportunity to go to school. She has had a convenience store for over 15 years located in her home and Mrs. Grissel began the business to be able to give her children their daily meals. The loan is for work capital, to buy basic grains, matches, coffee, candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, cookies and soups.

loans.use: buy basic grains, matches, coffee, candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, cookies and soups.

loans.name: Las Palmitas (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmitas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace tres ciclos decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar el nivel de vida y ayudarse a financiar sus negocios, la mayoría de las personas que integran este banco se dedican a realizar trabajos de artesanía más que todo productos de paja toquilla y también se dedican al comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María Jesús, tiene  33 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijas de 11 y 7 años de edad que estudian en escuela. El marido es artesano. Para ella este es el cuarto ciclo en el banco Comunal le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.

Ella es artesana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que esta es una profesión que le encanta ya que sus obras además de continuar con una tradición de muchos años también sus sombreros son admirados en muchas partes del Ecuador y del mundo, aprendió esta profesión de sus padres y  estos de sus abuelos, lleva como 20 años que se dedica  a esta actividad  y esto lo hace junto a su esposo el cual también teje sombreros. Los sombreros una vez semiterminados los venden a  comerciantes que llegan hasta las Pampas a comprar a los artesanos para llevarlos a otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros.

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Palmitas" ["The Little Palms"] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place where the famous paja toquilla [or "Panama"] hats come from. 

This is a group of people who decided to come together, three loan cycles ago, and form this communal bank. It is very helpful for them, since with the loans they have been able to improve their standard of living and finance their businesses more effectively. Most of the members of this bank work creating handicrafts, above all paja toquilla products. Some are also involved in trade in general. 

In this place, we meet María Jesús, who is 33 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two daughters, aged 11 and 7, who are in elementary school. Her husband is an artisan. For her this is the fourth loan cycle in the communal bank. She likes it because of the help the institution gives its members. 

She is an artisan and works making and selling paja toquilla hats. She works every day, and she reports that it is a profession she loves, since her creations are not only part of a continuing tradition that is many years old, but also are admired in many parts of Ecuador and the rest of the world. She learned this profession from her parents, and they learned it from her grandparents. She has worked in this area for some 20 years, and she does it together with her husband, who also weaves hats. Once the hats are semi-finished, they are sold to businesspeople who arrive in the Pampas area to buy from the artisans and take the products to other cities. 
 
This loan is to buy paja toquilla to make the hats.

Her dream is that her children will have a good future.

loans.use: to buy paja toquilla fibers to make hats.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs.Dulamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in the city’s ger district. Her eldest daughter attends a school and her young son attends kindergarten. 

Dulamsuren owns a minivan and she runs a transportation business. She has a contract with a construction company to carry workers and builders to construction sites in the morning and  to carry them back home in the evening. She has been running this business for 9 years. Last year, together with her husband, she started a family house-building project. The project was stopped due to lack of funding and the coming winter time. The project is 70% complete and by the plan, the house will to be environmentally friendly and green. The house is made of wood. The loan Dulamsuren is taking will be used to buy windows, doors, insulation material, roof tiles, a central heating system which works without a coal fired stove and to complete the house.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors, insulation material, roof tiles, a central heating system which works without a coal-fired stove and to complete the house.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 36 years old, married and has one child.

Rona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for nine years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her variety store. Rona has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Heyran

texts.en:
Heyran is married and has one daughter. Her husband is unemployed. Heyran helps her husband to take care of their family. She sells everyday products in her grocery store, which is located in the central market of Sabirabad. She purchases goods two times a week. Her monthly income is about 250 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). 

Heyran would like to get a loan of 1,000 AZN for purchasing a new assortment of foods in order to expand her business and allow customers greater choice. This will be her second loan and she has a good credit history. She is a careful and responsible borrower of AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: purchase more products in order to increase her profit

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse est une femme qui vend des fruits sur une table au bord d’une route nationale très fréquentée. Elle s’approvisionne en fruits variés (mangues, melon…), selon la saison,  dans différentes  localités du pays. Son commerce lui permet tant bien que mal de nourrir ses enfants et d’appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle sollicite  son premier crédit à l’IMCEC et voudrait acheter 10 bacs de manques. Les bénéfices tirés de la vente de ces mangues l’aideront dans la prise en charge de ses propres besoins et de ceux de sa famille. Elle envisage dans le futur d’implanter une cantine de stockage et de vente de fruits et de produits agricoles.
texts.en: This borrower is a woman who sells fruit on a table along the very busy highway. She buys various sorts of fruit (mangoes, melons, etc.) according to the season, in different parts of the country. Her business allows her to feed her children, more or less, and help her husband cover family expenses. She is asking for her first loan from IMCEC and would like to buy 10 bins of mangoes. The profit from the sale of these mangoes will help her support herself and her family. In future, she plans to open up a shop stocking and selling fruit and other agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy 10 bins of mangoes.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married, has four children and has received a junior high education. Her husband is an electrician.

Ekua sells assorted products such as canned fish, boxed drinks, powdered milk, milk, soap and other items in Abura. Her loan of 630 GHS will be used to buy more of the same to resell.

Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to resell.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married and her husband deals in traditional Punjabi foods called samosay and pakoray. He has very good taste in his food and people from different areas of the city come to him to buy his products. 

Shazia is a housewife who spends her time at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she supports her husband in preparing samosay (made with gram flour and potatoes) and pakoday (also made with gram flour and served with yogurt & chili sauce). 

She is the mother of a 10-year-old son who stays at home with her. Shazia couldn't educate him due to financial constraints. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as gram flour, spices, and potatoes in bulk to be able to prepare better quality food items to increase his sales and profits. 

He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for more than two years. Shazia is confident about the positive growth of her husband's business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for producing Punjabi food for sale

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo, su hermano y sus dos hijos, todos en la familia trabajan, inicio con el trabajo hace mucho tiempo con el apoyo de su hermano, su forma de vender es ambulante y ha alcanzado experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, ya que desea ampliar la granja, para tener más oportunidades de ganancia.
Su objetivo es que a través de los préstamos pueda alcanzar el crecimiento con los dos negocios, incrementar la clientela y proveer para su familia la alimentación.
texts.en:
Ángel engages in selling clothes and in breeding pigs. She lives with her husband, their two children and her brother, and every member of the family has a job. She is an experienced street vendor, and she started this activity many years ago thanks to her brother’s support.
She is requesting a loan to buy pigs as she wants to expand her small farm in order to have better earning opportunities.
Her goal is to achieve the growth of both activities through the loans, as well as increase the number of her customers and to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy some pigs.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Being a father is to be responsible for supporting and providing for all family needs and giving one's family a better life. Likewise, Amor who is a father of three, aims to improve their standard of living and to give his family a better life. He has been a farmer for almost 38 years planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to financial difficulty, he has engaged in raising fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to generate additional income. 

He aimed to strengthen this business to have a stable source of income. He is asking for an additional capital of P40,000 to buy feed and additional fingerlings to raise. He believes that through this loan, he will able to improve the business as he continues to work hard and manage his business well. He hopes that in the future, he will make the business grow and their life will also improve.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to raise

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Aurelio es casado, tiene 45 años de edad, cursó el segundo grado de educación básica, se dedica  a la agricultura como también al comercio ya que cuenta con un tienda para la venta de artículos en general, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo para compra producto para una tienda, dulce, agua gaseosa, comida en lata, lácteos, y entre otros. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 45 years old, married, and studied up to the second year of 'educación básica' (approx. equivalent = 8th grade).  He farms and also sells products as he has a store where he sells general goods.  He started this business on his own initiative and he now has two years experience.  Aurelio has the support of his wife who works as a maid.

Aurelio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his store: candies, soda, canned goods, dairy products, etc.  In the future, he hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store

loans.name: Lisia Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Lisia es socia del banco comunal Las Divina del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo.
Lleva siete años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropa, las vende en los caseríos cercanos a su casa.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ½ docena de pantalones, 1 ½ de polos para varones, 6 camisas, 6 bivirís, 6 shores de tela.
Cada fin de mes tiene que venir a Pucallpa (Ciudad) para hacer sus compras, también atiende pedidos. Su esposo es docente de profesión y los dos trabajan y están ahorrando para la educación de su hijo y cualquier emergencia que se pudiera presentar.
Espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos, es puntual con sus pagos para que a fin de ciclo también pueda recibir los incentivos que dan a las socias puntuales.
texts.en:
Lisia is a member of the 'Las Divinas' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

Lisia has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for seven years.  Her business is selling clothes.  She makes her sales in the small villages near her home.  She will use her new loan for 1,300 soles to buy 1 ½ dozen pairs of pants (trousers), 1 ½ dozen men's polo shirts, 6 shirts, 6 undershirts and 6 pairs of shorts.

At the end of every month, Lisia has to go to the city of Pucallpa to make her purchases.  She also fills any orders.  Her husband is a teacher by profession.  The pair of them both work and are saving up so that they can pay for their son's education and cover any emergency that might present itself.

Lisia hopes to continue working with Manuela Ramos.  She is punctual in making her repayments so that, at the end of each loan cycle, she is able to receive the incentives that Manuela Ramos provide to members who make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes (tops, pants, shirts, etc).

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 38-year-old widow.  She was left with a four-year-old daughter to raise.

To be able to do that, Aziza started to sell cleaning materials and detergents in the neighborhood two years ago. Her business has been going well regarding supporting her kid.

Now Aziza is hoping to widen her business to be able to provide the bigger stores with detergents to make more profit, so she has applied for this loan to get the quantity of detergents she needs at a wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy more detergent at a wholesale price

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita comprarse material como hilo de seda de varios colores, para la confección de hamacas, además de cancelar una parte que le queda de un lote de terreno.
Ella ha realizado inversiones anteriores muy provechosas, ya que le han permitido abastecer la demanda por los clientes en hamacas, bolso, mantas decoradas.
texts.en:
Roxana has decided to request a new loan since she needs to buy material such as silk thread of various colors in order to make hammocks as well as to make the final payment for a parcel of land.

She has made some very profitable investments previously, which have enabled her to satisfy the demand from her customers for hammocks, bags and decorated blankets.

loans.use: to buy silk thread of various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Houy, age 44, is married and has two children who are still in school. She earns a living as a seller, selling food, mangoes, drinks and other fruits. She supplements her income by farming. She has been with her business for 17 years in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district. 

This is Houy’s first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She will also use some of this loan to increase her business by buying some fruits, drinks, etc. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield as well as her business, and also earn more income so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and food and drinks for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Maria, continua trabajando en su negocio, ella cuenta con toda la disposicion de esforzace para mejorar y crecer en el comercio de sus productos, actualmente esta solicitando un prestamo para la compra de cañamo, hilo plastificado, piedras de muchos colores, accesorios de cobre para elaborar las joyas de diferentes estilos, todos modernos.
Espera que esta nueva compra sea provechoza al igual que la anterior, permitiendole seguir teniendo buenas ganacias.
texts.en: Maria continues working in her business.  She puts all of her efforts into improving and increasing the sale of her products.  Currently, she is applying for a loan to purchase hemp, plasticized thread, stones of many colors, and copper accessories in order to manufacture jewelry of different styles, all of which are modern.   She hopes that this new loan will benefit her as much as the prior one, permitting her to continue having good earnings.

loans.use: to purchase hemp, plasticized thread, stones of many colors, and copper accessories.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is 60 years old.  She is a widow and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a cloth weaver and her daughter is a garment worker. Nget is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk to weave at home.  In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business, build a new house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk to weave at home.

loans.name: Richard Guillermo

texts.es:
Richard es un hombre muy trabajador, es por ello que el único pasatiempo que el tiene es su trabajo en su pequeño negocio de confección de prendas de vestir. Su vivienda y negocio están ubicados en la ciudad de Yungay, ubicada en la sierra peruana y la cual posee uno de los atractivos turísticos más hermosos de nuestro país, el cual es el Nevado de Pastoruri. Richard aprendió su oficio desde muy joven ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios primarios. Richard le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes al día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y tiene muy buenos acabados en sus confecciones.

Richard está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar telas por fardos para poder realizar sus confecciones, de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo y así seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una fábrica textil”.
texts.en:
Richard is a very hardworking man, and it's for this reason that his only hobby is working in his small tailoring workshop. His home and business are located in the city of Yungay, situated among the Peruvian mountains, which possesses one of the most attractive and beautiful tourist sites of the country: "el Nevado de Pastoruri [Pastoruri Mountain]." Richard learned his trade from a very young age, since due to limited financial resources, he only had a primary education. Richard works in his business around 10 hours a day and can attend up to 25 customers daily. He believes that his business is going well because he is polite to his customers and he has very good finishing touches with his tailoring. 

Richard is very grateful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support they have offered him, he will be able to buy fabric bundles to perform his tailoring. This way, he will be able to have the necessary materials in order to do his job, and so he will be able to continue striving to achieve his greatest dream: "to have a textile plant."

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Messo Mahou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MESSO MAHOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Afiavi Roseline (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Afiavi Roseline est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Cosme. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afiavi Roseline vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Afiavi Roseline vend des friperies. Afiavi Roseline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Afiavi Roseline ensemble avec les membres du groupe MESSO MAHOU sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Pastor Nicolas

texts.es: PASTOR NICOLAS: Es un joven sonriente, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado, con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita financiamiento para terminar de construir su vivienda de mini falda (concreto y madera). Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción: cemento, cerámica, inodoro. Su sueño es dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias.

loans.use: para terminar de construir su vivienda de mini falda (concreto y madera)

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Miss. Juliet I. is 30 years old. She loves her profession so well that she is always at the services of her customers. She needs $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing material

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born on 24 August 1974 in Vogan in Southwest Togo, Mr. Kossi D. is married and has one (01) child. Not having had the chance to pursue his studies and not having a job, he turned himself into a motorcycle taxi driver, but it is difficult for him to meet the needs of the household because his wife does not run a business. Wanting to buy a new motorcycle, he is asking for $800 in financial support.

This dream, once realized, will allow Mr. D. and his family to enjoy an improved standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 24 août 1974 à Vogan au sud-est du Togo, Monsieur D. Kossi est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. N’ayant pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études et sans aucun métier sous la main, il se transforma en conducteur de taxi moto mais c’est difficilement qu’il arrive à faire face aux besoins du ménage car sa femme n’exerce aucune activité. Voulant s’acheter une nouvelle moto, il sollicite un appui financier de $800.

Ce rêve, une fois réalisé, permettra à monsieur D. et à sa famille de connaître un niveau de vie plus amélioré.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw material and to pay suppliers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three bicycles for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith A. is 36 years old, married and a mother of six children.  She is a member of one of LAPO's unions.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene to people in her community.  She is seeking a loan US $400 to expand her business. She has three years of experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
L. S. went through a critical period of illness. Since he was unable to work at a job which required his daily presence, he also had no dependable means of resources. His friend suggested taco-making as a suitable occupation for him. So that is how L. started selling tacos, initially only during the weekends. Today, he opens his store daily. However, his medication costs are still expensive.

Thus, he seeks a loan of $925 to enlarge his business, buy more chairs and tables and raw ingredients used in tacos. The loan will be paid back in installments over 6 months. L. is grateful for your support that helps him to move forward in life and provide a positive future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

L. S., pasaba por una etapa muy crítica en su vida puesto que se encontraba muy enfermo y por lo tanto no podía trabajar en una empresa que le requiriera todo el día, y por lo tanto no contaba con recursos para sobrevivir. Así fue como un amigo de él se le acercó para comentarle que un puesto de tacos sería el comercio idóneo para que él se pudiera superar, y fue así como comenzó por vender los fines de semana, y hoy abre su local diariamente. Pero el gasto de sus medicinas no lo a podido ayudar a superarse.

Por eso hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $ 925 para poder ampliar el negocio, comprar más sillas y mesas, y material para elaborar los tacos. El préstamo lo está pidiendo a un plazo de 6 meses. L. te agradece la ayuda para que él pueda salir adelante en la vida y poder brindarle un futuro próspero a su familia.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and buy more chairs and tables

loans.name: Jamila Mohamed And Mariam Rajab Chande Group

texts.en: Jamila M. and Mariam R. C. are two entrepreneurs who do their business jointly. Jamila runs a restaurant and, at the same time, makes Kanga (a type of local attire made by tie and die). Mariam runs both a restaurant and a ladies' beauty salon in the Buguruni area. They have been involved in their respective businesses for the past six years, and are now asking for a loan of US$400 each to expand their business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 48 year-old Thereza B..  She is married with six children aged between 7 and 26.  In 2000, Thereza established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan D., 29, is married to Roni and has 2 children. She has a small shop at her house where she sells sandals on credit, but she also goes door-to-door to sell her sandals, earning about $5 a day. She is asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little sandal business

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mrs. Tim N., 28, owns a plot of farmland together with her husband. They work growing a variety of vegetables, making on average around $2.50 a day. Beside growing vegetables they still breed pigs for resale. So now they are currently requesting a loan to purchase food to reserve for pigs.

loans.use: To purchase food for pigs

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha A. is a 60-year-old married mother of six in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past three decades, she has earned a living and supported her children by selling scarves and cloths. Agatha travels to the nearby village of Kumasi to purchase these materials. She's requesting a loan of $675 U.S. dollars so she can buy in bulk and not have to make the journey to Kumasi as frequently. Agatha also hopes to save her profits, so she can rent a store one day; currently, she carries her goods on her head and walks through the village to sell them.

Agatha is a member of the group called St. Anthony. Members are accountable to each other in re-paying their loans, ensuring that every person will pay back the money they borrow.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and scarves to sell

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Gioconda R. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood Reparto Shick. She is married and has two children, one that is 14 years old and the other 19. Both of the children are in school. Gioconda sells fried foods. She began working in the “La Union” supermarket, but now works in the “Pali” supermarket.

With the requested loan Gioconda plans to repair the roof of her home which is in serious need of repair before winter arrives. In the future Gioconda hopes to increase her living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Gioconda tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 14 y 19 años de edad que están estudiando. La Sra. vende fritanga y inicio en el supermercado La Unión, y ahora esta en el supermercado Pali.

Con el préstamo desea construir y componer el techado de su casa ya que lo tiene en mal estado y desea estar preparada para este invierno. A futuro espera tener un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Ameliis asking for her 2nd refinancing to invest in improving her home (constructing a room). She works as an elementary teacher.

She has two children, the oldest is 16 and in his 4th year of secondary school, and the her younger daughter is 13 years old and in 5th grade of primary. Amelia is an exemplary mother to her children and the community, she feels grateful for the previous loan she received from this institution.

It is important to mention that this client not only is a teacher, she also works growing basic grains on her brother’s farm on the weekends. Her dream is to have a decent home, health, steady work and that her children continue studying in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Rosa Amelia está solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), se desempeña como docente de Educación primaria.

Tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 16 años de edad estudia su cuarto año de educación secundaria y la hija menor de 13 años estudia 5to grado; la profesora Amelia es una madre ejemplar con sus hijos y con la comunidad , ella se siente agradecida con el crédito anterior otorgado por la institución.

Es importante mencionar que esta cliente no solo se dedica a la docencia, tambien trabaja cultivando granos basicos en la finca de su hermano los fines de semana, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna, salud, estabilidad laboral, y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room on her home.

loans.name: Ivana Leonarda

texts.es:
Ivana makes blankets but weaves and braids them by hand. She takes orders by agreeing to the size and color desired by the customer. With regard to marital status, she is married; her husband is a construction worker but does not earn much. She has four children attending school.

Her home is located in the area Irpavi II of La Paz, but she does not own the land and serves as a caretaker. She must occupy a single room with her family (with the discomfort of many Bolivian families).

This is her fifth time seeking support from Impro and the third in which Kiva has given her their support. Ivana is very responsible. Despite having many expenses, she always pays her debts on time. The loan is intended for the purchase of raw materials (fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivana confecciona mantas pero las teje y trenza manualmente. Trabaja tomando pedidos, o sea, de acuerdo a la medida y color que requiere el cliente. En cuanto a su estado civil es casada (su esposo es albañil pero no gana mucho) y tiene 4 hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Su domicilio esta localizado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, pero el terreno no es de su propiedad por lo que ella hace de cuidadora y tiene que ocupar una sola habitación con su familia (incomodidad por la que pasan muchas familias bolivianas).

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita el apoyo de Impro y la tercera en la que Kiva le dará su apoyo. Ivana es muy responsable, a pesar de tener tantos gastos siempre paga a tiempo sus deudas. El crédito será destinado para la adquisición de materia prima (tela).

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric for blankets

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, a 57-year-old married father of four children, lives in the suburbs of Saida, a city in South Lebanon, where he owns a small grocery shop and has been a loyal client of Al Majmoua since 2001. With a series of loans always repaid on time, Ali has been able to expand his business quite impressively. Presently he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more merchandise and diversify his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and diversify the grocery store's inventory of goods

loans.name: Mwashamba's Tukubaliane Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 24 years old. She is married. She has been a charcoal seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business.

Mwashamba now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Harusi.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth nació el 12 de Julio de 1971 en Chanchamayo, Junín. A los 05 años de edad toda su familia emigró a la sierra, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 09 años de edad. Vive en la comunidad de Queñuani, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Gracias a la invitación de su amiga Teresa decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo. Desde hace 08 años se inició con un crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual aumentó su capital y compró 01 cabeza de ganado. Desde los 15 años de edad se fue a trabajar donde su tía quien le pagaba por su trabajo, con ese dinero se compraba ropa y ayudaba a sus padres porque eran muy pobres. Desde los 20 años de edad convive con su esposo y juntos empezaron con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, semanalmente compraban en la feria de Acora y vendían en la feria de Yunguyo. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de ají que traen del departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) y venden los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelamente se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno.

Con este crédito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 cabezas de ganado vacuno a S/.900 cada uno, y con el resto comprará 03 quintales de ají a S/.180 cada quintal. 

Su sueño es aumentar más ganado vacuno (mejorados) para obtener más ganancias y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born on July 12, 1971 in Chanchamayo, Junín. At 5 years old her family immigrated to the mountains where she completed primary school. She is married and a mother to a 16 year old daughter and a 9 year old son. She lives in the Queñuani community in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Thanks to the invitation of her friend Teresa, she decided to become a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. 8 years ago she began with her first loan of S/.300 Nuevos Soles, with which she increased her capital and bought 1 head of cattle. Since she was 15 years old she went to work for her aunt who paid her for her work, and with his money she bought clothing and helped her parents who were very poor. Since she was 20 she has lived with her husband and together they began a business buying and selling cattle. Weekly they would buy in the Acora market and sell in the Yunguyo market. For the past 7 years she has been selling chili pepper that they buy in Tacna and sell on Fridays in Desaguadero city, and at the same time she also raises and fattens cattle. With this loan for S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 head of cattle at S/.900 each, and with the rest she will buy 3 quintals (a quintal is approximately 46 kg) of chili pepper at S/.180 per quintal. Her dream is increase her cattle to obtain greater earnings and that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two head of cattle and three quintals of chili pepper

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira H. has one daughter and works as a hairstylist.  However, she is qualified to be teacher but found that she couldn't earn enough teaching high school students.  After taking lessons in hairstyling four years ago, she began renting a small stall and repaired the equipment herself.  Now she works with her daughter, who is also a talented hairstylist.  In order to purchase more sophisticated equipment and attract more customers, Nazira is requesting a loan of $800.

loans.use: To purchase hairstyling inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to support her current business

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Madame DAHOUE Amivi est âgée de 30 ans, et elle vend des tissus et des articles de mercerie dans son magasin qui s’appelle « MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE ».  L’entreprise est située à Lomé, la capitale du Togo ou Madame DAHOUE est née.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Avec ce premier crédit, elle peut reconstituer son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de la fin d’année. 
Madame DAHOUE est mariée avec un opérateur économique, et ils ont 6 personnes à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Amivi DAHOUE is 30 years old and sells cloth and sewing supplies in her store called "MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE". This enterprise is located in Lomé, the capital of Togo where she was born. She started this business in 2005 and has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan. With this initial loan, she can replenish her stock to serve her customers better during this year-end holiday season. Ms. DAHOUE is married to an economic controller, and they have six people in their care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and fabrics

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Mach's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in Chamka village in the Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan with Mrs. Lorn M. as the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Doeun Phuon, are farmers who own a plot of land T. cultivate both rice and vegetables. Even though they work hard, they still gather little rice revenue which cannot support their family very well. In order T. improve their living conditions, Mrs. Lorn M. decided T. ask for a loan T. buy three piglets T. start a breeding business. She is 53-years-old and the mother of two children, both who are attending the local school.

Ten members in this group loan are committed T. end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. It allows them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T. do so. Most clients start T. make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

Mrs. Sokun O., one of the loan participants, is represented by her husband in the phoT..

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Esfuerzate Y Sed Valiente 3 Group

texts.en:
