Margalena G. is the bank coordinator for "Esfuerzate y Sed Valiente" (Group 3). The bank operates in San Marcos, a neighborhood a little bit outside of the city of Puerto Plata. Her group is the newest addition to this community bank, bringing their total number to 15 members. These entrepreneurs will undertake a variety of businesses, mostly involving clothing and food sales.

Margalena is 43 years old and is married to a man her own age. They have three grown children and three grandchildren. Margalena is a very active woman and has not delayed in putting time into her business. Most people probably see their business as a mean to achieve something, but Margalena also sees her business as a passion. Over 20 years ago, she started a beauty salon in her own house and in the front of her house she has a small frituria - which means that she fries a variety of foods for sale. About 4 years ago she also started to buy and sell clothes and natural products like medicine and drinks. Sometimes she is so busy with everything she is involved in that her husband and friends help her out. "I simply love to do business," she says.

San Marcos is a poor neighborhood, but the participants in the group think their economy has improved lately and that loans from Esperanza are one important reason for this improvement. It is no wonder that they have chosen Margalena as their coordinator. She is energetic and the one that has the most experience running a business.

With her upcoming loan, Margalena wants to expand her businesses, in particular she wants to sell more clothes. By being responsible with her loan, her businesses, family, group, and neighborhood will have more opportunity to prosper.

loans.use: Expand her fried food business and continue a new business activity: natural products sales

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, 44 years old, is married to Paul A., a church pastor in their village. In the past few years, they lived in Mountain Province, Philippines. But now, they came to settle for good in Barangay Del Pilar, where there are more livelihood opportunities. They were blessed with five children, namely; Enrique, 21 years old, a college graduate and an account officer in a banking corporation; Winnielyn, a domestic helper abroad who, at her young age of 19, also helps her husband with their family; Phoebe, 8 years old, now entering the second grade in the primary level; and the youngest, Valerie, 2 years old. The family is a God-fearing one. Magdalena envisions bringing her family closer to God for she believes in this Bible passage: “Trust in the Lord and He will direct your path.”

Madalena manages a store in their current village retailing gasoline, lubricants (for automobiles), and “bagoong” (a type of kitchen spice) for almost 11 years. Her weekly income from the business has an average of PHP1,000, which is not enough to support the education of her children since they don’t have other sources of income. She would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to add to her business revolving capital. She plans to also purchase  some bottled drinks and snacks to increase her weekly income to meet all her family’s necessities. Magdalena is hoping and praying that some day their living situation will become progressive by working hard and motivating her family members to work together in combating life’s difficulties.

loans.use: To increase business Capital

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул, удачно закончил первый кредит и решил повторно получить займ на проведение ремонта квартиры. Первый кредит он использовал для оплаты обучения дочери, который пунктуально завершил. У Абдурасула  пожилая мать , у которой квартира требует ремонта. Поэтому Абдурасул как единственный сын начал ремонт, но у него произошла нехватка финансов. Для чего он и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Abdurasul, having successfully paid back his first loan, decided to take out another loan to do apartment repairs. He used his first loan to finance his daughter's education, and paid it back on time. Abdurasul has an elderly mother whose apartment is in need of repair. Therefore, Abdurasul, as his mother's only son, began the repairs, though he doesn't have enough money. For money, he has come to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: apartment repairs

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah R. is 30 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children. Two of her children are currently in school while the youngest is still breastfeeding. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in the central region of Ghana. 

Hannah is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian people enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. 

Cape Coast region is one of the difficult regions in Ghana. The government is trying to alleviate the poverty rate there so that the economically active poor can also provide for their families. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy supplies including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Мирзоходжаев 1977 года рождения. Женат имеет 2 детей. Он дома содержит скот. Раньше во время советского союза  работал мастером в цеху. После распада Союза остался без работным и занялся скотоводством. Сейчас более 15 лет дома ухаживает за скотом и разводит. По совместительству мастерит неисправленные  холодильники.  Семья помогает   ухаживать за скотом.  В Микроинвест обратился 1 год назад.
texts.en:
Yusuf Mirzohodjaev was born in 1977. He is married and has two children. He keeps cattle at his home. During the Soviet Union times she used to work as a repairman in a shop. After collapse of the Soviet Union he became unemployed and started an animal husbandry business. At this time it has been more than fifteen years since he has being taking care of and breeding cattle. He also repairs broken refrigerators with a partner. His family helps him to keep after cattle. He first came to MicroInvest one year ago.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita R. es cliente antigua desde el año 2001, demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en su pagos, a la fecha se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia de credito individual, ella se dedica a repartir sombreros y mantas de vicuña, animal tipico de la codillera de los Andes. Ella vive con sus hijos, dos menores que estudian y otros dos mayores que son casados, todos ellos pero independientes. aunque el último de sus hijos quedó viudo y ella se dedica a cuidar al bebé que tuvo.La Sra. Benita R. vive en casa propia y es muy conocida por los vecinos. Su actividad la realiza con sus vecinos y toda persona que le hace el pedido, su cobro es a plazos.
texts.en:
Benita R. has been a customer since the year 2001, always demonstrating punctuality and responsibility in her payments. On the date when she found herself in her fourth round of individual credit, she decided to sell vicuña hats and blankets. Vicuña is a typical animal from the Andes mountain range. She lives with her children, two younger ones who study and the other two older ones who are married and are independent. Although, the last of her children is a widow and she is dedicated to take caring of his baby. Benita R. lives in her own home and is well known by her neighbors. She does business with her neighbors and anyone else who places an order at collection time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hats for cholitas (indigenous women)

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Турсунов Саиджон- мужчина 47 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом скота. У Саиджона имеется  рисовые поля которые дает хороший прибыль ему. Жена Саиджона не где не работает она занимается домашнем хозяйством и присматривает за скотом. Старшую дочку Саиджон выдала замуж теперь накопив денег хочет женит сына который находится на заработках в Казахстане .
texts.en:
Saidjon T. is a 47 year old man. He is married and is the father of 2 children. He fattens livestock. Saijon has rice fields that give him a good profit. Saidjon’s wife does not have a job; she takes care of the house and watches over the livestock. Saidjon married off his older daughter and now having saved money he would like to marry off his son who is earning money in Kazakhstan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten livestock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N., 42 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Son activité est le petit commerce. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du riz, de l’huile et du thé pour renforcer son activité et améliorer sa participation dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou N., 42, is married and raising 5 children. Her business is petty trading. She wants a loan to buy rice, oil, and tea to bolster her business and be better able to contribute to supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of rice, oil, tea, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Bancomunal 24 D. Octubre.  
Gregoria es casada tiene cuatro hijos D. 28, 26, 25, y 23 años que trabajan 
Gregoria  antes solo se dedicaba a su casa, hasta que se mudo y en su casa propia puso una bodega  D. venta D. abarrotes, su negocio ha crecido por que ahora ella venD. productos D. bazar.
DesD. que Gregoria esta en Finca le ha ido bien su capital aumentó, aprendió ha invertir y como llevar su negocio. 
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles para la compra D. víveres para su bodega, arroz, azúcar, harina 
El sueño D. Gregoria es vender al por mayor por que la mercadería se mueve rápido.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the village bank 24th of October. She is married and has four children ages 28, 26, 25 and 23 who all work. Gregoria was a full-time homemaker until she moved and set up a general store in her own house. Her business has grown because she now sells domestic products. Since Gregoria has been with FINCA things have gone well for her-- her capital has increased, and she has learned to invest and how to run her business. Gregoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy supplies for her store like rice, sugar and flour. Gregoria's dream is to sell wholesale because the merchandise sells quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her general store including rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy E. is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Khen Sokh Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This loan will benefit 13 people in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province, all of whom will use it to operate or expand their businesses. Mrs. Khen S. will use the loan to buy food for her pigs in order to support her current business of pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Um Ros, is a taxi driver who makes a small income to support the family and also helps his wife with her business. Mrs. Khen S. is 42 years old and has three children, two of whom wO. in a car wash while the youngest attends the local school.

One member of this group has applied for an end-of-term loan, which means he is not required to pay any principal on the loan until it is due. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans

loans.use: To support various small busineses, including one that breeds pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Elena es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Elena viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que vende en el mercado Nery.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y blusas.
Los sueños de Elena son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Elena, 36, is married and has six children. Elena travels to different regional fairs to sell various clothes. At the fairs she buys grains, cheese, and other products to sell in the Nery market. She needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy pants and blouses. Elena’s dreams are for her children to become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and blouses

loans.name: Ananita

texts.en: Although she has only one child, who is now of adult age, Mrs. Ananita H. strives hard to provide for her small family. At 52 years old, married, and a resident of Sebucao Diutay, Barangay. Sebucao, San Enrique, Negros Occidental, Ananita is not only working for the present needs of her family by helping supplement the income of her husband, she is also making plans for her old age. Four years ago, Ananita started a general store which provides a steady income for her family. In addition, she also started raising pigs in her backyard and she used the profits from the pig raising to capitalize on a third business venture - direct selling of a networking product. From these three business activities, she earns an average amount of PHP 6,000 per month, which is enough to cover the college expenses of her only child, and the balance she plowed back into her business. She manages her cash flow well and was able to pay off her last loan of PHP 12,000 without missing a payment. Now, for her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ananita is borrowing another PHP 12,000 so that she can continue expanding the operations of her three business activities. She is very thankful that she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because it has made a big difference in her family's quality of life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de matériels de maçonnerie

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mr. Mao C. is single and lives in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil, which is bad for his crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Mao C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. He will use the rest of the money to buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, piglets and pig food

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old, married and blessed with four children. She operates a cereal business located at Mbururu in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by existing group members. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy maize stock. Her dreams are to buy land and build a house where her family can settle.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia O. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Letecia is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 45-year-old widow with six children aged from 15 to 20 years, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children.

Kasifa works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She incurs transport costs to and from her work in Nakawa market. She has a stall selling yellow bananas and buys from her place of work from suppliers who get them from the villages. She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays daily market dues of 800 UGX per day worked.

Kasifa works seven days a week. She receives an average of ten customers a day and sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season which hinders her from reaching her customers.

Kasifa has been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for nine years and is servicing her thirtieth loan, working with the same group members. Kasifa joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas.

Kasifa is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only and also to getting permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells baby clothes and shoes. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 26 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a commercial driver.  As a LAPO client, Joy is a recipient of LAPO's commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more baby clothes for her shop. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes for her shop

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranjana P. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Ranjana P. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Sanu Babu P., is a farmer. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and the younger son in grade 2.

Mrs. Ranjana is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already owns two cows and sells the cow’s milk in her neighborhood. Nowadays, in that region, the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly. To meet the demands of her customers she needs another young milk-giving cow, so she is requesting a 10,000 NPR loan to buy a young milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Flor De Tuna Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Flor D. Tuna” esta representado por la señora Virginia y compuesta por 11 miembros muy trabajadores y emprendedores, cada uno D. los socios tiene una familia que mantener es por esto que todas las mañanas salen al mercado a vender sus productos con la esperanza D. poder generar una ganancia para mantener en pie sus hogares. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la comercialización y elaboración D. artesanía, costura D. mochilas y carteras, a la venta D. verduras y productos para hogar como detergentes, abarrotes y electrodomésticos. En el mercado en el cual desarrollan sus actividades existe bastante competencia por lo que alguna vez las socias deben mover sus puestos D. venta a zonas periféricas para poder rescatar su capital e incrementar sus ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. trabajo y la compra D. mercadearía e insumos para agrandar sus negocios y multiplicar sus ventas generando así un mejor ingreso que permita darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia del grupo una gran mayoría ya trabajo bajo la modalidad D. bancos comunales gracias a créditos similares, estando agradecidos con la Institución por el apoyo económico y la confianza brindada ya que eso representa que puedan seguir creciendo y poder soñar con un futuro mejor para sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the group Flor D. Tuna are respresented by Mrs. Virginia and is maD. up of 11 hard-working and entreprenurial members. Everyone in the group has a family to support and this why every morning they go to the market to sell their products with the hope of earning enough money to mantain their homes. The majority of the members work selling and making crafts, sewing bags and wallets, vegetables, and products like detergent, groceries, and appliances. In the market where they sell their products their is a lot of competition, so the members plan to move their stands to peripheral areas to increase their sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of products and supplies to grow their businesses and increase their sales thus generating better incomes so they can proviD. for their families. The majority of the group has experience working with different community banks and are thankful to the institution por the monetary support and trust placed in them. This support and trust will allow them to continue growing and dream of a better future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 39-year-old widow and mother of one child. After the death of her husband, a friend of her who owns a clothing shop helped her by offering a job. She gave her a number of clothes to sell and earn a percentage of the sales. In 2008, after 5 years at this job, Abir started selling clothes from her home as a business and she has been doing a well. 

Today, Abir is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a supply of clothes for the new season to attract more clients and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy a supply of clothes for the new season

loans.name: Olubumi

texts.en: Olubumi is a hardworking woman. She opens her stall daily from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. to sell drinks and juice to her customers. She loves this business because she has the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Mayini Claribel

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	En la comarca Rodeo grande sector las marías grandes la señora Margiany Clarivel E. M., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a la producción agropecuaria dentro de la cual desarrolla numerosos rubros productivos los que le aseguran su bien estar familiar y proveen de recursos necesarios como su alimentación y vestimenta, dentro de estos rubros destaca la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar así como los cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo que a demás de facilitarle sus alimentos básicos constituyen también una fuente de ingreso adicional, estos rubros los realiza en las épocas de invierno y verano con jornadas de 6 a 2 de la tarde todos los días.
Con el financiamiento pretende terminar de mejorar el techo de su casa y pintarla, ya que actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones y de esta forma mejorar su vida social y ofrecer un hogar digno asu pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.
texts.en:
Margiany Clarivel E. M. has been a farmer for most of her life in Rodeo Grande, Las Marías Grandes. She is involved in a variety of productive activities that insure her family's wellbeing and makes it possible for her to feed and clothe them; among which are: sheep, pig and fowl raising as well as farming subsistence crops like corn, sesame and sorghum. These crops, besides providing for the family's basic nutritional needs, also constitute an additional source of income. She works both Winter and Summer seasons from 6am to 2pm every day. She will use the funds to finish roofing and to paint her house because it's currently not in very good conditions. She will thus improve her social life and provide a proper home to her 2-year-old son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nasreen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Bushra parveen wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Kaniz wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Kalsoom wants a loan to buy a new donkey cart for loading. Yasmeen wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen akhtar is the group leader for the  above-mentioned ladies. They all live in Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan.

Nasreen operates a cloth-selling business. Once a month she travels to various cities (Lahore & Multan) and purchases the cloth. She receives orders from her community. Her income allows her to meet the family's expenses, together with her husband. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a loader by trade. He used a donkey cart for his loading business. He transports items such as construction supplies and delivers them to the required places. His work gives him Pak Rs. 8,000 every month. Now he is facing a problem: his cart has become rough and rotted in different areas which creates a hurdle in his work. So Nasreen is applying for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 to buy a new donkey cart for her husband so he can better do his business.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng M., age 30, and her husband, Mr. Moeng Meas, age 32, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have three daughters. The eldest daughter attends school. Besides her children, Loeng also has her mother-in-law living with her.
 
Loeng has been a garment factory worker for eight years while her husband has been a construction worker for ten years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa M. is thirty-seven years old, married, and the mother of three. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Tsetsegmaa operates a meat-trading business at a local market. She has been operating her business since 1997, and she has expanded her business steadily. When she began her business, her working capital was 50,000 MNT, and now, as a result of hard work, it has increased to 620,000 MNT. Tsetsegmaa built a new house with her business profits in 2007. She is an open and very hardworking person. Tsetsegmaa says, “With my business profit, I have been able to allow money for my oldest son's medical treatment which he has to have every year. In addition, I have been providing money for my family expenses.” Tsetsegmaa is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT, with which she will purchase a variety of meat at wholesale prices for resale at her counter.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more hair products, slippers and clothes

loans.name: Militona

texts.en:
Militona P., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Eugenio P., a retired pensioner, they are blessed with three children. She helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while having a direct selling business for a popular clothing and cosmetics brand as a sideline.

Militona has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business for buying larger quantities of products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying a large quantity of products to be incorporated into her current inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 39-year-old woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with four children and looks after a family of eight people. She dreams of educating her children and also accumulating wealth so as to become a rich lady.

Evelyn operates a retail shop in which she sells sugar, salt and rice. She would like to have it as a wholesale shop one day with big business volumes. She says she can achieve that feat because even the retail shop she operates was started with a small amount of capital, but it has now grown over the ten years she has operated it.

For now though, Evelyn has a challenge of taking her children back to school in terms of the school requirements. She intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede 2 Group

texts.en:
Nicolasa is the coordinator of her group, Dios todo lo pueD. 2 (For God Everything is Possible), and her story is representative of her group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is a free trading zone and a cement factory, but both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure being a divorced mom with her two children.

Nicolasa is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her retail business where she sells cosmetics, natural medicine and other personal products. She will use the profits to buy more products and in the future to build her own shop and buy a vehicle for her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To invest in her cosmetics and natural medicine business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is from the village of Brgy. 2, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 41 years old. Elsa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em P. is a 34-year-old rice grower from the Kompong Cham Province. (Her husband also appears in the photo.) She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbages, rice, potatoes and morning glories. She sells the crops to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. 

Em P. has four school-aged children. All four of them are students but work on the farm when they are free from school. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Em P. does not have enough farm supplies to use on her field. Em P. is therefore asking for capital to use toward purchasing fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To use toward purchasing fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía del menor D. sus 5 hijos, pues el resto se independizaron y trabajan en la ciudad. DesD. muy joven aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para obtener una productiva cosecha, es por esta razón que en la actualidad siembra arveja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, y dice que le gusta mucho su labor porque trabaja en compañía D. su hijo, y juntos vigilan sus cultivos todos los días con los primeros rayos del sol. Dice que la recompensa a su labor constante la observa durante la época D. cosecha, pues obtiene productos naturales D. calidad que venD. a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen D. la ciudad. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas D. insectos y recuerda con tristeza como alguna vez perdió casi toda su producción por esta razón. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora que siempre piensa en el futuro, ya tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando, además se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo D. su grupo comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy organizados y responsables. Zenovia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. semilla D. arveja y papa, además para esta campaña piensa contratar trabajadores para producir en mayor cantidad, D. esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Zenovia, who is 64 years old, lives in her own house with 5 of her children. The rest live by themselves and work in the city. When she was very young she learned the farming techniques necessary for a productive harvest. It is for this reason that she currently plants peas, potatoes, corn and other vegetables. She says that she likes this work a lot because she works with her son and together they keep watch of the crops every day starting at sun rise. She says that the reward of her constant labor is to watch during harvest time since she gets good quality fresh products which she sells at regular prices to the wholesalers who come from the city. The part she doesn't like is the many times is when they don't treat her crops adequately and the crops are infected with plagues of insects. She sadly remembers one time when she lost almost all of her products for this reason. As she is a very enterprising woman who always thinks about the future, she already has a plan to plant in larger quantities to increase her earnings. This is the third time she has gotten a loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who maD. this loan possible and allowed her to continue progressing. Also, she feels very satisfied with the work of her communal group because all the members are very organized and responsible. Zenovia plans on investing the loan she is requesting in buying pea and potato seeds. Also for this season she hopes to contract workers to produce in larger quantities and, in this way, she hopes to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds and contract workers to help with planting

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aly S. est marié à une femme et est  père de 6 enfants (3garçons et 3 filles). Il est né vers 1963 à Brimado et est domicilié à Loulouni, une des  sous- préfecture de la préfecture de Kadiolo, (3eme région administrative du Mali).  Il vit dans sa maison avec son épouse et leurs enfants.
Il est commerçant  de céréales depuis 10 ans Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, il le mène avec  beaucoup de réussite. En plus du commerce il cultive près de 5 hectares de céréales pendant l’hivernage (sorgho et maïs).
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt  2 tonnes et 1/2 de céréales (maïs). Il s’approvisionne à Loulouni et dans les villages avoisinants.
Il vend au comptant et souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de quelques consommateurs. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Aly S. is married and the father of six children (three boys and three girls). He was born around 1963 in Brimado and lives in Loulouni, one of the sub-prefectures of the Kadiolo Prefecture (third administrative region of Mali). He lives in his own home with his wife and children. He has been a grain merchant for the past ten years. With the commercial experience accumulated over the years, he is quite successful in managing his business. In addition to his commerce he cultivates five hectares (about 12 acres) of grain cereals (sorghum and corn) during the winter season. This is his second collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, and the preceding loan was duly reimbursed. His loan will be used to buy two and a half tons of cereal (corn). He gets his supplies from Loulouni and neighboring villages. He sells for cash and often for credit (wholesale and retail) mainly to dealers and to a few individual customers. He is projecting monthly earnings of 100,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to increase his working capital and the remainder put into savings, because his ambition is to build a residential house in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal

loans.name: Por La Gracias De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Por la Gracia a Dios está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Jojana Isabel C. M. vende chiverías, elotes y comida desde hace 7 años. Ella trabaja junto a su hija, mamá y marido los cuales le ayudan. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Mercedes R. vende desde hace cinco años y Yadira Elisabeth Cortes M. quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The “Por la Gracia de Dios” (By the Grace of God) group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Jojana Isabel C. M. is one of them. She has been selling snacks, corn on the cob, and food for seven years. She works with her daughter, her mother, and her husband; they help her. María Mercedes R. is another member of the group. She has been selling for five years. Yadira Elisabeth Cortes M., the other member of the group, sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, meat, corn on the cob, and snacks, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen estudió corte y confección y lleva 26 años dedicada a este oficio  se inicio con este trabajo debido a los problemas familiares , es por ello que hasta hoy en día ella se esmera mucho y apoya a su esposo que trabaja como obrero en diversas actividades y juntos lograron darles la mejor educación a su hijos como también sus alimentos y otras necesidades básicas, Agradece a una querida amiga, quien la ayudó económicamente para adquirir un maquina de coser, desde aquel momento ella pudo comprar sus materiales de trabajo y así fue mejorando sus ingresos, hoy en día sus 59 años de edad, casada y con 07 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes la  apoyan con los gastos de su casa, ella sueña mas adelante comprar una maquina industrial y poner un taller de confección mas amplio y  aprender hacer diseños de modas. Carmen se apoya con el programa prosperidad de Edaprospo pues debe invertir en diversos insumos para poder trabajar, ella se reporta puntual y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en: Carmen studied dressmaking and has been dedicated to this job for 26 years. She started with this job due to problems in the family which is why nowadays she does her best and supports her husband who works as a worker in diverse jobs. Together they were able to give their children the best education as well as food and other basic necessities. She is thankful for a dear friend who helped her economically with obtaining a sewing machine. From that moment on she was able to buy her materials and began improving her profit. Nowadays at 59 years old, married, and with 7 children who are all independent and who help with house payments, she dreams of buying an industrial sewing machine and open up larger workshop and learn how to design clothes. Carmen finds support in the prosperity program of Edaprospo since she has to invest in diverse supplies to be able to work. She proclaims herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: The purchase of an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
Misbah lives in a two-room brick house in Gujranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. She is a very talented lady and operates a business of stitching soccer balls. She collects orders from different manufacturing factories and earns well by sewing their footballs on time. She does this work to help her husband financially.  

Her husband, M. Y., has a business of selling bedsheets. He buys bedsheets from the cities of Multan and Lahore and sells them in different areas of the community to generate income.  He has been doing this business for the last five years.  

Misbah is the mother of three daughters and two sons. Three of them couldn’t manage to get an education. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy bedsheets in bulk quantity and increase his sales.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Ramón A. C. él es trabajador activo de la empresa Contratista “Jairo Agustín Vargas Mendoza” desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene  tres años de trabajar para esta empresa, es Acompañado actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón A. C. has worked for three years as a security guard at Jairo Agustín Vargas Mendoza's business.  He is married and has two school aged children.  

He has had four loans with CEPRODEL, which he has used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his home.  Those loans have benefited him a lot because he has improved his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials: sand, cement, and stone

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is 64 years old and married to Joseph. She supports her mother-in-law and her husband does farming on their family land. Mary raises rabbits and sells them at a profit, which has been her business for two years and brings her an income of 4,000 KES a month.

This is Mary's first loan with KADET and she intends to buy building materials to expand the rabbit pen. She hopes to start rearing broilers in the near future.

loans.use: To buy building materials to extend the rabbit pen.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: M. Angela lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, three of whom are in school. Angela has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Angela sells her products from home, by means of retail. Angela has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of oranges, mangoes and cabbage. She also generates additional income through her restaurant. The main business challenge(s) for Angela include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing fruits and vegetables. Angela lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of oranges, mangoes and cabbage

loans.name: Hloniphile Group

texts.en:
Bongekile is 36 years old and single with two children, ages four and thirteen. She also takes care of three relatives. She runs a business selling chickens at home and tupperware door to door in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

She has been running this business for two years and faces the challenge of finding enough chickens to keep in stock. She has requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase additional chickens and tupperware to resell. She hopes that her business will grow and that this loan will help her to get a car for her business and provide more food for her family. 

Bongekile is the leader of her group of five borrowers and is on the far left in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and tupperware for resale

loans.name: Nchoonga Taratia

texts.en:
Nchoonga Taratia, aged 46 years, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado. She is married to Taratia N., aged 50 years. He is a farmer and together they have three children: Sapatu, aged 19 years and in college; Noela, aged 15 years and in form one; and John, aged 12 years and in class six. Nchoonga was introduced to KADET by the staff of KADET. 

Nchoonga has been in this livestock-trading business for a period of eight years and her monthly profit is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs). She is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 from KADET. She intends to use Kshs 10,000 to purchase cows and Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, both for trade. If the loan boosts the business, Nchoonga will pay school fees for her children.

Nchoonga hopes to start dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat N. is divorced and lives with her two children, one of whom is a young child and one of whom is married and earning an income of approximately $ 1.25 each day. She earn her income by farming. She would like to try planting a dry-season rice field, but does not have capital to do so yet. To solve this problem, Khat N. would like a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Amenatu

texts.en: Amenatu A. sells food supplies like gari (which is made from cassava) and maize at Breman, near Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband with the payment of the family's expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of gari and maize for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of gari and maize for sale.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires avec  AMINATA M.. 
AMINATA M.   compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 paquets de cube maggi et 10 paniers de tomates fraiches. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les condiments sont revendus au  marché de N’TDJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
texts.en:
The ten members of the JIGUISSEME group are all married women, averaging 30 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in N’TDJILLA, a village in the NIENA prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Both previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells various items such as food condiments, as does AMINATA M..


AMINATA M. intends to use her loan to buy 2 packs of "Maggi" bouillon cubes and 10 baskets of fresh tomatoes. She gets her supplies at the grand market in NIENA. She resells the condiments for cash, at her home and at the N’TDJILLA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy and resell food condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more corn for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Elizabeth; La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, (22,20); la socia es docente y actualmente ella enseña en el colegio Comercio 41 de señoritas; la socia pertenece a este banco comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta reunirse con sus amigas con este motivo, ella comenta que es un grupo alegre, ameno y muy bien organizado; la socia con este crédito desea invertir en la educación de sus hijos, ellos están en la universidad y la socia junto a su esposo se hacen cargo de los estudios de sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Amauta Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and has two children (22 and 20).  She is a teacher, and she is currently teaching at the Comercio 41 school for girls.  She has belonged to this communal bank for ten years.  She likes getting together with her friends regarding her communal bank.  She says that the group is happy, agreeable, and very well organized.

She wishes to use the loan to invest in her children’s education.  They are attending the university.  She and her husband take responsibility for their children’s education.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her children’s education.

She is happy with the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Kuntaai

texts.en:
Kuntaai L. is 51 years old and married to Kanino, also a farmer; they have five children. Kuntaai is a very scrupulous woman who practices land farming in Oleserian-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over fifteen years and earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES.

Kuntaai is applying for a second loan, and she plans to use the entire loan amount to buy farm materials. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees.

Kuntaai hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm materials

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 35 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend and has 4 children. She was not able to attend school herself, but all her children are currently in school. Her partner works as a teacher. 

Amelia has a business selling soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and other small products, which she has had for 5 years. Some days the business is good and some others it's very slow. She started the business when her brother gave her some money. Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  

Amelia has requested a loan to purchase toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap. In the future, Amelia hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 50 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 10 años posee un establo donde cría vacas y toros, esta modesta campesina, trabaja diariamente, extrayendo la leche de sus vacas, de la que son vendidos a sus vecinos y a pequeñas empresas lácteas, donde elaboran queso y yogurt. Con la ayuda de sus hijos sale todas las mañanas a cortar el pasto, que es el alimento para sus animales, además que también la apoyan en el ordeño y en la limpieza del establo. Por otro lado, luego de 3 meses de engorde a sus toros, son vendidos o alquilados para realizar el arado en los campos. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es rentable y puede disponer de sus horarios para atender a su familia, por ahora su mayor prioridad es incrementar la cantidad de reses que tiene para aumentar la producción de leche. Es su crédito número 6 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque tiene confianza en ellos que es un grupo sólido y muy responsable en sus pagos, por su parte siempre ha demostrado ser puntual  por lo que sigue siendo considerada un elemento importante en su grupo y se compromete para lo sucesivo ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito comprará calaminas y madera para arreglar la infraestructura de su establo.
texts.en:
Eva is 50 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  For more than ten years, she has owned a stable where she raises cows and bulls.  This modest farmer works every day, milking the cows, which is then sold to her neighbors and small dairies where they make cheese and yogurt.  With the help of her children, she goes out every morning to cut the grass, which is the feed for the animals.  They also help her with the milking and cleaning the stable. After fattening them for three months, her bulls are sold or rented to plow fields. She likes that her work is profitable and she can arrange her schedule so she can care for her family.  

For now, her priority is to increase the quantity of cattle she has to increase milk production.  This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to be part of her community bank because she has confidence that they are a strong group and they will be responsible with their payments.  For her part, she has always been on time, so she continues to be considered an important part of the group.  She promises to be punctual with her payments for this loan.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase tin sheets and wood to fix the infrastructure of her stable.

loans.use: to purchase tin sheets and wood to improve the infrastructure of her stable.

loans.name: Isabelia Inés

texts.es:
Isabelia Inés A. G. se considera una luchadora, pues desde hace algunos años se dedicó a su tienda en la que ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, su negocio nació de la necesidad de contribuir con el pago de los gastos del hogar, pues lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus 3 hijos. 

A sus 55 años de edad, Isabelia se siente orgullosa de su labor y de su contribución a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pues como ella misma lo afirma aunque no viven muy bien por lo menos les alcanza para comer y para vivir dignamente. 

En el futuro Isabelia espera tener una gran tienda que sea reconocida en el sector y que le permita generar mayores ingresos y para ir construyendo ese sueño necesita de un préstamo que le permitirá comprar mayor variedad de productos para incrementar sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabelia Inés A. G., age 55, is a hardworking woman who several years ago started a convenience store where she offers various basic household products. She started this business because she had to help out with paying family expenses -- her husband's salary was not enough to provide for the basic needs of Isabelia and her three children.

Isabelia is proud of her work and her contribution towards the well-being of her family. As Isabelia likes to say, though they do not live very well, at least they have enough to eat and to live decently.

In the future, Isabelia would like to have a store that is well-known in her neighborhood and that would allow her to have a greater income. In order to keep building this dream, Isabella needs a loan that would allow her to purchase a greater variety of products, whereby helping her to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of basic household products

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es: Mireya de 42 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 20 años, vive  desde hace 25 años, en casa de sus suegros ubicada  en uno de los barrios más populares y alegres de la ciudad, donde la música compartida y el folclor caribe son el escenario propicio de sus habitantes. En este escenario hace 7 años inició su negocio de vender mercancías variadas, experiencia aprendida de su hermana a quien le ayudó durante dos años, cuando no estaba afiliada a empresas que vendían sus productos mediante guías especializadas. Cuando se independizó ya conocía el mercado y la forma de negociar, fue así como ingresó vendiendo mediantes catálogos y llegó a ser coordinadora de equipos de asesores de ventas, donde ha logrado muchos premios por su gestión. Ella comercializa cosméticos, interiores y hasta electrodomésticos menores, ropa y calzado;  con las utilidades obtenidas de este negocio,  Mireya ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar y manejar su propio capital. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y el dinero no le alcanza muchas veces, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes que cada día crecen, por eso ella acude a los financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su credikiva es el tercero, con el cual  comprará medicina natural, productos de belleza y ropa aprovechando los descuentos de productos que en sus manos rotan rápidamente, para poder trasladar los descuentos a las mercancías que vende,  con tal de ofrecerle un buen precio a sus clientes rentables.  Su sueño es tener su casa propia y lograr que sus hijos tengan una educación que les permita ser exitosos en el futuro. Con sus anteriores financiamientos ha fortalecido su negocio y con ello su autonomía y sus buenas relaciones familiares. Mientras Mireya construye su sueños, continua esforzándose por mantener una utilidad no menor del 30% que cada día planea aumentar, mediante un trabajo responsable.
texts.en: Mireya, 42, is married and the mother of 3 children who range in age from 14 to 20.  She has lived in the house of her in in-laws for 25 years.  The house is in one of the liveliest and friendliest neighborhoods of the city where traditional street music frames the everyday life of the inhabitants.  It was there, 7 years ago, that Mireya decided to set up her business selling the kinds of products that her neighbors wanted.  Before that, she helped her sister run a similar business buying products from catalogs and reselling them.  When Mireya struck out on her own, she knew her market and how to run a business.  She sold products that she bought from catalogs and was eventually put in charge of a sales team.  She was a successful leader and received prizes for her management of the team.  She sold cosmetics, decorative products and even small appliances, as well as clothing and footwear.  The earnings from the business have provided her with an independent income.  Mireya normally sells on credit and she can't always stretch her income to cover new orders, so she's applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a loan, her third, so that has the working capital she needs to support the business.  She will buy herbal medicines, beauty products and clothing, taking advantage of discounts so that she can pass the savings along to her own customers.  Mireya's goal is to buy a house of her own.  She also wants to provide her children with good educations so that they can be successful in the future.  Prior loans have helped Mireya strengthen her business and become more independent.  She is working hard to reach her goals, working no less than 30% of each day, because that's what it takes to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em (pictured here) and his wife, Puthavy, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have a young daughter.  

Em works for a company that supplies construction materials, while his wife is a garment factory worker. The couple have previously asked for a Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle. Now, Em is requesting $1,000 to purchase another motorbike for his sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Natural do Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 10 a 18 anos. Fez 12a classe e neste momento continua a aumentar o seu nivel de escolaridade. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mae enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.
Nunca saiu de Boane, trabalha como docente ha mais de 21 anos e tem um salario de 6.600.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
ja teve emprestimos no BIM, que aplicou no inicio da construçao da sua casa. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, vidros, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi de 20.000.00mt para a habitaçao.
o seu sonho e ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
A native of Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has 6 children between 10 and 18 years old. He finished 12th grade and at the moment continues to increase his level of study. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother by sending her some money for some household expenses.

Jeremias has never left Boane. He has worked as a teacher for more than 21 years and has a salary of 6,600 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account (at BIM).

He has had loans before with BIM, which he used to begin construction on his house. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution, and this is his second loan. Jeremias is asking for 25,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, window glass, beams and other items) to continue improving his house. The earlier loan was for 20,000 meticais and was for housing.

Jeremias' dream is to see his house finished and make his family more comfortable, so he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, window glass, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim, 59 years old, is a farmer. She is a single mother with 3 children and she makes about $10 per day for her income. One of her children is studying, the other one is a hairdresser. Another of her children is working in Korea. 

Naim spends $38 on food, $13 on school fees, $7 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy corn seed and to hire workers to clear the grass on her plantation. Her career can make a good income that’s why she has never wanted to change it at all. For her future, she plans to grow cashew nuts instead of corn because it is easy for her when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her plantation.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq has been in the business of cattle-breeding for the last six years. The breeding business requires a lot of dedication and effort since it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, including feed and care for pregnant cows and newborn calves. 

Through this business, Tofiq is able to support his spouse and his five children. 

This will be his fourth loan. He has a solid credit history. He intends to purchase three cattle and one cow.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and one cow

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su compañera de vida, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder establecer una pulpería, don Juan desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presenta  es el robo del producto ya que por la noches no tiene una persona que le cuide el cultivo y sobre todo este carece de insumos ya que la coloración no esta  muy apropiada , Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva por el apoyo que le brinda  ya que con las venta pueden pagar en tiempo y forma .
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe where he lives with his life partner. The plans for his family include improving their living conditions and establishing a grocery store. Don Juan has been growing pineapple for several years. The greatest challenge he faces is people stealing his product at night because he does not have anyone to look after his crops. He also lacks farming supplies necessary for his crops to attain the appropriate color.

Juan is grateful to AFODENIC for the support it has provided by supplying Kiva funds. Through his sales, he will be able to repay on time and according to terms.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Kaltumi

texts.en: Kaltumi is into multiple businesses such as being a seamstress, selling waakye and selling plastic blows at Abura. Kaltumi has been to junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a plumber. She assists her spouse in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy plastic bowls to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls to resell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a car spare parts trader and broker since 2000 with more than 16 years of experience. His business is specialized in buying wrecked cars to gather the pieces that can be repaired in order to resell them back after fixing them up. He is thankful for his business income, but he also needs supplementary financial support to help meet his family’s requirements. Today, he is asking to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car spare parts to sell and make good profits.

loans.use: to purchase more cars spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicio agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Ernesto labora desde hace unos años realiza servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi alquilada (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente mañana y tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.  También cría y comercializa animales de corral.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para la compra de una mototaxi de segunda mano y de alimento balanceado para sus animales, al contar con su propia unidad móvil podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar.  Ernesto es una persona trabajadora y responsable que con empeño ha sabido salir adelante, con el objetivo que en un futuro pueda brindarle a su familia mejores cosas y estudio superior a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 53 years old and he lives with his wife and son in his own house, which is supplied with electricity and water. It is located in the urban area of the Mórrope district which belongs to the Department of Lambayeque. The local people make their living from agriculture, cattle and craftwork.

For several years Ernesto has provided public transport services with a rented mototaxi (which is used for short journeys with a maximum capacity of 3 people) which he operates every morning and afternoon. With the profits he earns, he is able to pay the bills and provide for his family. He also breeds and sells farmyard animals.

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 1200 nuevos soles and it is to be used to buy a second hand mototaxi and feed for his animals. Having his own transport will mean more income for his home. Ernesto is a hard-working and responsible person and through his hard work he has learned to get ahead. His goal for the future is to be able to provide a better life for his family and higher education for his son.

loans.use: To buy a second hand mototaxi and feed for his animals

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 29 years old, single and supports his parents. He has been operating a butchery for the past two years.

He learned about KADET through a KADET customer and is applying for his first loan. He plans to use  the loan to  add more stock of meat to his butchery for sale. He hopes to make a profit and use the return to open other branches.

His dreams are to grow bigger in his business. He is an energetic guy who can do more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to add more stock of meat for sale

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: José,esta solicitando un préstamo, el cual lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes para las plagas, ya que sus hortalizas deben estar protegidas, actualmente tiene en su cultivo ejotes, chiles tomates, de lo que espera tener una buena produccion, de esa forma podrá tener productos para el consumo familiar y para vender.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for pest infestations because his plants need to be protected.

He currently has bean, chili, and tomato crops with which he hopes to have a good production.  This way he will be able to have products for family consumption and to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to prevent pest infestations.

loans.name: Lady Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian, como la llaman sus amistades, es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno y tiene 23 años. Vive con su conviviente y sus 2 hijos en una casa un poco alejado de su negocio. 
Está con Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años y tiene su negocio desde hace tres años. Vende dulces en su puesto (tienda). Fue idea propia de establecerlo y no cuenta con apoyo de nadie. Esta actividad le demanda casi todo el día pero cuenta con la compañía de sus hijos. El mayor está en el primer año de primaria y cada día después del colegio va a ver y acompañar a su mamá en el negocio. El nuevo préstamo de S./ 2,500.00 lo va a invertir en compra de galosinas y la compra de una moto para movilizarse mejor.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y una casa propia.  Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es que los préstamos se pagan rápido. Además le gustan las reuniones donde se relaja y arpende de los temas educativos.
texts.en:
Mirian, as her friends call her, is a member of San Miguel Communal Bank in the Ilave district of the department of Puno.  She is 23 years old and lives with her partner and two children in a house located somewhat far away from her business.

She has been with the Manuel Ramos movement for four years and has had her business for three years.  She sell sweets in her store.  It was her own idea to start the business and she has no help from anybody.  The business is demanding almost all day, but she has the company of her children.  The oldest is in the first year of elementary school, and every day after school he goes to the store to see his mother and keep her company. 

She is going to use the current loan of 2,500 PEN to buy sweets and a motorcycle so she can get around more easily.

Her dream is to have a bigger business and her own house.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is that the loans are paid off quickly.  She also likes the meetings, where she relaxes and learns from the educational topics.

loans.use: to buy sweets and a motorcycle.

loans.name: An

texts.en: An is 38 years old and has 3 children who are attending school. She is running a shop that sell clothes in a local market. She gets stable income from this shop. As a client of SEDA credit program in 2009, she used most loans to invest in her shop. For the new loans cylce, she requires a loan of 9,814,000 VND to buy more styles of clothing to meet the demand of customers for coming season.

loans.use: To buy more style of clothing for sale

loans.name: Armida Zuleyma

texts.es:
Armida, comprara plátanos para hacer tostadas, aceite para freírlas, y también comprara frutas para el negocio, ella se decidió por esta nueva inversión, debido a la necesidad D. mejorar el negocio, y comprar lo necesario para hace la venta.
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para que su negocio creciera y le proveyera más ganancias. La familia D. Armida ha aumentado con un nuevo miembro, pues es madre D. una pequeñita D. 4 meses.
Este credito es recurrente, pero ella por motivos D. su maternidad, tuvo unos atrasos en el pago D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Armida will buy bananas to make tostadas, oil to fry them in and also will buy fruit for the business.  She decided on this new investment because of the need to improve the business and buy what’s necessary for the sales.

The previous loan helped her business grow and produce higher profits.  Armida’s family has grown by one member; she’s the mother of a 4-month-old little girl.

This is a recurrent loan but due to her pregnancy she fell behind in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oil and fruit.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is 53 years old and married with 2 children.

Rosel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more root crops to sell.

Rosel has borrowed and re-paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business of buying and selling root crops for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock, charcoal retail and raising pigs.

Rosel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more root crops to sell

loans.name: Bakereti

texts.en: Bakereti is a 37-year-old married lady with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a family goal of educating her children.  She has been operating a cosmetics business for twenty years which she started with the capital of five hundred thousand UGX and now has capital of one million UGX.  Her business challenges are high fuel and transportation costs; her business goal is to buy land and grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gina Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
Aquí conversamos con la señora Gina, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos dos mayores de edad y el menor de  8 años que es el que  vive con ella y estudia en escuela.
