Ella es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les faltara nada se dedica al duro trabajo para sacarlos adelante,  ella trabaja en una casa haciendo los quehaceres domésticos, pero en las noches y en los días libres se dedica al comercio, e vende productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios), visita a sus clientes los sabados y domingos en el día ya que en estos días cobra porque deja a crédito. Lo que más vende son los perfumes, lleva en este negocio por más de 8 años y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería. Lleva en el Banco Comunal por seis  años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

 Sus sueños son tener un bazar y seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Emprendedora de Los Cerezos Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the residential area of Los Cerezos, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a poor and very densely populated urban area.

Here we spoke with Gina.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of three children.  Two are adults and the youngest, age 8, lives with her and attends school.

She is a very good mother who works hard to get her children ahead so they will never lack anything.  She works in a house doing domestic chores, but at night and on her days off she works in business, selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories).  She visits her customers on Saturdays and Sundays during the day, since those days she collects her money because she sells on credit.  What she sells most is perfume.  She has had this business for more than eight years and thanks to this she has been able to get ahead.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.  She has been with the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the help they give with the loans.

Her dreams are to have a store and to get ahead in life and in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: 05.01.28 Điện Biên Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, a 50-year-old married mother of two, lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. The leader of a three-member group, the 28 Điện Biên solidarity group, Lan has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for five years. Her main hardship is a lack of capital.

In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having repaid three previous loans, she is requesting a new loan to purchase vegetables to resell. With her profit, Lan hopes for success in her business, academic success for her children, and the opportunity to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, 44, is married and lives with her family, a husband and four children. Besides her elder daughter, the others are free. 

Her elder daughter is involved in the sewing business. She sews clothes for her relatives and neighboring customers and financially contributes to the family.  She is a very sincere and passionate girl. She loves doing her work because she has lots of interest. She sews dresses with perfect measurements and impresses her customers with her skills. 

Parveen’s husband is involved in a sanitary supplies selling business. He also offers his services of installing the sanitary supplies for the customers as they require. He has been in this business for many years. 

Parveen herself is a caring woman. She does her household responsibilities by staying at home. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the purchase of sanitary supplies like water pipes and taps in larger quantities for reselling. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further after making an investment into it. 

Note: One of the group members has a sewing business. That’s why she has shown her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy sanitary supplies for reselling.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 62 years old and is married with five adult children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, she has run a retail store where she sells personal products in the local community. She earns 10,000 PHP each month. Lourdes joined GDMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Lourdes is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Cerilina

texts.en:
Cerilina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Cerilina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cerilina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cerilina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Bokk Askane Ourack1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe est créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 28 septembre 2012, il est composé de trente sept femmes issues du même quartier et leur activité dominante est le petit commerce. Ndèye Fally est la responsable est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée mère de 08 enfants dont 03 garçons, elle s'active dans le petit commerce de chaussures,de savon, omo, et des produits cosmétiques. Elle est debout sur la photo à droite. ses bénéfices vont  lui permettent de prendre en charge , d'acheter des poulets et des moutons.
texts.en: This group was created on the inauguration day of the 'banc villageois' on September 28, 2012. It is composed of 37 women from the same district, and their dominant work involves small-scale commerce. Ndèye Fally is the group's official. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, including three boys. She is active in small-scale commerce selling shoes, soap, Omo, and cosmetics. She is standing at the right in the photo. Her profits will enable her to support her family and to purchase chickens and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and shoes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Doña Victoria, es casada y tiene tres niños quienes estudian, su esposo es chofer de un bus con ruta a Ciudad Capital, doña Victoria se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y venta de consumo diario en poca cantidad desde hace ocho años, también los  jueves hace paches y los sábados hace tamales, vende solo en las tardes y en su local de ropa,   ella hace cundo le piden almuerzos para una empacadora que está ubicada cerca de su vivienda, está feliz por su negocio ya que empezó con poco y ahora ya la conocen y ella a las personas que le compran, también agradece pues ella es independiente y ayuda a su esposo con  los gastos de su hogar y los de sus hijos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para vender.

loans.use: Comprar ropa para vender.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda lives in Pedro Escobedo, Queretaro, she is mother of two children. Many years ago she had a difficult divorce and she got her children and the familiar expenses alone. She needed to do something to confront the situation, Yolanda decided, together with a friend, begin a restaurant. However, in the little time, her partner left her with all the responsibility. She found support in micro-credits that she was looking for. Since 7 years ago she started her own business, and she has been to cover all the familiar expenses, with the support of her daughters, Yolanda try to give them studies and cover all their expenses, still without her husband.

Yolanda has demonstrated to have a capacity to confront all difficult situations and two of her mains qualities are dexterity and the enthusiasm. She needs a loan of $925 DLLS, to purchase merchandise as fresh food to increase her sales in her restaurant. In a term of 6 months she wants to return the loan, you can contribute to her small restaurant can grow up. Supporting her!!!!!

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, madre de dos hijas. Hace algunos años que afrentó un difícil divorcio y se quedó a cargo totalmente de la manutención de sus dos pequeñas. Para hacer frente a la situación, Yolanda decidió, junto con una conocida, poner un restaurante. Sin embargo, al poco tiempo, su socia le dejó toda la responsabilidad y es entonces cuando Yolanda encuentra en los micro créditos el financiamiento que estaba buscando. Ya son casi 7 años desde que inició, y ha logrado mantenerse con el apoyo de sus hijas, quienes gracias a la lucha y entrega de su madre han logrado crecer y salir adelante, aún sin su padre.

Yolanda ha demostrado ser capaz de enfrentar situaciones difíciles, por lo que dos de sus principales cualidades es destreza y el entusiasmo. Ella ahora necesita un préstamo de $925 DLLS, de esta forma podrá incrementar sus ventas y por ende el ingreso familiar. Contribuye a su crecimiento, comparte sus logros, apoyándola!!!!!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise as fresh food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 53 years old. 14 years ago she started selling cosmetics to obtain the income necessary to support and educate her only daughter: she never received help from her partner, meaning she had sole responsibility for meeting the cost of her daughter’s upbringing. For this reason she has worked hard and makes an effort every day. When she began she had a very small stock of cosmetics but now she has managed to increase the number of customers and her sales.

It has not been easy for Ana to have this responsibility, but the love she feels for her daughter has motivated her throughout. Now she needs a loan of $200 dollars which she will use to buy merchandise to increase her supply of products and offer a better service to her customers. Now is the time to help those who need it most: you can help to improve the living conditions of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Maria tiene 53 años de edad, hace catorce años inició con la venta de cosméticos para obtener los recursos que necesita para el sustento y la educación de su única hija, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja por lo que ha tenido que solventar ella sola los gastos de su hija, para lo que ha trabajado mucho y se esfuerza día a día. Cuando empezó tenia muy poco surtido de cosméticos pero ahora ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y sus ventas.

No ha sido fácil para Ana tener esta responsabilidad, pero el amor hacia su hija la han motivado durante tanto tiempo, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar el surtido de sus productos y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ahora es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Edgar would like to diversify and increase his inventory for his store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence N. is married and has eight children.  She is 50 years olds and sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for a living.  She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She has been in her business since 1990.  She needs a loan of $175 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ni Ketut Jepun

texts.id:
Living in Brawantangi village, West Bali, where all the inhabitants are Hindus, made Ni Ketut Jepun to be in the Banten (Hindu prayer Offerings made from young coconut leaves) business. Ni ketut Jepun makes Banten for ceremonies like Marriage; Nyambutin (ceremonies to celebrate child birth, after they are 3 months old; Ngotonin (ceremonies to celebrate child birth, after they are 1.5 years old). Ni ketut Jepun has 6 workers to help her, that are being paid Rp10,000-Rp15,000 (about $1-1.65)/day. With an initial capital of Rp500,000 (about US$55), Ni ketut Jepun bought raw materials to make Banten, like: young coconut leaves, bamboos, banana leaves, and assortment of flowers. Profit after subtracting labor cost and buying raw materials are Rp100,000 (about US$11). Every day Ni Ketut Jepun makes banten from 8:00AM - 5:00PM. Profit is used besides paying for daily expenses, are also used to pay for education expenses for her 4th grader daughter. Ni Ketut Jepun hopes that Dinari's loan could be used to increase capital, so that she could serve more customers. Ni Ketut Jepun plans to repair her hut, that is made from woven bamboo, and sand floor, to make it a more permanent home, worthy to live in.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di Desa Brawantangi, Bali Barat, yang semua penduduknya beragama Hindu membuat Ni Ketut Jepun menekuni usaha Dagang Banten ( sarana untuk umat Hindu sembahyang yang terbuat dari daun kelapa muda ). Ni ketut Jepun membuat banten untuk upacara seperti pernikahan, untuk Nyambutin ( upacara untuk merayakan kelahiran anak. Dilakukan setelah anak berumur 3 bulan ) dan juga Ngotonin ( upacara untuk merayakan kelahiran anak setelah berumur 1,5 tahun ). Ni Ketut Jepun dibantu oleh 6 orang tenaga kerja yang dibayar dari Rp.10.000.- sampai Rp.15.000.- per hari. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000.- Ni Ketut Jepun membeli bahan baku untuk membuat banten seperti daun kelapa muda, bambu, daun pisang dan aneka jenis bunga. Keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah dikurangi untuk biaya tenaga kerja dan juga untuk pembelian bahan sebesar Rp.100.000. Ni Ketut Jepun setiap hari membuat banten dari jam 08.00 pagi sampai jam 05.00 sore hari . Keuntungan yang diperoleh selain untuk kebutuhan sehari – hari, dipakai juga untuk pendidikan satu putrinya yang sekarang duduk dikelas 4 SD. Ni Ketut Jepun berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dapat melayani lebih banyak pelanggan. Ni Ketut Jepun berencana untuk memperbaiki rumahnya yang terbuat dari gedeg dan lantai tanah, menjadi rumah yang lebih permanen dan layak untuk ditempati.

loans.use:
To add capital to buy raw materials to make Banten, like: young coconut leaves, bamboos, banana leaves, and assortment of flowers

Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat Banten seperti daun kelapa muda, bambu, daun pisang dan akeka jenis bunga

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 27 years old. He has 2 children, and his mother and father live with him. They are all living in a rented house. He has a carpentry shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 for the following: purchase new wood and some raw materials for the shop, hire two jobless to help him in the shop, paint the shop, and make some advertising. He wants to increase his income and develop himself.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and some raw material

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Mrs. Korn K. S., age 27, works with her husband raising pigs and making medicinal rice wine. Together, they earn about $5 each day. They live with their young child, niece, and nephew in Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

She requests a loan of $400 in order to purchase more rice to produce wine, and to buy pig feed to supplement her livestock.

loans.use: Purchase pig feed, and more rice to produce medicinal wine.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Rehema C. is 28 years old and she is married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. In 2005 Rehema established a crop-selling business and now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. Rehema thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Kireka B3 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of mushroom growing and is requesting a loan to hire more land for cultivation. Sarah is 39 years old and is single. She has 3 children ranging from age 10 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start another business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to buy water tanks and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Madinah K., Sylvia N., Hanifah J., and Aidah M.. Madinah K. has a business running a retail shop and wants to rent bigger premises. Sylvia N. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase a hair steamer and more mirrors. Hanifah J. operates a retail shop business and wants to expand into wholesale selling. Aidah M. is currently in the business of selling breakables (such as pottery/ceramics) and is requesting a loan to add more stock.

loans.use: To add capital to mushroom growing business

loans.name: Tendo .

texts.en:
A. is married with three children. He has encountered so many challenges in life such as the death of his father and mother who were very supportive to him. This made him not continue his education. He decided to do farming where he raised some money to provide for himself and the family.

However, with farming he suffers the lack of farm input like manure and fertilizer. This made him join GHAPE. He has managed and repaid loans with GHAPE up to two times.

Given the new loan he plans to expand his vegetable gardening and cultivation of other crops. Also, he would like to add another business of animal rearing like fowls and pigs. He is the main supplier of vegetables and other fruit to his community and the local market. He plans to repay the loan in 18months. His first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Buying of seedlings, Piglets and fowl

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run S. is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Her youngest son is shown here with her. Run works at a stall in the largest city market, and earns around $3 in profits. The competition against other stalls in her area is extremely fierce. Her husband works in a garment factory and earns a total of $5 a day. Run runs her business by purchasing fresh produce from farmers and then distributing it to others in the city market. Run would like to purchase a motorbike to allow her to transport and purchase larger amounts of produce to sell, in order to increase her income and support her children’s futures.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora is 60 years old and is married to Señor Juan Vera who is a vendor. They have two shops (one in their home and the other in a market in the city).

Aurora opened her shop over 18 years ago and thanks to her perseverance and her insistence that sustains her, with her husband, she has been able to raise two children who are independent and are college-educated working professionals.

Aurora, thanks to her efforts and a good investment of loans acquired from the “Fundación Paraguaya”, has been able to improve the quality of her life and that of her family, which is how she was able to allow her children to study.

Aurora needs a loan to purchase more merchandise so that she can stock her businesses now that the season of higher prices is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurora tiene 60 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Juan Vera, quien es comerciante, poseen dos locales (uno en su propio domicilio y otro en el mercado de la ciudad).

Aurora inició su actividad de despensera hace más de 18 años y gracias a la constancia y el empeño que sostuvieron con su esposo, lograron formar a sus dos hijos, quienes ya son independientes y excelentes profesionales universitarios.

Aurora gracias a su esfuerzo y a la buena inversión del crédito adquirido de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, como así también hacerle estudiar a sus hijos.

Aurora necesita del crédito para adquirir más mercaderías para poder surtir sus negocios ya que se acerca la temporada de suba de precios.

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products, meats, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Abdurahim is 36, married, and has 3 children. He has been involved in business for several years. He now has two area of business - at home he raises cattle, and in addition, since he is a chef by training, he rents a small cafe, where he cooks and has hired employees. At his cafe customers can sit with friends, enjoy a good lunch, and drink cold beer and other refreshing drinks. Both businesses are stable and allow him to support his family. Since he invested a large amount of money in the cafe, he came to Microinvest for a loan. With the loan he bought two large bull calves. His family helps raise the animals. Business grew steadily and he earned a good profit. When he found out about Kiva, he decided to request a new loan, which he would like to invest into expanding the livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахиму 36 лет, женат. имеет 3 детей. Предпринимательством занимается уже несколько лет. Сейчас у него 2 направления бизнеса - дома откармливает крупный рогатый скот и еще, так как он по профессии повар, он взял в аренду маленькое кафе где наняв работников работает по профессии. Там у него можно вкусно пообедать, выпить холодного пива и прохладительные напитки, посидеть с друзьями. Оба бизнеса стабильные и позволяют содержать семью. Так как большая часть денег была вложена им в кафе, он обратился в Микроинвест за займом. Получив займ он купил 2 больших бычков. В откорме скота ему помогает его семья. Бизнес развивался стабильно и он тогда получил хорошую прибыль. Узнав О КИВА он решил обратиться за новым займом. который собирается вложить в дальнейшее расширение откорма скота.

loans.use: Purchase of bull calves

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge Q. G. has his own house in the zone of Vino Tinto (on the outskirts of the city of La Paz). He is retired, his wife is a homemaker, and the couple have two children.

The house has three rooms that are utilized for a number of household uses (because of this the family does not have much room). And the home does not have a front wall along the street, which poses a risk to the whole family (and especially for the couple who are elderly). The requested loan will be used in the construction of a front wall of reinforced concrete.

This is the second time that he has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis carried favorably qualifies him, and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Q. G. tiene vivienda propia en la zona de Vino Tinto (afueras de la ciudad de La Paz). El señor es rentista (jubilado) y su esposa es ama de casa, la pareja tiene dos hijos.

El domicilio posee tres habitaciones que son ocupadas para distintos usos en el hogar (por lo que la familia no tiene mucha comodidad) y no cuenta con una muralla hacia la calle, lo cual es un riesgo para la seguridad de toda la familia (sobretodo los esposos que son de la tercera edad). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción del muro frontal con estructura de hormigón armado.

Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Front Wall in his Home

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence S. B. is 34 years old and he is married with two kids who are currently in school. Lawrence is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and service for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives them to his customers at retail prices.He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Alive Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Lawrence would like to increase his stock of mobile phones and accessories to sell and repair.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her small salon

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak K. is a 45-year-old a rice farmer who earns about $1.50 a day. She is married to Mr. Sory Vin and has five children, all of whom live at home. Four of her children are in school. The family lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. Mrs. Vannak is applying for a loan because she would like to supplement her income by buying groceries for resale.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. N. lives in Bac Phu commune, Soc Son district, Ha Noi province.  She is 58 years old and she has 4 children. She has been a member of TYM since 1995.  Now her main income is from raising pigs and carpentry.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND ($600 US) to buy pigs and materials to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy pigs and materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her store with basic consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more timber in bulk

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa D. is 55 years old. She has 10 children and two of them are already married. Her husband worked as a government employee. However, because of illness her husband died and left her with all the responsibility for their children. Now, as a widow, she is continuously longing for the love that her husband gave her.

Rosa is a pig grower. She started in 1998 with only 1 sow. From her experience, she realized that she could earn as much as Php 8,000 from 3 piglets that she sells. She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. She wants to raise more hogs. In this way she can earn more profit from her business. The loan that she will get will also be a big help to let her get started with a new business.

Insurance coverage, training and credit assistance are what Rosa D. enjoys from joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
S. Zulfiniso lives in the Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with 3 children. At present, she supports the family on her income alone. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work, but because of the world financial crisis, he could not find a job that would provide his family with the basic necessities.

Zulfiniso has been working at home for six years, running the family business that makes and sells the type of bread most popular in her country. She prepares the dough herself and makes “lepeshky,” which is the traditional bread in Central Asia, including the Tajik Republic.

Zulfiniso has applied for a loan of 3000 STJ for 3 months from KIVA. She wants to expand her business by importing large amounts of flour.

loans.use: Import large amounts of flour

loans.name: Qarosoch

texts.ru: Джумаева Каросоч проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 47 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Пенсионерка, занимается торговлей тканей. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 13 лет. Завозит товар из города Душанбе  и реализует у себя в кишлаке. Кроме тканей привозит еще и одежду  на заказ. Кредит планирует получить и использовать для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qarosoch J. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old, married and has six children. She is a retiree, involved in the fabric sales business. She has been in this business for 13 years. Qarosoch brings the goods from Dushanbe and sells them in her village. Besides fabrics, she also brings clothing by request. She plans to obtain this loan to increase the goods turnover. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha M. started her fish business ten years ago in Eguase, a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. She purchases fish at the seashore and later retails them to her faithful and loyal customers. She has a large customer base, many of whom travel from other parts of the region to buy her fish.

Agatha smokes some of the fish and sells some fresh. She prepares and serves very tasty and good quality fish. She has respect for her customers. Agatha will use this loan to increase her stock of assorted fish.

Agatha is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Currently, two of her children are in school and the other two have completed senior high school. It is her dream to provide a better education for her children and she believes that if she is well supported her dream will come true.

Agatha belongs to a village bank called "Akukudrofo" which means "Brave People".

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Yalama Yalama Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Yalama Yalama sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kadiolo (Noumousso) dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pommades, d’habits, de jus de fruits et  d’huile alimentaire.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 3 colis de pommades, 5 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques complets en bazin. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et à Kadiolo ville. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de la ville de Kadiolo, dans les quartiers de façon ambulante et souvent sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Yalama Yalama ambitionnent d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Yalama Yalama are all married and average 35 years of age and 3 children each. They live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso) in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They do a diversity of work, including selling ointments, clothing, fruit juices, and cooking oil.

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the previous ones have been correctly repaid.

With this new loan, they intend to buy four 20-liter drums of oil, three packages of ointments, five bolts of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and some suits made of damask fabrics. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in Kadiolo City. The merchandise is sold to customers composed of men and women in mostly cash transactions at the Kadiolo City marketplace, door-to-door, and often by special order.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be put into savings. Some of the women of the group have the ambition to buy a plot of land on which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther B. C. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella tiene estudios Superiores Incompletos, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria tiene como negocio principal la venta de productos de belleza y venta de sandalias. Cuando inició, la empresaria vendía productos de belleza (entre amigos) actualmente ha ampliado su negocio inscribiéndose en diversas marcas que distribuyen dichos productos, luego complementó su negocio con la venta de sandalias.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más sandalias en diferentes modelos y talla.
Maria tiene como sueño poner una tienda de venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esther B. C. is 32 years old, lives in Casa Grande district, a province of Ascope, in La Libertad department of Peru. She has some college education and has one child who financially depends on her. Maria's main business is the sale of beauty products and sandals. When she started, the entrepreneur sold beauty products to her friends and has now expanded her business by subscribing to several different brands that distribute such products. Later she added to her business by selling sandals. With her first credit of $100 that she received from her Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, she was able to invest in the purchase of beauty products. With the credit of $100, she would use it to purchase more sandals in different styles and sizes. Maria's dream is to open a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandals

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru: Шарипов Абдулхаким проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Абдулхаким вот уже более 15 лет занимается услугой такси. Этот вид услуги, является единственным источником дохода. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en:
Abdulhakim S. lives in the Hamadoni region of Tajikistan. He is 35 years old, married and has eight children. Abdulhakim has been working for 15 years as a taxi driver. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Abdulhakim would like to use this loan to repair his taxi cab.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of taxi cab

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift sells traditional medicine that is produced with natural herbs. The herbs are most effective for blood purification. Gift travels to Ghana to purchase her traditional medicines. Gift is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. Gift is an active LAPO client. Gift hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more traditional medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase traditional medicines

loans.name: Orchidée Plus Group

texts.fr: Pitchou L.  gère ses deux propres moulins qui constituent l’essentiel de son activité. Il a acheté le premier moulin en 1999. Le deuxième a été acquis en 2008, grâce aux bénéfices accumulés générés par le premier. En janvier 2008, Pitchou décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Orchidée Plus » dans le but de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un dépôt  de mais et de devenir un jour, fournisseur de ce produit dans son quartier situé au sud-est de Kinshasa. Il a déjà reçu trois prêts chez Hope qu’il a remboursés totalement. Pitchou compte, avec le crédit actuel, diversifier son activité en achetant 8 sacs de maїs à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $175 par semaine. Pitchou est célibataire et père d’un enfant âgé de 3 ans. Le groupe « Orchidée Plus » a eu la joie et le privilège de recevoir John, Kiva Fellow à Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Pitchou L. runs two mills belonging to him, which constitute the essential part of his business. He bought the first mill in 1999. The second was acquired in 2008, thanks to the accumulated profit made with the first mill.

In January 2008, Pitchou decided to join one of the Hope groups called « Orchidée Plus » with the intention of making his dream come true: to open a maize depot and one day, to become a supplier of this product in his neighborhood situated in the south-east of Kinshasa.

He has already received three loans from Hope which he completely reimbursed. Pitchou intends, with this loan, to diversify his business by buying 8 sacks of maize to sell to earn income. Presently, his business is generating a profit of US$ 175 per week.

Pitchou is single and the father of a child of 3. The « Orchidée Plus » group has had the joy and the privilege to welcome John, Kiva fellow in Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 8 sacks of maize in order to diversify his business

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.pt:
Roberto Carlos M., de 40 anos de idade, casado e pai 5 filhos de mães diferentes. Estudou a te 8 classe tendo parado forçosamente. todos filhos estudam e tem idades compreendidas entre 5 e 13 anos.

Roberto nasce em maputo e cresce junto dos seus pais ate a altura que saiu o seu nome para ir cumprir serviço militar obrigatório numa altura em que a guerra civil estava bastante intensa nos pais. Foge para áfrica do sul, por temer ser soldado, na companhia de amigos, onde trabalhou durante muitos anos. Regressa no ano 1990 e junta se com a sua primeira esposa e ambos nasceram 4 filhos e tendo se divorciada desta por motivos sociais.vive na casa própria apenas com a sua família.
Roberto casa se com a actual esposa com a qual ainda tem um filho, o tal de 5 anos. 
Enquanto ia a escola costumava passar duma carpintaria para apreciar as obras feitas e aprender, de forma voluntária, a fazer alguns artigos/objectos. Ganhou vocação e paixão pela a actividade e após o seu regresso de áfrica do sul, inicia a actividade de carpintaria como fonte para sobrevivência.
Actualmente tem o negocio (carpintaria) minimamente estável e conta com 5 empregados. Vende mais esquadria (postas e janelas) e vende, por exemplo uma porta a 2.000,00MT e consegue fazer 6 portas por mês.
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 14.000,00MT com o qual pretende comprar madeira.
Tem como plano futuro adquirir uma viatura para usar no transporte de matéria prima, quando terminar de pagar o credito.
texts.en:
Robert Carlos M. is 40 years old, he is married and has 5 children from different mothers. He studied until 8th grade, all his children study and are between the ages of 5 and 13. Roberto was born in Maputo and grew with his parents until he left to fulfill his obligatory military service duty at the time when the civil war was intense in his country. He went to South Africa with some friends, avoiding to be a soldier, where he worked for several years. When he came back to his country in 1990 he married his first wife and had 4 children, he later divorced her for social issues. He owns his home. Roberto married his current wife and they have a child 5 years ago. When he was in school, after classes he used to stop by a carpentry to appreciate the pieces and learn voluntarily to create objects and articles. He gained passion for the activity and after his return from South Africa, he started working in carpentry. Currently his carpentry business is stable and he has 5 employees. He sells more doors and windows, for example a door for 2,000MT and he builds 6 doors a month. He heard about Hluvuku-adsema from friends and this is his first loan for 14,000MT that he will use to buy wood. His future plans are to buy a vehicle to move supplies when he finishes paying his credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build wood articles, tables, doors and windows

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.fr:
Mado N. M. 34 ans, est trésorière de « l’Avenir Plus », un groupe constitué solidairement de 28 membres qui ont déjà reçu le crédit de Kiva à travers Hope Kinshasa RDC et l’ont remboursé correctement. 

Mado gère sa propre boutique et une terrasse dans un quartier situé un peu à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé l’activité commerciale en 2002 en vendant la friperie. Elle est parvenue avec le temps et les circonstances à la transformer en boutique et terrasse. Compte tenue de ses ambitions d’élargir ses affaires et de réaliser les projets de son foyer, Mado a décidé d’avoir un appui financier permanent à travers des prêts de Hope depuis 2008. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des articles divers tels que des conserves, des sacs du riz, du sucre, du lait, et autres pour renforcer le stock de la marchandise de sa boutique. Sa rigueur dans le travail ainsi que la bonne gestion sont ses atouts qui font prospérer ses activités. Mado est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 15 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Mado N. M. is 34 years old and the treasurer of "L'Avenir Plus", a group made up of 28 members who have already received and fully paid back a Kiva loan through the microfinance institution Hope Kinshasa DRC. Mado manages her own store and a terrace in a neighborhood located a little bit west of Kinshasa. She started he business in 2002, selling second-hand clothing. In time and with improving circumstances, she was able to transform her business into a shop and terrace. Given her ambitions to expand her business and fulfill the projects she has for her home, Mado decided to gain steady financial support through loans from Hope since 2008. The next loan she is requesting will enable her to purchase various items, such as jams, sacks of rice, sugar, milt and other items to strengthen the stock of merchandise in her shop. Her hard work, as well as her great management are the "trump card" for her business - the reason it prospers. Mado is married and the mother of 6 children whose ages range from 3 to 15. All of her children attend school

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various articles to improve the stock of the merchandise for her boutique

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick C. is from the village of Lawa-an. He is 41 years old. Nick is widowed. To make a living, Nick owns and operates a motor-cab transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Nick has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nick joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nick has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Nick is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nick from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with three children. She owns a shop where she sells medicines to her customers within her community in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.

Helen is requesting for loan of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Kerezbu's Group

texts.en:
Kerezbu, a fifty–seven year old widow, is the leader of this group. Several years ago, Kerezbu left for Russia as a migrant worker. Hard work and determination helped her save her earnings and upon returning home, she started her own business. She is a mother to and has raised four children. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her elder son is still working in Russia. Her middle son does odd jobs at the local market and her little daughter, 26, helps her in the business. Some people believe that the active part of your life ends once your children become grown–ups, and you can quietly meet an old age and have rest. That’s not the case with Kerezbu. Moreover, having received Kerezbu’s upbringing, her children know that there is no free cheese in this world. Kerezbu has preferred to be active and not depend on them. Instead, she is a great example of a strong independent woman. Kerezbu’s business is trade in women’s underwear, night gowns, pajamas and T–shirts. From her earnings, she invested around $715 to purchase goods. Now her current monthly income is $120. Her Russian experience is helping her to survive and be competitive. Kerezbu needs a loan to purchase goods for fall and winter seasons and increase her range of goods. Her immediate plans are to save money to buy a car for her middle son and marry her little daughter.

Kerezbu’s partners: Aida, Asel and Uulkan. Aida, 36, has three children. She plans to start her own business of running a shop. She hopes to obtain a loan as she wants to purchase foodstuffs, drinks, cereals and sugar.

Asel, 26, has one child. Together with her husband, she sells socks at a local market. They need a loan to buy a milk cow for breeding and for milk.

Uulkan, 22, is married. She sells various kinds of jackets. Her husband and his brother help her transport the goods. Uulkan has applied for this loan because she needs to purchase new goods and increase the assortment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for fall and winter seasons and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie mills palm oil to sell. She also owns a palm oil farm. She is requesting for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more fertilizer and also to repair her oil-milling machine.

Ivie is 57 years old and married with four children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer and to repair her oil-milling machine

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos L. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos L. is 36 and married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. She and her husband do the same work, and they have a shop. They have been weaving for some time. Their home is located in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo L. runs a food stall selling a la carte grilled meat like pork, chicken feet, chicken liver and other grilled products in his community. He is 35 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. Eduardo has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas A. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio a crecido y a tenido más ingreso. Con el cual le ha mandado a su familia que viven en Veracruz México.
Nueva mente  esta solicitando su cooperación para un préstamo ya que necesita comprar mercancía y herramienta mas moderna, para las televisiones de plasma.
Don Tomas planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias D. negocio, ya que tiene que mandarle a su familia a Veracruz.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas A. is very grateful for the support of his previous loan which has grown his business. He sent this extra income to his family that lives in Veracruz, Mexico.

Now he is asking for your help with another loan as he needs to buy merchandise and more modern tools for repairing plasma screen televisions. Tomas plans to pay off the loan with a portion of the earnings from his business, as he has to send the rest to his family in Veracruz.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and modern tools to repair plasma screen televisions

loans.name: Trust We Group

texts.en:
These are a group of local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo near Freetown. They named their group 'Trust We' and made Mamusu B. (in the middle of the photo) the leader of the group. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 (or SLL 500,000 each) from SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo. With a loan at their disposal, they can expand their businesses by adding more goods. Consequently, sales and sales-to-profit margins will increase for these entrepreneurs. They will thus be able to better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in paying their school fees and other school related expenses.

Mamusu was born in Kambia, in northern Sierra Leone. Mamusu is divorced with two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School III and the other is in Primary School V. Since 2000, Mamusu has been selling fried meat, fried chicken, roasted fish and bread. Mamusu wants this loan in order to buy in larger quantity the materials she needs in preparing the meat, fish and chickens she sells – condiments, gallons of oil, charcoal, and so on.

loans.use: To buy in larger quantity the materials she needs in preparing the meat, fish and chickens she sells

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is excited about taking out his first loan. He is 34 years old and is married with a child. He supports his family by making and selling furniture. He has been in business for the past seven years.

John is requesting a loan in the amount of N80,000. He will use this loan to invest in his business, specifically to buy furniture-making materials in bulk to get a better price. He hopes that this loan will help him build a business that will be profitable, particularly to provide for his child's future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to build furniture

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de León, muy responsablemente la señora Rosa C. se ha dedicado a la actividad de venta de productos comestibles como atol y pan los que son elaborados por ella misma a diario.
La señora Rosa C. tiene su puesto de venta en donde se ubica dos horas en la venta del producto y  luego lo ofrece de forma ambulante por las mañanas vende el atol y por las tardes vende el pan. 
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como lo es el pan, la canela y la leche. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
In the central market of Leon, Rosa C. has very responsibly dedicated herself to the sale of food products like atol [a thick, warm drink made with milk and corn] and bread that she makes herself every day. Mrs. Rosa C. has a stand where she sells her products from for two hours every day, then she walks around selling atol in the morning and bread in the afternoon. The loan she is applying for is to buy basic things like bread, cinnamon and milk. She hopes that her loan will be approved and in this way she will continue to improve her quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ingredients to make bread and atol

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has worked as a farmer in his village since 1999. He owns a large piece of land and he cultivates it with all type of vegetables and fruits. He is involved in this occupation after learning it from his father because his village is specialized in this sector.

Youssef is married with four children who still go to school. He’s taking care of his family and his dream is to see his children graduate from school and university.

Today, Youssef is requesting $1,000 to buy farming supplies and tools for his business.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and tools

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose loves groceries and that is why she is in the business. She sells groceries, such as noodles, milk, detergents and sugar. She hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. 

She is hoping for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a happy woman and she is so determined to excel in her business. She is 34 years old and married, and she has 4 children. Her youngest child is 5 years old. She is happy because her children are progressing in school. Her husband also works to support the home. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Donadi

texts.es:
el señor Donadi Y. tiene 44 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad de su ultimo matrimonio, tambien tiene otros hijos del matrimonio anterior. El ayuda economicamente a todos sus hijos ya que dice que es su responsabilidad educarlos y darles todo hasta que ellos puedan valerse por si solos en la vida. Dice sentirse muy bien con su nuevo hogar.
Donadi se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene dos puestos que compro en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome Valle. Esta solicitando el credito ya que quiere surtir un poco mas su negocio y con ello obtener mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su hogar y para cubrir con todos los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Donadi Y. is 44 years old. He has a four year old daughter from his latest marriage. He also has other children from a previous marriage. He helps all of his children economically. He says it is his responsibility to educate them and give them everything until they can manage on their own in life. He feels very good in his new home. Donadi sells clothes. He bought two stands outside of the Nacaome Valle municipal market. He is requesting the loan because he wants to stock his business a little more. That way he will get more earnings, which he needs to support his household and cover all of the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jean, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, and socks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
33-year old Evelyn tills a rice field in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the needs of her family. She needs additional capital to run her rice-farming business since she lacks seed and fertilizer. 

Community Economic Ventures, Inc. gives Evelyn an opportunity to obtain a loan to fulfill the needs for her farm. She requested a loan of 14,000 Php which will be helpful to buy supplies to produce a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Thua

texts.en:
Thua T. N. is 39 years old. She lives in yen Phong, bac Ninh with her husband and three children. She is farmer and has livestock. Besides that, she is a seasonal worker. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND), which is about $117 US. 

In 2008, she joined SEDA to gain access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used largely to buy food for pigs, are always repaid punctually. In the next round, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND more to invest in her livestock. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: For livestock

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ya T. is a 29-year-old married woman and she is the village bank president, selected by the 10 group members. They are located in Spean Dek village in Kandal province. Each member of the group will use the loan for a different purpose. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family living conditions. Mrs. Ya T. owns a general store to sell goods. In order to support and enlarge this business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more goods to resell. Her husband, Mr. Samnea Sanh, is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Ya T. is the mother of two children. One of her children is attending the local school and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more goods to resell

loans.name: José Agnelio

texts.es:
José Agnelio P. U.  tiene 32 años, es soltero, no tiene  hijos,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
José trabaja en la agricultura  a partir de los 18 años y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, maíz.   Vende los productos en los mercados de San Miguel y en su comunidad cuando llegan los comerciantes. 
José solicita el crédito para comprar abonos químicos para sus cultivos.  Su meta es de obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar su forma de vida de su familia.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son precios baratos en tiempos de cosechas. José en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar voleibol.
texts.en:
José Agnelio P. U. is 32 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

José is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. José has been farming for 18 years as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are potatoes, wheat, and corn. He sells his products at the markets in San Miguel and to merchants who pass through the community.

José is requesting a loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his crops. His goal is to achieve a good harvest and improve his family’s way of life. José challenges include dealing with low market prices during harvest time. In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit S. is married and a mother of three. She and her husband currently live with their son and one grandchild, whose parents have gone to Russia to find jobs to support their family. 

Anahit has been managing her “lavash” (traditional Armenian flat bread) bakery to support her family. Her bread has become very popular, and she is now planning to expand her production to offer various bread types. 

This resourceful and energetic mother is the main source of income for her family. Anahit has applied for a $3000 loan.

Anahit is hopeful that her business will grow enough that her daughter and son-in-law can return from Russia to reunite with their child and help her at the bakery.

loans.use: To purchase a larger oven and mixer and wholesale flour

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr:
Jean Paul est née dans le capital du Rwanda (Kigali) dans un district de kicukiro, secteur de Kanombe tout près  de l’aéroport international de Kanombe et dans ce même lieu de naissance en même temps de résidence, il est marie âgée de 28 ans, Il a une femme et deux enfants l’aine a 5 ans et l’autre a 6 mois, son niveau d’étude est primaire.

Il est salarié employé d’une entreprise de construction basée à Kigali, Il est ouvrier dans ladite entreprise. Comme sa résidence est un peu rurale, il exerce les activités d’agriculture (il cultive les sorghos, haricots et maniocs) pouvant lui aider dans la vie quotidienne de sa famille, quand a sa femme, elle contrôle les activités d’agriculture.

Il a contracté plus de dix prêts avec ACB et, avec ces prêt il a acheté  une maison  lesquels il devient économiquement indépendant grâce à ces prêt antérieur. Aujourd’hui il  prend un prêt de trois cent vingt mille francs Rwandais(320000FRW) pour réparer sa maison, cuisine et toilette en achetant le sable, du ciment ,deux portes interne pour sa maison et sa cuisine, puis construire la toiture ,pavé afin de maintenir la valeur de sa maison et de le rendre fort continuer aisément son travail comme il le dit; ses ambitions sont de mieux rembourser son prêt pour que la Banque lui accorde un prêt d’ un gros montant pour acheter une vache pour élever ses enfants  et pour produire du lait et du fumier.

Dans l’avenir, il compte à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (mettre les enfants à l’école, les nourrir bien ainsi que sa femme).
texts.en:
Jean Paul, 28, was born in the capital of Rwanda (Kigali) in the district of Kicukiro, Kanombe neighborhood, near the international airport of Kanombe and he currently lives there. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. The older is five and the younger six months. His instructional level is primary school. He is a salaried employee of a construction company based in Kigali. He is a workman in that company. Since where he lives is a bit rural, he grows sorghum, beans, and manioc, used to feed the family, and as for his wife, she oversees the farming. Jean Paul has had more than 10 loans from ACB and with these loans, he has bought a house. The prior loans have allowed him to become economically independent. Today, he is taking out a loan of 320,000 Rwandan Francs to repair his house, kitchen, and toilet by buying sand, cement, two interior doors for his house and kitchen, then to build a roof and pavement, in order to maintain the value of his house and to make it strong, so that he can comfortably continue his work, as he puts it. His ambition is to reimburse his loan in a timely manner so that the Bank will accord him a big loan to use to buy a cow who will produce offspring to raise, and milk and manure. In the future he hopes to improve living conditions for his family (put his children in school and feed them and his wife well).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sand, cement, two interior doors for his house, kitchen and toilet

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Bwaise selling chicken. She has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for nine years. 

Miria buys chicken from poultry farmers in Kawempe, Bwaise, and Kalerwe.   She sells both layers and broilers.   She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken for sale. She uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping twice a week.  She works on the outskirts of Kampala.  She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.   Her business challenges includes thieves and transportation. She is aspiring of building a house and also buying another plot of land. She joined MCDT because of its low interest rates.

loans.use: To buy more more chicken for sale

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar R. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old and single. Oscar owns and operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal transportation services to local community members. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Oscar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Oscar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a single man.  He runs a retail shop where he employs one person.  He is also a web designer and was able to buy a laptop through a loan from Faulu Kenya.  He is requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to add stock in his retail shop and set up a grocery store.  He hopes to open a supermarket in the future.  He is also hoping to set up a cyber café 10 years from now so as to employ more people. He describes himself as outgoing, hardworking, business-oriented, and focused.

loans.use: To add stock in his shop and set up a grocery store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio P. B.  un señor de 37 años de edad  que vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Don Antonio es caracterizado por uno de los miembros más activos y mas hospitalarios de esta comunidad. Uno de sus deseos es que el turismo siga creciendo en la su comunidad, es por eso que construyo una casa y compro unos caballos para alquilarlos a los visitantes a un buen precio.
En este momento la casa no tiene camas, ni muebles  es por eso que el necesita un préstamo  de ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para la compra de colchones, sillones y sabanas para equipar su casa de alquiler y poder poner a disposición de los turistas. Asegura que tendrá muchos beneficios y que esto contribuirá a que el turismo siga creciendo en su comunidad y genere mas ingresos a el y a su familia
Don Antonio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y está muy satisfecho con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Antonio P. B. is a 37 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and four children on a reserve inhabited by one of the largest indigenous groups in Costa Rica known as the Guaymí. The reserve is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area known for its elevation and being located an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main business activities are agriculture and handicrafts. Tourism has increased within the last few years.

Don Antonio is known as one of the most active and most hospitable members of this community. One of his wishes is to see tourism continue to grow in his community. For this reason, he built a house and bought some horses that he could rent to visitors at a good price. At the moment, the house does not have any beds or furniture. He needs a loan of 200,000 CRC to buy mattresses, chairs, and linens to equip his rental house so that he can make it available to tourists. Antonio says his business has many benefits and will contribute to the growth of tourism in his community, as well as generate more income for him and his family.

Don Antonio is a member of Ku Kwata Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is very pleased with this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his rental cottage

loans.name: Zaituna

texts.en:
Zaituna N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Zaituna sells drinks like passion fruit juice, sodas, and water, a business she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Zaituna has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda with which she will purchase more drinks to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zaituna hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and home materials for her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own cosmetics shop. Zaituna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her make more of a profit in her business.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Señor Alcides P. cuenta con 28 años de edad, el nos contó que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la elaboración de ladrillos junto con su tío, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un título universitario. 
Luego, con el correr de los tiempos se hizo dueño de una olería (fábrica de ladrillos a base de arcilla que es quemado en un horno), dicho dinero para la compra de la olería lo consiguió trabajando día a día en la oleria de su tío, compro esa olería para poder de esa forma trabajar  y así construir su propia casa donde más tarde se pueda independizar.
   El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un horno más grande, para la producción de ladrillos de modo que pueda aumentar así los ingresos y de esa forma construir su casa propia.
  El señor Alcides agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcides P. is 28 years old. He says as a young man he began working with his uncle manufacturing bricks. In addition, he never had the opportunity to study and earn a college degree.

As time passed, Alcides later became the owner of a factory where bricks are made from clay and baked in an oven. The money he used to buy the factory enabled him to continue working with his uncle on a daily basis. Through his work making bricks, Alcides was able to build his own house and later become independent.

The loan he is requesting will be used to build a larger oven for producing bricks. This will help him increase his income and complete the construction of his house. Sr. Alicides is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to build a larger oven for baking bricks

loans.name: Lisseth Ana

texts.es: Lisseth Tiene 21 años, ella tiene ya 2 años en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, lo cual le permite adquirir una gran ganancia que le sirve para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por lo que solicita el credito para poder compra mas cantidad de productos de belleza, se lo otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias y capacida de pago.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 21 years old and has already been in the business of selling beauty products for two years.  This allows her to earn the majority of the income she needs to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more beauty products.

In order to receive this loan, Lisseth has good references and the ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun K. is 47 years old (was in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Oeun is 46 years odd, have been married since 1986 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of them married and lives outside the family home. One of her children is a garment factory worker and another one attends school. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Soeun K. and her husband are fishermen. They fish from the lake nearby their house and sell to a middleman who comes to buy them at their home. The couple hopes to supplement a new business of raising ducks. They will be able to generate income to better support their family. 

Hence Soeun is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to establish the business.

loans.use: To use for raising ducks.

loans.name: Brenda Cristina

texts.es:
Brenda G. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de alimentos y bebidas como gaseosas y jugos atendidos en su localidad.

A pesar de las dificultades económicas atravesadas, ha logrado mejorar su negocio sacándolo adelante. El crédito que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos entre lo que se encuentra: arroz, frijoles, carne de res, pollo y aceite. Con estos productos logrará preparar los alimentos y así seguir avante en dicho negocio que ha desarrollado.
texts.en: Brenda Garcia has her own business selling food and beverages such as soda and juice in her area. In spite of going through economic difficulties she has succeeded at improving her business and moving it forward. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of raw materials to prepare food, such as rice, beans, beef, chicken and oil. With these products she will be able to prepare food and keep ahead in her business that she has developed.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for food preparation

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of Lahore which is Pakistan’s second largest city, known for its culture. Its history is thousands of years old and it attracts many visitors every year. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area called Khokar Road where she moved many years ago with her family. She is a housewife and spends her time at home and doing her household responsibilities.
