Her husband is a butcher by trade. Naseem’s home is situated in the street near the market and her husband has opened his shop on the corner. He sells chicken meat to his customers. He has been doing this business for many years and people prefer buying meat from his shop due to its freshness and good weight. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will utilize the loan money in buying chickens in bulk to offer better quality fresh meat to his clients. Naseem is hopeful that after this loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and his income will double.

loans.use: To buy chickens in bulk to sell as meat

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old and married with one child who is three years old.  Christine owns a small business selling tomatoes, onion and cooking oil.  These are very common foodstuffs used by all families in Rwanda.  Christine works hard in order to improve her economic situation. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening every day. Christine is very new to this business and has been working in the food market for only eight months.

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more tomatoes and other foodstuffs, which can help her attract more customers. Christine hopes the business will be profitable, as she would like to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Descripción	L El Sr. Herminio  está  casado, tiene tres   hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de bebida en su domicilio  y en el microcentro de C.D.E, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos. 
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para cargar su negocio con muchas variedades de bebidas ya que se quiere preparar para las fiestas de fin de año y aprovechar el gran aumento de la venta de bebidas en esta época.
texts.en:
Herminio is married and has three school-age children.  He sells soft drinks from his home and in Ciudad Del Este's business district.  His drinks business is growing and makes him a good income.

With the help of his wife, Herminio is getting ahead in life through a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  He is a successful small businessman who has a loyal and large customer base owing to his kindness.  He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person in his commitments which is why we must provide him with all the support he needs in his undertakings.

On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to stock his business with many different kinds of drinks since he would like to prepare for the end-of-year party season and take advantage of the large increase in drink sales during this period.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man. He is from Lebanon and is living with his parents and one sibling. He is the only income source for his family. He is experienced in doing women's hair dressing for almost 18 years and in 2005 he opened his own women's hair salon. He purchases his products from a local beauty center. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with on-time repayments. Today he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l  to make needed improvements for his salon to be able to welcome his clients in a suitable place where they can find excellent service.

loans.use: to make the needed improvements for his salon

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Hin S. has been in a farming business for many years. She is a widow woman who lives with her four children. Three of the children are single and one is married. Some sources of her profit come from her three kids who are employed in different occupations. She has no life partner because her husband passed away a long time ago. In addition, Hin S. raises a few pigs behind her house. She requests a loan of $1,100 to purchase small pigs to feed and then sell. By using this loan, she will get more profit and be able to support her family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to feed and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She travels from market to market to earn her living selling tobacco leaves. Her husband Felix, who is 63 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children between 28 and 42. 

Rosalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her tobacco sales business so that she can to save up for her family's future needs and security. Rosalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water pump

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin Antonio tiene 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que ama su trabajo. El se dedica a la venta de oro laminado, hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que para en ese tiempo tenía que mantener a sus 2 hijos, que están a su cargo. El solicita actualmente este financiamiento para capital de trabajo como es oro lamido, plata, oro, pulseras, cadenas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es seguir acondicionando su vivienda que es lo que puede dejarle a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marvin Antonio is 35 years old. He is a hardworking man who loves his job. He sells gold laminate. He has been doing this activity for more than 3 years. He started this business of his own initiative since he had to support his 2 children, whom he is raising. He is asking for this loan at this time for working capital for gold laminate, silver, gold, bracelets, and chains among other things. He wants to continue fixing up his house so that he can leave it to his children.

loans.use: to buy gold laminate, silver, gold and bracelets

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 41, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia.  They live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

She began selling meat and meat products at a local food market in 2002. She started her business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 250,000 MNT. She breeds pigs which she uses for meat. Her business has become more stable and now she has her own regular customers. She is a hardworking person who says, "I am trying to save money for my children and help them to get a good education." 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a car so that her husband will be able to help her with the business by transporting the meat from one place to another.

loans.use: to buy a car for transporting meat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her boyfriend who cuts hair. Beatrice has three children, 12, 6, and 4 -- all are living with her.  Her two oldest children attend school. 

For seven years Beatrice has been cooking and selling pig feet. She started out selling food by the bowl and then later switched to pig feet. Recently, the price of pig feet went up and that has been a challenge for her. Regarding being in business, Beatrice likes to earn her own money and also says that people respect her. 

Beatrice has requested a loan to buy a barrel of pig feet to cook and sell. In the future she would like to buy her own land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of pig feet to cook and sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.es: Joseph B. de 32 años tiene el negocio de alquilar lavadoras  del cual vive y sostiene a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 6 años. Desde hace más de dos años inicio este negocio por la necesidad de tener ingresos para lograr el sustento de su familia, él   comenzó alquilando estas máquinas a unos pocos clientes y gradualmente ha ido ganando un mercado, que hoy genera mayor demanda y Joseph no tiene como responderle,  porque tiene 7 lavadoras que permanecen sirviendo a las amas de casa todos los días ; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento conla Fundación Mario Santo Doming, el cual lo invertirá  en la adquisición de 3 nuevas lavadoras,porque así lo indica la gran acogida que tiene este servicio en el barrio Villanueva donde está establecido. Su meta es crecer como microempresario y adicionar la venta de electrodomésticos, porque su mayor desafío es lograr que sus clientes den un uso cuidadoso a sus máquinas y lograr hacerle  un mantenimiento preventivo permanente para aumentar su vida útil.
texts.en:
Joseph B. is 32 years old and has a business renting washing machines.  This business supports his family, which is made up of his wife and his six year old son.  He started this business two years ago because he needed an income to support his family.  He started renting the machines to a few customers, and gradually has gained a market.  There is a high demand for his products, and Joseph isn't able to respond to the demand because he has seven washing machines that remain to serve the housewives every day.  

This is the reason he is asking for a Kiva loan.  This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to purchase three new washing machines.  This indicates a great success that he will have this service in the Villanueva neighborhood where he is established.  His goal is to grow as a small business owner and expand into appliance sales.  His greatest challenge is to get his customers to use the machines carefully and to do a permanent preventative maintenance to increase their useful life.

loans.use: to purchase three new washing machines.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal Shipibas del Distrito D. calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos mayores D. edad.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, anteriormente contaba con una tienda en uno D. los puertos D. Pucallpa, pero fueron sacados D. ese lugar porque estaban en un lugar prohibido.
Con su nuevo prestamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una caja D. leche chica,2 cajas D. galleta, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 paquetes D. toallas higuienicas,1 bolsa D. lejia, 1 cajas D. conserva, 1 saco D. azucar, 1 racimo D. platano, 5 docenas D. huevo.
Hace unos años quedo viuda y por un buen tiempo estuvo deprimida y se puso mal D. salud, pero se está restableciendo y está volviendo a trabajar, vive sola y su negocio le sirve también para distraerse.
A pesar D. todos sus problemas sigue trabajando con Manuela Ramos y desea hacerlo por mucho más tiempo porque ya es parte D. su vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Shipibas Communal Bank which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has six adult children.

Margarita has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years and has a small store that she manages in her home. She previously had a store at one of the ports in Pucallpa, but she had to move it since it had been situated in a prohibited area.

With her new loan of 3000 PEN, Margarita will buy the following items: one case of small-sized cartons of milk, two cases of cookies, two packets of hand wipes, one case of bleach, one case of preserves, one sack of sugar, one bunch of bananas, and five dozen eggs.

Margarita became a widow a few years ago and spent a good amount of time depressed and in poor health. However, she was able to recover and return to work. She lives alone and her business serves as a distraction. Despite all of her problems, Margarita continues to work with Manuela Ramos and hopes to do so for a long time now that this is part of her life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer trabajadora de 33 años de edad. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres menores hijos en el distrito de Chepén – La Libertad. Esta es considerada una familia cariñosa y unida, donde siempre hay apoyo entre sus miembros.

Santos  se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de artículos de plástico (recipientes, tinas, cestas, bacines, jarras) en la entrada de un mercado de su localidad. Ella ha tenido ganancias con este oficio y es por ello que desea seguir invirtiendo en él.

Santos ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar su mercadería. Comprará más artículos de plástico así como platos, tazas y vasos de loza. Esto le permitirá tener mayores ventas pues ofrecerá más y mejores productos.

Santos es un cliente de nuestra entidad que goza de un buen historial crediticio, este sería su octavo crédito y los anteriores los canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Santos is a hard working woman who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and three minor children in the district of Chepén – La Libertad. It is a loving and close family, where there is always support between its members.

For 7 years, Santos has sold plastic items (containers, tubs, basins, jars) in the entrance of the market of her community.  She has had earnings with this tradde and that is why she wants to keep investing in it. 

Santos has asked Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 1000 nuevos soles that she will use to buy merchandise. She will buy more plastic items, such as plates, cups, and ceramic glasses. This will allow her to have more sales and better products. 

Santos is a client of our agency who has a good credit history. This would be her eighth loan and she paid off the others punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy plastic and ceramic merchandise.

loans.name: Mout

texts.en: Mout, aged 41, is a married woman who lives in Siem Reap Province. She earns her daily income by working as a local farmer in the village as well as selling a few goods in front of her house. She is married to Mmork, aged 35, who shares responsibility for earning income with Mout by driving a motorcycle taxi. He runs his business very well because he has communication skills which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not very much due to his motorcycle being too small to carry many passengers. That is why Mout has decided to ask for a loan of $1100 to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) so that her husband can use it to pick up more passengers than before. She will use part of her loan funds to buy more items to sell. The couple has two children, both are single and live with them.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle (tuk tuk) for her husband and to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 39 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in the Philippines. Charita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods.

Charita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Charita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 48 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 3 children. 

Caridad works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP15,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Caridad has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 11 years. She is 39 years old and married to Benson. She is a mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is her third loan. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and meet labor costs.

Her future dream is to improve her farming by introducing an irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and meet labor costs

loans.name: Diandra

texts.es:
Jose es un joven de 18 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Jose se dedica a la siembra de café. Dice que desde que inició el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Jose es solicitar un préstamo por ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar de más almacigo, fertilizante y mano de obra que necesita para su finca de café. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Jose forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Jose is an 18 year old young man who lives with his family in the community of Costa Rica, called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers to the south of the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. There they grow vegetables and coffee and raise beef cattle and pigs. There are also some organic farming projects and hydrophonic vegetables. In addition to farming there are mechanic's workshops a supermarket, small restaurants and a furniture store. 

For some time, Jose has worked planting coffee. He says that since he started the project, results have been good. It has had a good reception in the community and the income he is generating has helped him get his family ahead.

At this time, what Jose wants is to ask for a loan of ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for the labor he needs for his coffee farm.With this, he hopes that his micro-business will grow and generate more income to improve his quality of life.
  
Jose is a member of the Bancruce Community Bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, he has received a micro-loan which allowed him to grow as a micro-businessman.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for labor at his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella compra maíz al por mayor y lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, widowed, and has three children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling corn. She buys corn in bulk and then sells it at the market in Urubamba between the hours of 6am and 7pm. Through her work, she is able to help her children get ahead. The member wants to expand and improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Zein

texts.en: Zein is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has owned a small shop since 2009 where he sells batteries and rims designed for different types of vehicles. In parallel, he has worked in a local bank since 1995. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. In order to develop his new business, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase electrical tools and supplies needed to help him put in batteries and rims. He is very positive and he is sure that the loan will help him fulfill his business needs.

loans.use: to purchase electrical tools and supplies

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 5, 8 y 14 años de edad, el se dedica a administrar una tienda y un molino de nixtamal, y fue iniciado a través de su madre hace 12 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en productos para la tienda como pan, arroz, maíz, gaseosas, frijoles y sopas instantáneas, el préstamo le ayudara para mantener mejores ventas y aumentar los ingresos de la familia, manteniendo surtido el negocio.
Las aspiraciones de él es que a través de préstamos pueda desarrollarse y ofrecer un mejor servicio a la clientela, también en su familia espera que la calidad de vida sea mejor.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and three children, aged 5, 8 and 14  years old.  He works managing a store and a corn mill.  He started in this 12 years ago, and was introduced to it by his mother.  He works from Monday through Sunday.

He is requesting a loan to invest in products for his store, such as bread, rice, corn, sodas, beans and instant soups.  The loan will help him keep up his strong sales and grow his family income by keeping his business fully stocked.

His hopes are that through the loans he can develop his business and provide a better service to his customers.  He also hopes that his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy household goods: bread, rice, corn, sodas, beans and soups.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 42 years old. She has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for five months. Within these months of her existing business, she has usually encountered a lack of food for her pigs. So when she learned about Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc., she was very happy because this organization will help her in growing her pigs.

She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy enough feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She knows it could provide better nourishment to her pigs; that will give her a higher income. This would be a big help to her in financing the education of her five children. 

At the age of 42, she is still hopeful to uplift her family from poverty through her hard work and strong determination. Hopefully, their pain will end and they will overcome the poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy enough feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de joyería y artesanía, ella vende collares, aretes y pulseras, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 
7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de joyería y venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar collares, pulseras, aretes y artesanía como chompas, polos, pantalones y muñecas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the “Kanchary" communal bank. The members live in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. 

Rosario is 46, single, and has one son.  In addition to her daily activities, she has a business selling jewellery and crafts. She sells necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. She sells on her own from 8:00am to 7:00pm, and by means of this business, she is raising her child.  

She wants to expand the business of selling jewellery and crafts. She is asking for the loan in order to buy at wholesale: necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and crafts such as sweaters, polo shirts, pants, and dolls. She is happy to get the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy at wholesale: necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and crafts such as sweaters, polo shirts, pants, and dolls.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 46 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  He is a farmer from the Zovreti, Imereti Region in the western part of the country. 

Vladimer leads his family's agricultural business. Specifically, they have three milk cows. Vladimer and his mother produce cheese and other dairy products and sell them in Zestaponi, a nearby town. Along with the dairy farm the family owns a 2000-square-meter vineyard. They sell grapes in the Zestaponi market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris, including the pensions of Vladimer’s parents. 

Vladimer is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase a milk cow. The family will be able to sell more dairy products and raise their income. Part of the increase in income will be reinvested in farming activities and the rest will be used for improving the family's living conditions

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción, tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella actualmente vive con su esposo y cuatro nietos, ya tiene dos años D. administrar su tienda, cuenta Concepción que aprendió el negocio por pura necesidad. Su esposo se dedicaba a la venta D. frutas y verduras D. manera ambulante, pero esta Ella vio la situación por la que estaban pasando y le nace la inquietud D. iniciar una tienda, por lo que, le comento a su esposo y este le dijo que solo tenia disponible 140 dólares, y así comenzó a comprar y ha invertir en su tienda hasta que creció.

Para adquirir los productos que venD., Concepción debe caminar a pie unos cinco minutos, para abordar un autobús que se tarda una hora, para llegar a su destino y luego se traslada a su casa con la mercadería.

Ella solicita un préstamo, para comprar: 600 libras D. maíz, 100 libras D. fríjol, 200 libras D. arroz, 5 galones D. aceite, 8 cajas D. jabón, 10 cartones D. huevos, 100 libras D. papas, 300 huevos, tres docenas D. lejía, tomates, etc. D. esta manera, ella comprara a mejor precio, ya que será al por mayor y tendrá la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ganancias y obtener sus productos a buen precio. 

Con esta compra, ella satisfacera la demanda D. sus clientes, ya que, hay productos que estos buscan y ella no los tiene disponibles, al mismo tiempo le permitirá mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

La señora Concepción, desea sacar adelante a su familia, ella ahorra para comprar un terreno y construir su casa, porque en la actualidad viven en casa D. un familiar; también, desea en un futuro instalar un mini súper.
texts.en:
Concepción is 47 years old and married with two children. 

She currently lives with her husband and four grandchildren.  Concepción says she learnt the business out of pure necessity.  Her husband used to be a mobile fruit and vegetable seller.  On considering their situation, Concepción felt an urge to open a store, which she mentioned to her husband.  He told her he had only $140 to spare and this is how she began to buy produce and to invest in her store until it grew. 

In order to buy the products she sells, Concepción must walk five minutes to catch a bus, which takes one hour to reach her destination.  She then travels home with her goods.

She is asking for a loan to buy: 600 pounds of corn, 100 pounds of kidney beans, 200 pounds of rice, 5 gallons of oil, 8 boxes of soap, 10 cartons of eggs, 100 pounds of potatoes, 300 eggs, three dozen bottles of bleach, tomatoes etc.  By buying in bulk, she will be able to get her products at the best price, and she will have the opportunity to better her earnings and to get her products at a good price. 

With this purchase, she will be able to meet her client demand, as there are products that they want which she does not have available.  At the same time she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. 

Concepción wants to help her family get ahead.  She is saving to buy a plot of land and to build a house, because they currently live in a family member's house.  She also hopes one day to set up a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to buy 600 pounds of corn, 100 pounds of kidney beans, 200 pounds of rice, 5 galons of oil, 8 boxes of soap, 10 cartons of eggs, 100 pounds of potatoes, 300 eggs, three dozen bottles of bleach, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca de 61 años de edad, es soltera por viudez desde hace 15 años, tiene 6 hijos de 9,16, 18,19, 22 y 24 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural de Santa cruz de Yojoa.

Tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y café, tiene una manzana de cultivo y la producción la vende en el mercado local, la mayor parte llegan los compradores a su casa. Esta finca se la dejo su esposo y es bien administrada por ella y sus hijos, dedicándole el tiempo necesario al cultivo.
Este es el sexto préstamo y los a utilizado para la siembra y mantenimiento de la finca de café y cultivo de maíz y frijoles.  A logrado tecnificar mas su finca y cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijos.
Su meta es mejorar el cultivo para sacar buenas cosechas y poder arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 61 years old and single for the last 15 years due to widowhood .  She has six children who are 9, 16, 18, 19, 22 and 24 years old.  She lives in a rural village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

She’s been farming for 30 years.  She grows corn, beans and coffee.  She has a manzana [Central American land measure] of farmland and she sells her crops in the local market; most of her buyers come to her home to buy.  Her husband left her the farm and it’s well managed by her and her children; they dedicate the necessary time to the crops.

This is the sixth loan and she’s used them for coffee, corn and bean crops maintenance.  She has managed to increase the technology level in her farm and cover the educational expenses of her children.  Her goal is to improve the crops to have good harvests and be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.

location.town: La Boquita, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 59 years old, and has two children in school.  Fe has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for making fishing nets. Fe has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann used her first loan amount to buy a motorbike and it has been earning her a good income.

She repaid the loan amount well and in good time. This will be her second loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy another motorcycle.

In the future, Ann plans to invest more in the transport industry by buying passenger service vehicles and become one of the leading businesswomen in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for her transportation business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in Baga within the municipality of Panaon, a part of Misamis Occidental province. She is married with five children. Gina operates a general store and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for two years and is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Gina hopes to send her children to school and help them obtain their college degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Kimhong

texts.en:
Kimhong, 36, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Kimhong sells fish and her husband is a security guard of a private company. 

Kimhong is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to rent a stand at the market to sell fish. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 52 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a bundle of maize flour and a sack of sugar.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of maize flour and a sack of sugar

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
 
Rowena has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Vincent is married, and has twenty children. He has been farming for forty years, and is currently farming maize and soya beans, as well as tending to a tree plantation and rearing chickens on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because he believes that honey is medicinal, and will also give him another income source. 

This is Vincent's first loan, and he plans to use the incomes generated by his beehives to buy a dairy cow. When asked about his hopes for the future, Vincent says he wants "my children to have high education."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2012.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture.

Ndougou qui se trouve au centre de la photo et levant la main droite,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée,elle est âgée de 62 ans et a 08 enfants.Son activité consiste à cultiver du riz,du mil et du mais.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience par rapport à ce type d'agriculture qu'elle pratique depuis sa jeunesse,elle arrive à écouler sa production dans les marchés environnants son village.

Ainsi avec le prêt,elle compte acheter des semences et une brebis en vue de l'élever et de la revendre par la suite.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2012.  All the members of the group come from the same village, and they all work in agriculture.

Ndougou (in the centre of the photo with her right hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 62 years old, married and has eight children.  She works cultivating rice, millet and maize.  She has a lot of experience in this type of agriculture as she has done this work since her youth.  She sells her produce in the markets around her village.

Ndougou will use her loan to buy seeds and a sheep, which she will raise and then resell.  Her aim is to improve the level of her savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, millet and maize seed and a sheep for resale.

loans.name: Budri

texts.en:
Budri is 37 years old and lives in a very small village of Koraput district, Odisha, with her husband and two children. She has managed a chicken-rearing activity for the past five years. The chickens when they breed are then sold for chicken and eggs. 

Budri is requesting her first loan for 35,000 INR to buy additional chicks, feed and medicine and to construct a brooder so she can expand her business. She will then be able to help her husband by contributing to the family income, which in turn will help them build a secure future together. She is very happy to have this loan and would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks, feed and medicine and to construct a brooder so she can expand her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and 4 go to school. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years; she works seven days a week. Mariam has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy beef, flour,tomatoes,beans,bunches of green bananas ,sugar. Mariam's major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also start providing outside catering.

loans.use: To buy beef, flour,tomatoes,beans,bunches of green bananas ,sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would want to buy sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Oloo

texts.en: T. Oloo is a 43 year-old entrepreneur.  She lives in the Nyamasaria slums in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and three children.  She started her business in 1995 and deals in assorted commodities such as grains and daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil, and soap. She also sells charcoal in small quantities. The picture was taken while T. was selling charcoal to her customers. She used the funds from her first two loans to set up a small kiosk adjacent to the local market. She plans to use the loan, if awarded, to move her business into a larger space and a more lucrative location.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Elvia Teresa

texts.en:
Elvia is 23 years old and has five children. She has 4 years of experience in business. At this point, she has just 1 animal. Her goal is to have 10 to 15 pigs. She uses 2 bags of feed ($200 each) to fatten and raise them. She has a lot of faith in achieving her goal with this loan, so she can help with her children's education and in supporting her home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elvia tiene23 años y cinco hijos.Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el negocio , en estos momentos tiene 1 sólo animal, su meta es llegar a tener 10 a 15 puercos.Utiliza 2 bolsas de alimento( $200 c/u ) para el engordamiento y la crianza.Tiene mucha fé en lograr su meta con este prestamo y de esa forma colaborar con la educación de sus hijos y colaborar en el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a widow and has two daughters ages 18 and 25. She started her business 5 years ago to help support them. At first it was to help her husband with the household expenses, but later she was left alone to care for her family. She began selling cosmetics and later expanded to sell clothing and shoes, which have been more successful. With this work she has supported her daughters so that they can continue with their studies and hope for a better future.

Gregoria now needs a loan for US$925 to purchase seasonal merchandise which she hopes will boost her sales and grow her business. She commits to repay the loan within 6 months. You can be an important part of Gregoria’s success and help her daughters finish their education. They all thank you sincerely for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Gregoria es viuda y tiene dos hijas de 18 y 25 años de edad, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual inició su negocio hace cinco años, primero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y después porque quedó sola a cargo de su familia. Empezó a vender cosméticos y fue incorporando la venta de ropa y calzado con lo que ha tenido mejores resultados, de esta manera es como ha apoyado a sus hijas para que continúen estudiando, porque ella quiere que sus hijas puedan concluir sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Gregoria necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía de temporada con lo que espera darle ese impulso que necesita su negocio y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Gregoria y ayuda a que sus hijas puedan finalizar sus estudios, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio is 37. He and Carmen, 35, have four children between the ages of 8 and 17. His oldest son helps him with his daily chores. Atanacio didn't have the opportunity to go to school; he completed only the sixth grade, because his family was poor. He says that he has a plot where he grows an assortment of vegetables, including lettuce, chard, broccoli, cauliflower, and parsley. He began working when he was very young on his parents' farm, but he struck out on his own twelve years ago and today has his own farm that generates adequate income. He gets up early every day to travel to the market, near the capital, where he sells his produce. With much sacrifice and effort, he was able to pull together the money to buy a pick-up truck, which is now indispensable in his work. He would use the loan to buy needed supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

loan of Atanacio tiene 37 años, vive en pareja con Carmen que tiene 35 años de edad. Tienen 4 hijos de entre 17 y 8 años. El mayor de sus hijos ya le ayuda en sus labores diarias. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, solamente hizo hasta el 6to. año de la primaria, debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde. Comenta que tiene una huerta en donde cultiva todo tipo de hortalizas como ser: lechuga, acelga, brócoli, coliflor, perejil, etc. Comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeño en la huerta de sus padres pero hace 12 años que se independizó y hoy día tiene su propio cultivo que le genera muy buenas ganancias. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para trasladarse hasta el mercado de abasto de la ciudad capital para comercializar sus productos. Con mucho sacrifico y esfuerzo logró reunir dinero para comprarse una camioneta que hoy día es un instrumento de trabajo indispensable para el mismo. En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos que utiliza en sus cultivos como ser: abono, semillas e insecticidas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah N. is 35 and married with four children and two dependents. She sells lumber. In Uganda, lumber is generally rough sawn just on the outskirts of town and brought to the lumber ards by truck. Lumber is sold by small businesses. The sizes generally are: 2 x 4’s, posts and 1 x 10’s. With just those materials one can construct a small building with siding. 

Hadijah has been selling lumber for two years and has belonged to her lending group for  seven years. With her loan, Hadijah will expand her business by building up her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Affectionately nick-named Mama Bright, which literally means ‘the mother of Bright’, in reference to her 1 year-old son Bright, Veronika P. is certainly bright and creative. She established a business making and selling African batik cloth earlier this year and now generates a profit of approximately $100 per month. She requires a loan of $300 to expand her business by purchasing additional cloth and dye.

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Veronica would like to purchase additional cloth and dye for her batik business.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a single mother who supports her family with a small market business selling children’s toys. Irina’s business is located at an outdoor market in the city of Energodar in southern Ukraine near the beautiful Dnepr River. She has been self-employed for ten years and loves what she does. Her business has been a good source of income for her and her family and she’d like to continue developing it in the future.

Irina has requested a loan of $1000 so that she can purchase new toy inventory and continue to attract customers to her little kiosk. This is Irina’s sixth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to continue helping her operate a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little toy kiosk

loans.name: Upper Kawugab(2061) D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hanifa K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her inventory. Hanifa is 40 years old and is married with one child, aged 20. Her child goes to school. Each week, Hanifa makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.

Hanifa is joined in her small group by Christine M., Jennifer K., Sylvia N., and Prossy N.. Christine M. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to increase her stock. Jennifer K. is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more shoes for sale. Sylvia N. is currently in the business of running a bar/pub and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy a fridge. Prossy N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: To re-invest in the businesses

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 27 years old. He lives and works in Bekaa, Lebanon. Ali owns a pharmacy. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, Ali would like to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sustain and develop his business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is the mother of seven children. She has been selling various items in Obuasi for the last three years. In addition to selling gari (fried cassava), cassava, and soda, she makes a type of strong laundry soap called Azuma Blow. (Azuma is the name of a famous Ghanaian boxer whose punches are legendary for their strength, hence an appropriate name for a laundry soap.)

Margaret plans to use the loan to buy additional products in Kumasi, the nearby large town. She will use the profits from her business to help pay for her children’s school fees.

Margaret is a member of the trust group Exodus. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy gari, cassava, and soda in Kumasi

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida Baji, wife of Mr. T., has been married for 30 years. She has four daughters and one son. All are being educated at a local school near their residence. Shahida is a  housewife and her husband used to be  a Senior Assistant Clerk in a bank. Then her husband retired and took the “Golden Hand Shake” ( a type of award received upon voluntary retirement) from the government.   With the award money he bought three cars and started a car rental business. In addition, her husband also runs a Public Call Office (called a PCO) and a shop where he makes photocopies and binds books.  Shahida needs a loan to purchase a new photocopier and paper and toner for her husband’s shop.

loans.use: To expand a photocopy shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, 25, is single and lives with his mother. He worked in his father's glass business from a young age and took over the business when his father died. He still operates the glass business along with a carpentry business that he just bought. He wants to make furniture that he will later sell in the interior of the country.

Juan wants to buy a store on the main street of Caaguazu so that he can set his business up there. He's applying for a loan to buy wood to make "roperos" (stand-alone closets or armoires).

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Juan M. de 25 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente esta viviendo con su Madre. El sr. Juan desde pequeño trabajaba en la vidriaría de su Padre, cundo falleció su padre el quedo al frente del negocio. Actualmente esta trabajando en su vidriaría y también acaba de comprarse una carpintería donde desea fabricar mubles para su posterior venta en el interior del país.

Como sueño personal desea comprar un local en la avenida principal de Caaguazú para poner allí su negocio. El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas para la fabricación de roperos.

loans.use: Buy different kinds of wood for furniture-making business.

loans.name: March

texts.en: Mrs. March K. is a farmer who lives in Chrork Sangkai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Tip Sun, is a house construction worker and they have four children, one of whom is attending school while the others are of preschool age. The family lives in poor conditions in a very old house, so in order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. March K. is requesting a loan to combine with her savings  to build a new house to replace the old one. Previously, she obtained $150 from AMK to buy household equipment to use in daily life.

loans.use: To help build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Isauro

texts.es:
Isauro started his business because from a young age, he learned bricklaying. He started out as his uncle’s assistant approximately 5 years ago. Somebody then asked him to do some brickwork, so he decided to work for himself because the income he received from his uncle was not sufficient. With this job, he was able to save money and purchase his own tools, and with the support of the microloans, he has been able to excel.

He needs a loan of $375.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can purchase work materials. With your help, he will make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Isauro inició el negocio desde muy joven ya había aprendido el oficio de la albañilería, comenzó siendo ayudante de su tío hace aproximadamente 5 años, una persona le solicito un trabajo de albañilería y el decido realizarlo por su cuenta, ya que la paga que obtenía a través de su tío no era suficiente, y con ese trabajo junto para comprar sus herramienta y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha logrado sobre salir.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo. Con tu ayuda el hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase bricklaying materials

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 50 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 20 and 3 years old. She is a bites seller. Every day, she works at her business so that she can earn.

Amina now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gloria G. es una dama muy esforzada ya que siempre ha llevado el pan diario a su mesa para beneficiar a su pequeño hijo y lo hace por medio de su ardua labor de venta de cosméticos en el municipio Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día la señora Gloria ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual lo ha utilizado para la compra de los cosméticos. Una vez más ha solicitado el apoyo ya que requiere comprar de sus proveedores dichos productos. Según comenta continuara con estos créditos para mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria G. is a hard-working woman who has always put the daily food on the table for her small son, and she does this by means of her arduous efforts selling cosmetic products in the Sandino City municipality in Managua.

These days, Gloria has managed to get ahead thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel which she has used for the purchase of the cosmetics. Once again, she has solicited the support she needs to buy said products from her suppliers. She comments that she will continue with the loans in order to improve her family’s financial situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida baji is the wife of M. A. B. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a medical store as salesmen. Her elder daughter is in 8th standard. Her younger daughter is in 7th standard.

Farida baji’s husband is an electrician by profession. Farida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy medicines because her elder son wants to open his own medical store.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Kosar baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy garments to re-sell. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles for her spare-parts shop. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy goods (snacks, biscuits) for her canteen.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines to open a pharmaceutical store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Albert has been living in Barangay Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabela since he was born. The people in their community are bonded with unity and cooperation which is manifested through helping each other in times of crisis. Specifically, corn and rice are the primary agricultural products of the people because of the area’s rich agricultural lands.  Albert is married and has  two (2) healthy children  for which he is very thankful for.

Albert is engaged in buying and selling of domestic animals like carabao (water buffalo), cow, pig, and goat. Using his motorcycle, he transported these animals to the nearby province and then sold them at relatively higher prices. The nature of his business requires additional working capital but he just requested Php 5,000 for a start. Such an amount is big enough to add up to his revolving capital. He works hard and strives to improve his business in order to achieve his goals in life. His ultimate goal is for his family to be freed from poverty. 

He believes in the essence of strong family ties and dreams to provide a good education for his two children.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Née à Tsévié en 1949, Madame K. Adjoa est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Résident à Aného depuis 32 ans, le commerce de farine de manioc et du poisson est sa principale activité. Son ancienneté dans la profession lui confère une expérience de bonne gestionnaire. Dynamique et sérieuse, son activité lui rapporte beaucoup et l’aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Voulant renforcer son activité par l’achat des produits en gros dans les zones de production, elle sollicite un crédit. Le revenu qu’elle va en tirer servira à mieux assurer les besoins de sa famille pour son plein épanouissement.
texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1949, Mrs. Adjoa K. is married and the mother of 4 children. She has lived in Aného for 32 years. She sells manioc flour and fish as her main business. The fact that she has been involved in this business for such a long time shows she has lots of management experience in her business.

Dynamic and serious, she gets a lot out of her business and it helps her to cover the needs of her family. She would now like to bolster her business by buying her products wholesale where they are produced, so she is asking for a loan. The income that it will bring her will help her better support her family so that they can flourish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling manioc flour

loans.name: Ester J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Ester M. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because her parents cannot take care of her. 

Ester has been running a business selling crops since 1997. Her business is to purchase maize, beans, rice and wheat from villages and sell them in town at higher price. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Ester currently earns about 300USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more maize, rice, wheat and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Ester thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, rice, wheat and beans in bulk

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia S. is 49 years old and married to Leonardo, who is a tricycle operator and also serves as one of the Barangay councilors in their village. The couple works together and they keep on striving for their family. Arsenia also serves as an active leader of a women's organization in their village.

They are blessed with six children: Hazel, a 27-year-old college graduate; Marilou, a 25-year-old college graduate; Cheryl, a 21-year-old college undergraduate; Erwin, an 18-year-old college student; Katrina, a 16-year-old who is still in the fourth year of high school; and Sugar Ray, who is 13 years old and in the first year of high school. The two eldest daughters, Hazel and Marilou, are already married.

Arsenia is requesting a loan of $150 for her village store business. The loan will be used to improve her store to sustain their daily living and continue sending her children to school until they finish college.

Arsenia wants to become a successful entrepreneur and be a role model to other small entrepreneurs in their village. Arsenia said that her dream will come true by treasuring time because it is as precious as gold--it is the most important factor in any kind of business. She knows that she needs to work hard and learn to spend less.

loans.use: Improvement of her store

loans.name: Sok Vy

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Vy C. is a villager in Chhrek Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Sout Leap, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he has an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy farm supplies to support his field. Mrs. Sok Vy C. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 34-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child. Mohamed has been working as a painter for fifteen years. He paints houses and furniture.

Mohamed requested a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When Mohamed first started his business, he didn’t have any difficulty. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro L. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera esté es su negocio y tiene ya mas de ocho años con este oficio. Pero le está haciendo falta una maquina especial para la madero y no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para realizar la comprar de la maquina que está necesitando, y así poder elaborar los muebles que tiene pendientes de entregar.
texts.en:
Alejando L. has been in the business of making wooden furniture for over eight years. He is missing a special woodworking machine but doesn't have enough money to buy it himself. He is therefore looking to obtain a loan that will let him buy the machine he needs to fulfill outstanding furniture orders.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a woodworking machine

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Махмадаминов Хасан житель города Яван. Женат и имеет десятерых детей. занимается животноводством , а так же производством муки. Имеет минимельницу , где производит муку. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы. Переработав его в муку сможет продать и получить прибыль.Таким образом он будет иметь оборотную сумму , которая даст возможность зарабатывать деньги.
texts.en:
M. Hasan is a resident of the city of Yavan. He is married and has ten children. He raises livestock and also makes flour. He has a mini-mill where he produces flour. Hasan plans to get credit in order to purchase wheat grain. After processing it into flour he will be able to sell it and earn a profit. This way he will have working capital that will allow him to earn money.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 863, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y son su gran orgullo.

Diomith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchos tropiezos en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de la línea Unique, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Además se desempeña como Directora de su propia red de consultoras en diferentes Distritos y se siente muy capaz y eficiente como mujer, ya que  personalmente incentiva  a su red de consultoras.

Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo mas vitrinas para exhibir  sus productos.

Diomith, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Diomith belongs to the Virgen de la Inmaculada community bank. She lives at Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 863, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 39, married, and has two dependent children who are her great pride. Diomith is a woman who has been able to overcome many bumps in the road of her life. The desire to get ahead has given her good results. The business she runs makes her feel happy for what she has achieved. She started selling cosmetics from the Unique line. Her business is still ongoing. She is also the director of her own network of consultants in different districts. She feels very capable and efficient as a woman. She personally motivates her network of consultants. With a loan for 3,000 PEN she wants to stock beauty products like perfume for women and men, creams, compact powder, lipstick, and nail polish. She would also like to buy more display cases to show her products. Diomith, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women who start a business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for her stock (perfume, creams, nail polish, etc.)

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: A sus 20 años, Yovana tiene la necesidad de trabajar para pagar sus estudios técnicos, vive en la casa de un tío, quien la apoya desde que llegó a Juliaca de su natal Arapa (Pueblo del departamento de Puno) y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Siendo todavía joven, ha puesto en marcha un negocio que le está dando buenos resultados, tiene un restaurante, el cual es muy concurrido por los comensales de su barrio, la sazón que le pone a sus comidas y la amable atención que brinda, son las principales armas con las que cuenta para atraer a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y escuchar los halagos que recibe de algunos clientes, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que atender sola a toda la gente que asiste a su restaurante. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su negocio crezca y que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, para así poder salir adelante. Es el primer  préstamo al que accede Yovana con MFP, espera no tener problemas en pagar todas sus cuotas, en su banco comunal le tienen mucha confianza, ya que es una de las socias más serias y cumplidas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, incrementará la cantidad de sillas y mesas de su negocio, para poder atender a más personas.
texts.en:
At 20 years old, Yovana needs to work to pay for her technical studies. She lives in the house of an uncle who has supported her since she arrived in Juliaca from her native Arapa (Department of Puno). What she would like most is to forge a good future. Still young, she has started a business that is giving good results. She has a restaurant that is very popular for meals in her neighborhood. The seasonings that she puts on her food and the friendly service that she offers are her principal means of attracting customers. What she likes best is to cook and hear the compliments that she receives from her customers. She has worked in this for one year, and the most difficult for her is to have to alone serve everyone that comes to the restaurant. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and improve her income so that she can get ahead. This is the first loan that Yovana has taken with the MFP. She expects to have no problem making her payments. In her community bank, she is trusted as a serious and accomplished member. With the 800 Nuevos Soles ($275 USD), she will increase the amount of chairs and tables in her business to be able to serve more people.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi owns a restaurant where she sells cooked food, drinks and sachet (polythene-bagged) water. She opens her shop from Monday to Saturday from 5 a.m. when she starts cooking until 6 p.m when she closes.

Ngozi is 40 years old and married with six children. She is requesting the loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Success

texts.en:
Success A. is married and her husband is a petty trader. She has received tertiary education.

Success sells a variety of provisions in Tsakpe New Town. She has been selling provisions since 2001 and uses her income in helping her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of the provisions to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit in her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more of the provisions to sell

loans.name: Laurinda Joao

texts.pt:
Laurinda João Objana C. nasceu no distrito de Magude (190 km a norte de Maputo) de 39 anos de idade e mãe de duas filhas sendo a mais velha com 9 anos e estando a estudar numa das escolas na cidade de Matola.

Maria concluiu a 12 classe e espera ingressar no superior logo que estabilizar a sua situação social (ter a casa própria completa). actualmente é separado e vive com as filhas e envia dinheiro para as suas irmãs que se encontram na cidade de maputo, ainda sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu de Magude juntamente com seus pais no ano de 1973 para Boane e em 1994 passou ao vizinho distrito de Moamba em missão se serviço e tendo depois regressado a Matola para se formar como docente. Actualmente é professora na Escola Primaria do trevo onde trabalha e vive a mais de 12 anos numa casa alugada, somente com suas filhas.
Tem um salário mensal no valor de 4.432,00MT que aplica no sustento da sua família.
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas de serviço e tendo aproximado e solicitar este seu primeiro credito no valor de 10.500,00MT para compra de materiais de construção. Espera pagar sem problemas para poder construir a sua própria casa, tomando mais empréstimos
texts.en:
Laurinda Joao Objana C. was born in the district of Magude (190km north of Maputo) she is 39 years old and has 2 daughters, the oldest is 9 years old and they study at a school in Matola. Maria finished the 12th grade and expects to enter higher education when the social situation stabilizes (when her own house is finished), currently she is separated and lives with her daughters and sends money to her sisters who are in the city of Maputo, who are under her responsibility. She left Magude with her parents back in 1973 to Boane and in 1994 went to the district of Moamba in a mission, then she went back to Matola to study to be a teacher. She is currently a teacher at a Primary school in Trevo where she has been working and leaving for the past 12 years at a rented house with her daughters. She has a monthly salary of 4,432MT that uses to support her family. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from coworkers and came to request her first loan for 10,500MT to buy construction materials. She expects to pay without problems to request more loans to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Hubertine

texts.fr: Cette dame ayant 02 personnes à charge et mariée exerce depuis 2003 dans le marché d’Adidogomé à Lomé le commerce de céréales, plus précisément les sacs de maïs. Elle sollicite vivement un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de maïs et pour lui permettre aussi de couvrir ses frais de transport.Elle compte beaucoup sur son expérience pour faire fructifier ce prêt.
texts.en:
Having two persons to support, this married lady has been doing commerce in grains at the Adidogomé marketplace in Lomé since 2003. She trades in sacks of corn to be exact. She is eagerly seeking a loan from WAGES for buying 25 sacks of corn and also for enabling her to cover the transport costs. She is counting very much on her experience for this loan to yield a profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Tserenbaljir

texts.en: Tserenbaljir O. is a 30 year old businessman who lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Four years ago, he got married and built own house inside his yard. His wife used to work at sausage making workshop and now is at home, taking care of their 2 month old daughter. Tserenbaljir graduated from an art university and used to work as a music teacher at secondary school #20. Since 2006, he has run a taxi-driving business. As  result  of his hard work, he owns two cars. He drives one of the cars himself, while he leases the second for 150,000 (approx. $ 104 USD) tugrugs per month.  He earns between 15,000-20,000 ( approx. $10-14 USD) tugrugs per day from his taxi business. Tserenbaljir plays the morin khuur,  a mongolian traditional two- stringed musical instrument, and  he plans to work as a musician some day in the future. Tserenbaljir  is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (approx. $690 USD) loan to purchase tires for his vehicles and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his vehicles and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She sells all types of medicines and has been in the medicine business for the past 12 years. She hopes to receive a loan for N150,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Desididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Desididas lo integran tres mujeres luchadoras e ingeniosas del barrio Camilo Ortega ellas son Yolanda S., Claudia G. y Elizabeth O.. La coordinadora de este grupo es constante, trabajadora y  sagaz, ella es Yolanda del Carmen S. de 60 años.

Esta señora tiene una diversidad en cuanto a su negocio ella vende cajeta, dulces tradicionales, pasteles, churros, comida, carne entre otros. Todo comenzó con la venta de carne y luego fue variando en cuanto a los productos que realiza y comercializa, actualmente desea invertir en la venta de sopa  y desea en un futuro no muy lejano tener una pulpería.

Las otras dos integrantes son Claudia Leticia G. de 32 años quien destaza cerdo y vende nacatamales, un plato típico nicaragüense y Elizabeth del Carmen O. de 41 vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Desididas Group is comprised of three clever women who are born fighters. Yolanda S., Claudia G., and Elizabeth O. are from the Camilo Ortega neighborhood. Yolanda del Carmen S., 60, is the coordinator of this group. She is loyal, hard-working, and astute. She sells diverse items like caramel, traditional sweets, cakes, churros, meals, and meat among other things. Everything started with the sale of meat. Then she started selling a variety of products. She currently wants to invest in selling soup. In the near future she wants to have a mini market. Claudia Leticia G., another member, is 32. She butchers pork and sells “nacatamales”, a typical Nicaraguan dish. Elizabeth del Carmen O., a member, is 41. She sells cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, meat, corn and vegetables to make soup and other things

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Mrs. Chreb C. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phin Ya, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. For this plantation, they need some money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support their rice field. Thus, Mrs. Chreb C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she hopes to increase her income.  She is 43 years old and the mother of five children. Two of them are employed in a garment factory, one is a motorbike taxi driver and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Justina Alberta

texts.es: Justina es una señora casada y cuenta con 47 años de edad, tiene su casa que es propia, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas. Su actividad es la del el transporte por parte del esposo con 23 años de experiencia en el rubro, en la cual su esposa le ayuda en la administración de los ingresos.
