Tiene competencia porque el área de trabajo es una ciudad donde hay bastante movimiento y sobre todo vehicular. El destino del crédito fue para compra de equipo además de capital de inversión. Cuenta con buena experiencia crediticia en Agrocapital el presente préstamo es el cuarto en la institución.
texts.en:
Justina is 47 years old, and lives in her own home along with her husband and three daughters. Her husband has been in the transportation field for 23 years and she has helped him keep the books. They have competition because the area in which they work is a city where there is a lot of movement, particularly vehicular movement. This loan will be used to purchase equipment. She has a good credit history with “Agrocapital” and this will be her forth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Equipment

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 22-year-old S.’s daily routine, something she and her husband learned to do from a grandmother. Her husband appears in the photograph because she was not available that day. S.'s husband also takes time to climb palm trees to tap juice, so she is requesting a loan to purchase a palm step for him to climb the trees.

loans.use: To purchase a palm step for her husband to climb palm trees

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra Maria Beatriz junto con su esposo tienen una venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza. ubicado en el barrio Los olivos , cuentan con casa propia y tiene 3 hijos que estan en el colegio.   La Sra Maria beatriz tambien trabaja como maestra en un colegio turno noche. Solicitaron el credito para surtir su venta ya que llega la epoca de vacaciones y se entregara por completo a este negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Beatriz and her husband have a store in the neighborhood of Los Olivos where they sell groceries and beauty products. They live in their own home and have three children attending high school. Sra. Maria Beatriz also teaches night classes at the high school level. She is requesting a loan to restock her store for the holiday season and plans to devote herself completely to this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a married woman and a mother of 4 children, a guardian to 2 orphans and also the breadwinner of her family. She runs a business selling eggs and fish on the veranda of her friends retail shop. She started her business in 2007. 

Mary requires Kshs 30,000 to  restock her fish business and  save part of the loan for future needs. She admits her living standards have improved and that the business is doing well. As a result she is thinking of expanding her current business.

loans.use: Improve her fish business

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al P. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  He is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Al owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Al has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Al joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Al has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Al is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Al from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sale.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa A. is a 43-year-old mother who cares for her three children, all of whom look to her for support. Her husband is a laborer who also makes doormats. To help support the family, she started a business making and selling doormats. 

Leonisa applied for a second loan to buy an assortment of raw materials for her business such as cotton, flannel and other supplies. In the future, Leonisa hopes to open a stall where she can fill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house to live in and a happy family to live with.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of raw materials such as cotton, flannel and other supplies

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha has worked as a home-based tailor since 1997. She is the mother of one child and started her small business to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her child’s schooling. She cooperates with her husband to make their hard life situation better. In addition to tailoring, she also repairs clothes upon request of clients.

Today, Maha is requesting $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine for her business to replace her old one to offer a good quality of work to her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Enjeru Group 1, Kyenjojo

texts.en: C. George who appears in the small photo is also in the big photo and is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is 40 years old and married with five children aged 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years. He also takes care of more dependants. George has been a farmer in Enjeru Iraara for five years. Although his business is mostly affected by the fluctuating prices, he is able to make between 50,000/= and 100,000/= profits a week. He is grateful for the financial support from Pearl Microfinance because he is able to invest more into his business, hence more profits. He works so hard to ensure that he becomes famous in the market for the quality produce that he sells and for having a respectable family. He needs a loan to be able to buy more fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Nubia de los Santos Sáenz vende agua y gaseosas en la parada de buses León Managua desde las 6 am y finaliza a las 5pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra productos como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, cola shale y cosadehorno. Así para realizar mayor venta y tener más ganancia para el sustento de su familia.

 La Señora Sáenz esta muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por que ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nubia de los Santos Sáenz sells water and soft drinks in the León Managua bus station from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m.

She seeks this loan to purchase more products like soft drinks, juices, bottled waters, cola, and baked goods so that she can have better sales and higher earnings to sustain her family.

Ms. Sáenz is very satisfied with the support that Ceprodel has afforded her and helped her grow her business and improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various soft drinks, juices, colas, bottled waters, and baked goods.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, aged 48 years, is the mother of three children. She is bread winner for her family and lives in a two-roomed rented house with her children.

Margret has a retail shop business in Masindi, Uganda and has operated her business for eighteen years. She first operated in an open space in the market and later shifted to a shop as the business grew.

This is Margret’s first loan from HOFOKAM and she will use the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 55 years old. Alicia is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 19-year-old young woman. She is married and lives with her husband. She and her husband are both working to support their household. She has an undergarment and lingerie shop in her home. She has been selling goods from her home since 2007. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her inventory. 

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering micro-loans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Increase inventory for her store
